question_en: How long is the Omo River?
pos_context_en: Its course is generally to the south, however with a major bend to the west at about 7° N 37° 30' E to about 36° E where it turns south until 5° 30' N where it makes a large S- bend then resumes its southerly course to Lake Turkana. According to materials published by the Ethiopian Central Statistical Agency, the Omo-Bottego River is 760 kilometers long.
neg_context_title_en: Omo Child: The River and the Bush
neg_context_en: The Omo River forms through the confluence of the Gibe River, by far the largest total tributary of the Omo River, and the Wabe River, the largest left-bank tributary of the Omo at . Given their sizes, lengths and courses one might consider both the Omo and the Gibe rivers to be one and the same river but with different names. Consequently, the whole river basin is sometimes called the "Omo-Gibe River Basin". This river basin includes part of the western Oromia Region and the middle of the Southern Nations, Nationalities, and People's Region.

Omo National Park is one of the national parks of Ethiopia. Located in the Southern Nations, Nationalities, and Peoples' Region on the west bank of the Omo River, the park covers approximately 4,068 square kilometers, about 870 kilometers southwest of Addis Ababa; across the Omo is the Mago National Park. Although an airstrip was recently built near the park headquarters on the Mui River, this park is not easily reachable; the Lonely Planet guide "Ethiopia and Eritrea" describes Omo National Park as "Ethiopia's most remote park."

Omo Child: The River and the Bush is a documentary film by John Rowe. It is about a young man who is on a quest to get tribes to change their beliefs and traditions. Namely their beliefs about curses. One tribe in particular had a custom of killing children that were believed to be cursed.
The film is set in the Omo River valley in Ethiopia. Children that are thought to be cursed are killed because it is believed that they can bring disease, famine and death to the tribes.
Lale Labuko, an educated man decided to challenge the tradition that had been around for a long time.
As of October 2015,the film had managed to pick up 24 awards around the world.
Journeyman Pictures, a London based distributor has the worldwide rights to the film.

This zone is named for the Omo River, a river that flows south into Lake Turkana on the western side. Mago National Park and Tama Wildlife Reserve are located at the eastern bank of Omo river. There is Lake Chew Bahir surrounded by Stephanie Wildlife Sanctuary located at the eastern border of this zone. Notable high points include Mount Smith (2560 meters) and Mount Mago (2538 meters). West of the Omo is the most sparsely populated part of Ethiopia, inhabited by nomadic and semi-nomadic ethnic groups. A 1996 report described the infrastructure of the Zone as "weak and for the most part non-existent; this is a disadvantage inherited from historical neglect of a typical marginal region." It also observed that the Debub Omo Zone "one of Ethiopian's socially most diverse zones. It contains a minimum of 12 different ethnic groups, and possibly as many as 21. Social diversity therefore compounds the existing problems of isolation, acute shortage of basic infrastructure as well as scarcity of professional and technical man-power."

In its course the Omo-Bottego has a total fall of about 700 m from the confluence of the Gibe and Wabe rivers at 1060 m to 360 m at lake-level, and is consequently a rapid stream in its upper reaches, being broken by the Kokobi and other falls, and navigable only for a short distance above where it empties into Lake Turkana, one of the lakes of the Gregory Rift. The "Spectrum Guide to Ethiopia" describes it as a popular site for white-water rafting in September and October, when the river is still high from the rainy season. Its most important tributary is the Gibe River; smaller tributaries include the Wabi, Denchya, Gojeb, Mui and Usno rivers.

Heavy rains in 2006 caused the Omo to flood its lower course, drowning at least 456 people and stranding over 20,000 people over the space of five days ending 16 August. While seasonal heavy rains are normal for this part of the country, overgrazing and deforestation are blamed for this tragedy. "The rivers in Ethiopia have less capacity to hold as much water as they did years before, because they are being filled up with silt," World Food Programme spokeswoman Paulette Jones said. "It takes less intensity of rainfall ... to make a river in any particular part of the country overflow." The seasonal flooding of the Omo River is vital to the indigenous groups that live along it. The flood brings fertile silt and inundates the banks with water, making river bank cultivation possible. The diverse peoples along the lower Omo—which include the Turkana, Dassanach, Hamer, Nyangatom, Karo, Kwegu, Mursi, Bodi, and Me'en—derive a great portion of their food supply from flood retreat cultivation.

The Gibe III Hydroelectric dam is a 243 m high roller-compacted concrete dam with an associated hydropower plant on the Omo River in Ethiopia. It is the largest hydropower plant in Africa with a power output of about 1870 Megawatt (MW), thus more than doubling total installed capacity in Ethiopia from its 2007 level of 814 MW. A controversy has ensued over its construction, with several NGOs forming a campaign to oppose it. According to Terri Hathaway, director of International Rivers' Africa programme, Gibe III is "the most destructive dam under construction in Africa." The project would condemn "half a million of the region's most vulnerable people to hunger and conflict." 
A group of international campaigners launched an online petition against Ethiopia's dam project over human rights concerns.

Upper part of the Omo River (segment of )Lower part of the Omo River (segment of )The "Omo River" flows into a river bend on the east bank of the Maicasagi River. From there, it flows southwest and west to the east shore of Maicasagi Lake. Then the current flows south-west through the Max Passage into the Goéland Lake. The latter is crossed to the northwest by the Waswanipi River which is a tributary of Matagami Lake.

The Omo-Bottego River formed the eastern boundaries for the former kingdoms of Janjero, and Garo. The Omo also flows past the Mago and Omo National Parks, which are known for their wildlife. Many animals live near and on the river, including hippopotamuses, crocodiles and puff adders.
question_src: Mto wa Omo ni wa muda gani?
pos_context_src: Kozi yake kwa ujumla ni ya kusini, hata hivyo na bend kubwa kuelekea magharibi karibu 7 ° N 37 ° 30 'e hadi 36 ° E ambapo inageuka kusini hadi 5 ° 30' n ambapo hufanya sehemu kubwa kisha inaanza tena kozi yake ya kusini kuelekea Ziwa Turkana. Kulingana na vifaa vilivyochapishwa na Shirika kuu la Takwimu la Ethiopia, Mto wa Omo-Bottego ni urefu wa kilomita 760.
neg_context_title_src: Mtoto wa Omo: Mto na kichaka
neg_context_src: Mto wa Omo unaunda kwa njia ya ushirika wa Mto wa Gibe, kwa jumla ya jumla ya ushuru wa Mto wa Omo, na Mto Wabe, eneo kubwa zaidi la benki ya Omo huko. Kwa kuzingatia ukubwa wao, urefu na kozi mtu anaweza kuzingatia Omo na Mito ya Gibe kuwa moja na mto huo huo lakini kwa majina tofauti. Kwa hivyo, bonde lote la mto wakati mwingine huitwa "Bonde la Mto wa Omo-Gibe". Bonde hili la mto ni pamoja na sehemu ya mkoa wa magharibi wa Oromia na katikati ya mataifa ya kusini, mataifa, na mkoa wa watu.

Hifadhi ya Kitaifa ya Omo ni moja ya mbuga za kitaifa za Ethiopia. Iko katika mataifa ya kusini, mataifa, na mkoa wa Peoples kwenye Benki ya Magharibi ya Mto wa Omo, mbuga hiyo inashughulikia takriban kilomita za mraba 4,068, karibu kilomita 870 kusini magharibi mwa Addis Ababa; Katika OMO ni Hifadhi ya Kitaifa ya Mago. Ingawa uwanja wa ndege ulijengwa hivi karibuni karibu na makao makuu ya mbuga kwenye Mto MUI, mbuga hii haiwezi kufikiwa kwa urahisi; Mwongozo wa Sayari ya Lonely "Ethiopia na Eritrea" inaelezea Hifadhi ya Kitaifa ya Omo kama "Hifadhi ya mbali zaidi ya Ethiopia."

Mtoto wa Omo: Mto na Bush ni filamu ya maandishi na John Rowe. Ni juu ya kijana ambaye yuko kwenye hamu ya kupata makabila ya kubadilisha imani na mila zao. Yaani imani yao juu ya laana. Kabila moja haswa lilikuwa na tabia ya kuua watoto ambao waliaminika walilaaniwa.
Filamu hiyo imewekwa katika Bonde la Mto wa Omo huko Ethiopia. Watoto ambao hufikiriwa kulaaniwa wanauawa kwa sababu inaaminika kuwa wanaweza kuleta magonjwa, njaa na kifo kwa makabila.
Lale Labuko, mtu aliyeelimika aliamua kupinga utamaduni ambao ulikuwa karibu kwa muda mrefu.
Mnamo Oktoba 2015, filamu hiyo ilikuwa imeweza kuchukua tuzo 24 kote ulimwenguni.
Picha za Safari, msambazaji wa msingi wa London ana haki za ulimwenguni kote kwa filamu.

Ukanda huu umetajwa kwa Mto wa Omo, mto ambao unapita kusini kuelekea Ziwa Turkana upande wa magharibi. Hifadhi ya Kitaifa ya Mago na Hifadhi ya Wanyamapori ya Tama ziko katika Benki ya Mashariki ya Mto wa Omo. Kuna Ziwa Chew Bahir kuzungukwa na Sanaa ya Wanyamapori ya Stephanie iliyoko katika mpaka wa mashariki wa ukanda huu. Pointi zinazojulikana ni pamoja na Mount Smith (mita 2560) na Mlima Mago (mita 2538). Magharibi mwa OMO ndio sehemu iliyojaa watu wengi wa Ethiopia, inayokaliwa na makabila ya nomadic na nusu-nomadic. Ripoti ya 1996 ilielezea miundombinu ya ukanda huo kama "dhaifu na kwa sehemu kubwa haipo; hii ni shida iliyorithiwa kutokana na kupuuzwa kwa kihistoria kwa mkoa wa kawaida wa pembezoni." Pia iligundua kuwa eneo la Debub Omo "moja ya maeneo ya kijamii ya Ethiopia.

Katika kozi yake Omo-Bottego ina jumla ya kushuka kwa m 700 kutoka kwa mito ya Gibe na Wabe saa 1060 m hadi 360 m kwa kiwango cha ziwa, na kwa hivyo ni mkondo wa haraka katika sehemu zake za juu, ukivunjwa na Kokobi na maporomoko mengine, na ya kusongeshwa tu kwa umbali mfupi juu ya mahali pa kutuliza ndani ya ziwa, moja kwa maporomoko ya moja kwa moja ya ziwa. "Mwongozo wa Spectrum kwa Ethiopia" unaelezea kama tovuti maarufu ya kuweka maji-nyeupe mnamo Septemba na Oktoba, wakati mto bado uko juu kutoka msimu wa mvua. Jalada lake muhimu zaidi ni Mto wa Gibe; Kodi ndogo ni pamoja na Wabi, Denchya, Gojeb, Mui na Usno mito.

Mvua nzito mnamo 2006 ilisababisha OMO kufurika kozi yake ya chini, ikazama watu wasiopungua 456 na kuwachukua watu zaidi ya 20,000 juu ya nafasi ya siku tano kumalizika 16 Agosti. Wakati mvua nzito za msimu ni kawaida kwa sehemu hii ya nchi, kuzidisha na ukataji miti hulaumiwa kwa janga hili. "Mito nchini Ethiopia ina uwezo mdogo wa kushikilia maji mengi kama walivyofanya miaka iliyopita, kwa sababu wanajazwa na hariri," msemaji wa Programu ya Chakula Duniani Paulette Jones alisema. "Inachukua kiwango kidogo cha mvua ... kutengeneza mto katika sehemu yoyote ya nchi kufurika." Mafuriko ya msimu wa Mto wa Omo ni muhimu kwa vikundi vya asilia ambavyo vinaishi kando yake. Mafuriko huleta hariri yenye rutuba na huingiza benki na maji, na kufanya kilimo cha benki ya mto kinawezekana. Watu tofauti pamoja na Omo ya chini - ambayo ni pamoja na Turkana, Dassanach, Hamer, Nyangatom, Karo, Kwegu, Mursi, Bodi, na Me'en - huleta sehemu kubwa ya usambazaji wao wa chakula kutoka kwa kilimo cha mafuriko.

Bwawa la Gibe III hydroelectric ni bwawa la simiti lenye urefu wa 243 m na mmea wa hydropower unaohusishwa kwenye Mto wa Omo nchini Ethiopia. Ni mmea mkubwa zaidi wa hydropower barani Afrika na nguvu ya uzalishaji wa takriban 1870 megawatt (MW), kwa hivyo zaidi ya kuzidisha uwezo uliowekwa nchini Ethiopia kutoka kiwango chake cha 2007 cha 814 MW. Mzozo umeibuka juu ya ujenzi wake, na NGO kadhaa zinaunda kampeni ya kuipinga. Kulingana na Terri Hathaway, Mkurugenzi wa Programu ya Kimataifa ya Mito ya Afrika, Gibe III ni "bwawa linaloharibu zaidi chini ya ujenzi barani Afrika." Mradi huo ungelaani "nusu milioni ya watu walio hatarini zaidi wa mkoa huo kwa njaa na migogoro." 
Kundi la wanaharakati wa kimataifa walizindua ombi la mkondoni dhidi ya mradi wa bwawa la Ethiopia juu ya wasiwasi wa haki za binadamu.

Sehemu ya juu ya Mto wa Omo (sehemu ya) sehemu ya chini ya Mto wa Omo (sehemu ya) "Mto wa Omo" unapita ndani ya mto kwenye ukingo wa mashariki wa Mto Maicasagi. Kutoka hapo, inapita kusini magharibi na magharibi kuelekea pwani ya mashariki ya Ziwa la Maicasagi. Halafu ya sasa inapita kusini-magharibi kupitia kifungu cha max ndani ya Ziwa la Goéland. Mwisho huo umevuka kwenda kaskazini magharibi na Mto Waswanipi ambao ni kijeshi cha Ziwa la Matagami.

Mto wa Omo-Bottego uliunda mipaka ya mashariki kwa falme za zamani za Janjero, na Garo. OMO pia inapita nyuma ya mbuga za kitaifa za Mago na Omo, ambazo zinajulikana kwa wanyama wao wa porini. Wanyama wengi huishi karibu na kwenye mto, pamoja na kiboko, mamba na nyongeza za puff.
report_src: Mto wa Omo una urefu wa takriban kilomita 760 kulingana na takwimu zilizochapishwa na Shirika Kuu la Takwimu la Ethiopia [1].

question_en: How large is Bengal by area?
pos_context_en: Most of the Bengal region lies in the Ganges-Brahmaputra delta, but there are highlands in its north, northeast and southeast. The Ganges Delta arises from the confluence of the rivers Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers and their respective tributaries. The total area of Bengal is 232,752  km—West Bengal is and Bangladesh .
neg_context_en: The decision to effect the Partition of Bengal was announced in July 1905 by the Viceroy of India, Lord Curzon. The partition took place on 16 October 1905 and separated the largely Muslim eastern areas from the largely Hindu western areas. The former province of Bengal was divided into two new provinces "Bengal" (comprising western Bengal as well as the province of Bihar and Orissa) and Eastern Bengal and Assam with Dacca as the capital of the latter. Partition was promoted for administrative reasons: Bengal was geographically as large as France and had a significantly larger population. Curzon stated the eastern region was neglected and under-governed. By splitting the province, an improved administration could be established in the east, where subsequently, the population would benefit from new schools and employment opportunities. The Hindus of West Bengal who dominated Bengal's business and rural life complained that the division would make them a minority in a province that would incorporate the province of Bihar and Orissa. Indians were outraged at what they recognised as a "divide and rule" policy.

The Bay of Bengal occupies an area of . A number of large rivers flow into the Bay of Bengal: the Ganges-Hooghly, the Padma, the Brahmaputra-Jamuna, the Barak-Surma-Meghna, the Irrawaddy, the Godavari, the Mahanadi, the Brahmani, the Baitarani, the Krishna and the Kaveri. Among the important ports are Chennai-Ennore, Chittagong, Colombo, Kolkata-Haldia, Mongla, Paradip, Port Blair, Tuticorin, Visakhapatnam and Yangon,Dhamra . Among the smaller ports are Gopalpur Port, Kakinada and Payra.

Sagar Island is an island in the Ganges delta, lying on the continental shelf of Bay of Bengal about 100 km (54 nautical miles) south of Kolkata. This island forms the Sagar CD Block in Kakdwip subdivision of South 24 Parganas district in the Indian State of West Bengal. The island is large — with an area of 224.3 km², lying between 21°36’ to 21°56’ north latitude and 88°2’ to 88° 11’ east latitude. It has 43 villages and a population of over 160,000. The largest village is also named "Ganga Sagar" or "Gangasagar". Although Sagar island is a part of Sunderban Administration, it does not have any tiger habitation or mangrove forests or small river tributaries as is characteristic of the overall sunderban delta.

The preferred habitats of the Bengal slow loris range across tropical and subtropical regions, and include evergreen and semi-evergreen rainforests with forest edges and continuous, dense canopies. It can also be found in bamboo groves. It prefers habitats with larger diameter, tall trees with a large crown depth (defined as the length along the main axis from the tree tip to the base of the crown); these areas are typically associated with greater food abundance, and decreased risk of predation. Because of its preference for dense forests, it acts as a good indicator of the ecosystem's health.

After the Maratha rebellions in Northern India the Bengal province became autonomous and was ruled by the Nawab of Bengal however after the Battle of Plassey the region became the administrative division of British India with Bengal's capital Calcutta becoming the Indian capital. Bengal Presidency was formed in 1765. In 1905, the presidency was divided into Bengal province and East Bengal and Assam province. In 1911, Bengal was reunited. Assam including Meghalaya and Sylhet was severed from the Presidency in 1874. Assam became the Province of Assam together with Lushai Hills in 1912. In 1912 Bengal was separated into various states of the British empire after being a tense area of the Indian independence movement. These new provinces were Bihar and Orissa and East Bengal and Assam however the westernmost part of the Bihar and Orissa province and East Bengal were reunited to become a smaller but yet united Bengal. This province was partitioned again in 1947 into Hindu-majority West Bengal and Muslim-majority East Bengal (now Bangladesh) to facilitate the creation of the separate Muslim state of Pakistan, of which East Bengal became a province.

The Bengal region is one of the most densely populated areas in the world. With a population of 300 million, Bengalis are the third largest ethnic group in the world after the Han Chinese and Arabs.
According to provisional results of 2011 Bangladesh census, the population of Bangladesh was 142,319,000; however, CIA's "The World Factbook" gives 163,654,860 as its population in a July 2013 estimate. According to the provisional results of the 2011 Indian national census, West Bengal has a population of 91,347,736. So, the Bengal region, , has at least 233 million people. This figures give a population density of 1003.9/km; making it among the most densely populated areas in the world.

As per the India State of Forest Report 2017, recorded forest area in the state is , while in 2013, forest area was , which was 18.93% of the state's geographical area, compared to the then national average of 21.23%. Reserves and protected and unclassed forests constitute 59.4%, 31.8%, and 8.9%, respectively, of forested areas, as of 2009. Part of the world's largest mangrove forest, the Sundarbans is located in southern West Bengal.
From a phytogeographic viewpoint, the southern part of West Bengal can be divided into two regions: the Gangetic plain and the littoral mangrove forests of the Sundarbans. The alluvial soil of the Gangetic plain, combined with favourable rainfall, makes this region especially fertile. Much of the vegetation of the western part of the state has similar species composition with the plants of the Chota Nagpur plateau in the adjoining state of Jharkhand. The predominant commercial tree species is "Shorea robusta", commonly known as the sal tree. The coastal region of Purba Medinipur exhibits coastal vegetation; the predominant tree is the "Casuarina". A notable tree from the Sundarbans is the ubiquitous "sundari" ("Heritiera fomes"), from which the forest gets its name.

Eastern Bengal and Assam had a total area of 111,569 sq m and was situated between 20° 45' and 28° 17' N., and between 87° 48' and 97° 5' E. It was bounded by Tibet and the Kingdom of Bhutan to the north, British Burma to the east and the Bay of Bengal to the south. Within these limits, were the princely states of Hill Tippera, Cooch Behar and Manipur.

A small coastal region is on the extreme south of the state. A part of the district of Purba Medinipur along the Bay of Bengal constitutes the coastal plain. This emergent coastal plain is made up of sand and mud deposited by rivers and by wind. Parallel to the coast are colonies of sand dunes and marshy areas. The Digha dune lies nearest to the Bay of Bengal while the Kanthi dune is the farthest from it. In some areas dunes occur at a distance of 15–16 km from the coast and are 11–12 m high.
question_src: Bengal ni kubwa kiasi gani?
pos_context_src: Sehemu kubwa ya Bengal iko katika Ganges-Brahmaputra Delta, lakini kuna maeneo ya juu kaskazini, kaskazini mashariki na kusini mashariki. Ganges Delta inatokana na ushirika wa mito ya Ganges, Brahmaputra, na Meghna Mito na ushuru wao. Jumla ya eneo la Bengal ni 232,752 km - Magharibi mwa Bengal ni na Bangladesh.
neg_context_src: Uamuzi wa kuathiri kizigeu cha Bengal ulitangazwa mnamo Julai 1905 na Viceroy wa India, Lord Curzon. Sehemu hiyo ilifanyika mnamo 16 Oktoba 1905 na kutenganisha maeneo ya mashariki ya Waislamu kutoka maeneo ya Magharibi ya Hindu. Mkoa wa zamani wa Bengal uligawanywa katika majimbo mawili mapya "Bengal" (iliyojumuisha Bengal Magharibi na mkoa wa Bihar na Orissa) na Bengal ya Mashariki na Assam na Dacca kama mji mkuu wa mwisho. Kuhesabu kulipandishwa kwa sababu za kiutawala: Bengal ilikuwa kijiografia kama Ufaransa na ilikuwa na idadi kubwa zaidi. Curzon alisema mkoa wa Mashariki ulipuuzwa na kutawaliwa. Kwa kugawanya mkoa, utawala ulioboreshwa unaweza kuanzishwa Mashariki, ambapo baadaye, idadi ya watu ingefaidika na shule mpya na fursa za ajira. Wahindu wa West Bengal ambao walitawala biashara ya Bengal na maisha ya vijijini walilalamika kwamba mgawanyiko huo ungewafanya wachache katika mkoa ambao ungejumuisha mkoa wa Bihar na Orissa. Wahindi walikasirishwa na kile walichotambua kama sera ya "mgawanyiko na sheria".

Bay ya Bengal inachukua eneo la. Mito kadhaa kubwa inapita ndani ya Bay ya Bengal: Ganges-Hooghly, Padma, Brahmaputra-Jamuna, Barak-Surma-Meghna, Irrawaddy, Godavari, Mahanadi, Brahmani, Baitarani, Krishna na Kaveri. Kati ya bandari muhimu ni Chennai-Ennore, Chittagong, Colombo, Kolkata-Haldia, Mongla, Paradip, Port Blair, Tuticorin, Visakhapatnam na Yangon, Dhamra. Kati ya bandari ndogo ni bandari ya Gopalpur, Kakinada na Payra.

Kisiwa cha Sagar ni kisiwa katika Ganges Delta, iliyoko kwenye rafu ya bara la Bay ya Bengal karibu kilomita 100 (maili 54 nautical) kusini mwa Kolkata. Kisiwa hiki kinaunda kizuizi cha CD cha Sagar katika ugawanyaji wa Kakdwip wa Wilaya ya Parganas ya Kusini 24 katika jimbo la India la West Bengal. Kisiwa hicho ni kikubwa - na eneo la kilomita 224.3, liko kati ya 21 ° 36 'hadi 21 ° 56' latitudo ya kaskazini na 88 ° 2 'hadi 88 ° 11' latitudo ya mashariki. Inayo vijiji 43 na idadi ya zaidi ya 160,000. Kijiji kikubwa pia kinaitwa "Ganga Sagar" au "Gangasagar". Ingawa Kisiwa cha Sagar ni sehemu ya usimamizi wa Sunderban, haina makao yoyote ya tiger au misitu ya mikoko au huduma ndogo za mto kama ilivyo tabia ya Delta ya Sunderban.

Makao yanayopendekezwa ya Bengal Slow Loris huzunguka katika mikoa ya kitropiki na ya kitropiki, na ni pamoja na misitu ya mvua ya kijani na ya evergreen na kingo za msitu na dari zinazoendelea. Inaweza pia kupatikana katika mianzi ya mianzi. Inapendelea makazi yenye kipenyo kikubwa, miti mirefu yenye kina kirefu cha taji (hufafanuliwa kama urefu kando ya mhimili kuu kutoka ncha ya mti hadi msingi wa taji); Maeneo haya kawaida yanahusishwa na wingi wa chakula, na kupungua kwa hatari ya utabiri. Kwa sababu ya upendeleo wake kwa misitu mnene, hufanya kama kiashiria kizuri cha afya ya mfumo wa ikolojia.

Baada ya uasi wa Maratha kaskazini mwa India jimbo la Bengal likawa huru na lilitawaliwa na Nawab wa Bengal hata hivyo baada ya vita vya Plassey mkoa huo ukawa mgawanyiko wa kiutawala wa India ya Uingereza na mji mkuu wa Bengal Calcutta kuwa mji mkuu wa India. Urais wa Bengal uliundwa mnamo 1765. Mnamo 1905, urais uligawanywa katika Mkoa wa Bengal na Mkoa wa Bengal Mashariki na Assam. Mnamo 1911, Bengal aliunganishwa tena. Assam pamoja na Meghalaya na Sylhet walitengwa kutoka kwa urais mnamo 1874. Assam ikawa mkoa wa Assam pamoja na Lushai Hills mnamo 1912. Mnamo 1912 Bengal alitengwa katika majimbo mbali mbali ya Dola ya Uingereza baada ya kuwa eneo la harakati ya Uhuru wa India. Majimbo haya mapya yalikuwa Bihar na Orissa na Bengal Mashariki na Assam hata hivyo sehemu ya magharibi ya Mkoa wa Bihar na Orissa na Bengal Mashariki waliunganishwa tena kuwa ndogo lakini bado United Bengal. Mkoa huu uligawanywa tena mnamo 1947 kuwa Hindu-Majority West Bengal na Waislamu wengi Mashariki Bengal (sasa Bangladesh) kuwezesha uundaji wa jimbo tofauti la Waislamu la Pakistan, ambalo Bengal Mashariki ikawa mkoa.

Kanda ya Bengal ni moja wapo ya maeneo yenye watu wengi ulimwenguni. Pamoja na idadi ya watu milioni 300, Bengalis ndio kabila kubwa la tatu ulimwenguni baada ya Wachina wa Han na Waarabu.
Kulingana na matokeo ya muda ya sensa ya Bangladesh ya 2011, idadi ya watu wa Bangladesh ilikuwa 142,319,000; Walakini, CIA "The Factbook World" inatoa 163,654,860 kama idadi ya watu katika makisio ya Julai 2013. Kulingana na matokeo ya muda ya sensa ya kitaifa ya India ya 2011, West Bengal ina idadi ya watu 91,347,736. Kwa hivyo, mkoa wa Bengal, una angalau watu milioni 233. Takwimu hizi zinatoa wiani wa idadi ya watu 1003.9/km; kuifanya iwe kati ya maeneo yenye watu wengi zaidi ulimwenguni.

Kama ilivyo kwa Ripoti ya Jimbo la Msitu wa India 2017, eneo lililorekodiwa la misitu katika jimbo hilo, wakati katika 2013, eneo la misitu lilikuwa, ambalo lilikuwa 18.93% ya eneo la jiografia la serikali, ikilinganishwa na wastani wa kitaifa wa 21.23%. Akiba na misitu iliyolindwa na isiyo na msingi ni 59.4%, 31.8%, na 8.9%, mtawaliwa, wa maeneo yenye misitu, kama ya 2009. Sehemu ya msitu mkubwa zaidi wa mikoko, Sundarbans iko kusini mwa Bengal Magharibi.
Kutoka kwa maoni ya phytogeographic, sehemu ya kusini ya West Bengal inaweza kugawanywa katika mikoa miwili: tambarare ya Gangetic na misitu ya mikoko ya littoral ya Sundarbans. Udongo wa udongo wa bonde la gangetic, pamoja na mvua nzuri, hufanya mkoa huu kuwa na rutuba. Sehemu kubwa ya mimea ya sehemu ya magharibi ya serikali ina muundo kama huo na mimea ya Chota Nagpur Plateau katika hali inayoungana ya Jharkhand. Aina kubwa ya miti ya kibiashara ni "Shorea robusta", inayojulikana kama mti wa sal. Mkoa wa pwani wa Purba Medinipur unaonyesha mimea ya pwani; Mti mkubwa ni "Casuarina". Mti mashuhuri kutoka kwa Sundarbans ni "Sundari" ya kawaida ("Heritiera fomes"), ambayo msitu hupata jina lake.

Bengal ya Mashariki na Assam ilikuwa na eneo la jumla la 111,569 sq m na ilikuwa kati ya 20 ° 45 'na 28 ° 17' N., na kati ya 87 ° 48 'na 97 ° 5' E. Ilifungwa na Tibet na Ufalme wa Bhutan kaskazini, Briteni Burma kuelekea mashariki na Bay ya kusini. Ndani ya mipaka hii, walikuwa majimbo ya kifalme ya Hill Tippera, Cooch Behar na Manipur.

Kanda ndogo ya pwani iko kusini mwa jimbo. Sehemu ya wilaya ya Purba Madinipur kando ya Bay ya Bengal hufanya eneo la pwani. Bonde hili la pwani linaloibuka limetengenezwa na mchanga na matope yaliyowekwa na mito na upepo. Sambamba na pwani ni koloni za matuta ya mchanga na maeneo ya marshy. Dune ya Digha iko karibu na Bay ya Bengal wakati Dune ya Kanthi ndio mbali zaidi kutoka kwake. Katika maeneo mengine matuta hufanyika kwa umbali wa km 15-16 kutoka pwani na ni 11-12 m juu.
report_src: Bengal inakadiriwa kuwa na jumla ya eneo la takriban kilomita za mraba 232,752, likijumuisha maeneo ya Bangladesh yote na Jimbo la Magharibi ya Bengal nchini India [1].

question_en: What denomination is St. Joseph's Church in Fall River?
pos_context_en: St. Joseph's Church is a historic church located at 1355 North Main Street in Fall River, Massachusetts. It was built in 1880 in the Gothic Revival style and added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1983. It was designed by notable church architect Patrick C. Keely.
neg_context_title_en: Notre Dame de Lourdes Church (Fall River, Massachusetts)
Notre Dame de Lourdes Church (Fall River, Massachusetts)
neg_context_en: With the loss of the church Masses were moved to St. Joseph's Orphanage till a new church could be built. Saturday & Sunday masses were held at Bishop Connolly High School. When the ruins were searched it was found that very little remained from the fire. One stained-glass window, "The Flight into Egypt", was spared destruction due to being in Connecticut for repair. The third Notre Dame was designed and built around this window. The three Angels that had adorned the Sanctuary Lamp and two candlesticks, though in the middle of the blaze, managed to survive the inferno. These too are part of the new church. The Sacred Heart Monument also miraculously survived the blaze even though it was in close proximity to the church. It wasn't until 1986 that the new church was built and ready for use. The orientation of the new building is reverse what the old one was. The new churches "front" sits in the footprint of the old churches "rear". In 2012, it was revealed that the parish of Notre Dame de Lourdes would be merging with the parish of Immaculate Conception in Fall River. This occurred in June 2012 and they will be using Notre Dame as their church, taking on the name St. Bernadette.
St. Joseph's Orphanage is an historic former orphanage and school located at 56 St. Joseph Street in Fall River, Massachusetts.
The trustees of the church are Henry J. Whalen and James H. O'Neil.

The end came on Ash Wednesday, February 18, l885, and the last words that he gave utterance to were these: "I'm tired; I want to go home!" On the Friday of that week, February 20, the funeral ceremonies were held with the first religious service in the new church, the officers of the Solemn High Mass of Requiem being: Celebrant, Reverend Father McCabe of Fall River; Deacon, Reverend Father Roach of Taunton; Sub-Deacon, Reverend Father Grace of Fall River; Master of Ceremonies, Reverend Father Briscoe of Fall River. The eulogy was ably delivered by Reverend Father Kinnerney of Pawtucket, R.I., with the absolution and the final blessing by the head of the diocese, Right Reverend Bishop Hendricken. As in the death of the founder of the parish, the body of Reverend Father Brady was laid at rest in a vault in the basement of the church.

The Jesus Marie Convent is a historic former convent located at 138 St. Joseph's Street in Fall River, Massachusetts. It was built in 1887 and designed by local architect and parish member Louis G. Destremps, who also designed the nearby orphanage, school and church.
The church's pipe organ was built in 1883 by W.K. Adams & Sons in Providence RI. It is one of the largest built by them. It was once run by water and then by bellows.

Words truly spoken, indeed. What the City of Fall River was destined to become, God alone knew then. But with a retrospective glance over the dim and musty pages of local church history covering more than four decades of time, what do we find today as matters of common knowledge of which Catholics one and all may well feel proud? Fall River, an Episcopal See, under the wise guidance of Right Reverend Daniel F. Feehan as the successor of the late lamented Right Reverend William Stang, its first Bishop; 23 Catholic churches where, in addition to the English tongue, the worshippers are representatives of the French, Portuguese, Polish, Italian, and Syrian nationalities; a city with a population of rising 128,000 and more than 80 per cent of them Catholics; a Catholic, Honorable John W. Cummings as President of the Fall River Bar Association and a Past President of the Massachusetts State Bar Association; A Catholic, Honorable Hugo A. Dubuque, as a Justice of the Superior Court of Massachusetts; a Catholic, Honorable Edward F. Hanify as Justice of the Second District Court of Bristol County; A Catholic, Honorable Edmond P. Talbot, as Mayor of the city; a Catholic, Hector L.Belisle, as Superintendent of Schools; a Catholic, Martin Feeney, as Chief of Police; a Catholic, Jeremiah F. Sullivan, as Chief of the Fire Department; Catholics as heads of several of the other important bureaus in City Hall; two Catholics, Honorable John T. Coughlin and Honorable Thomas F. Higgins, former mayors and present members of this parish; a Catholic, and likewise a parishioner, Michael J. Orpen, Esquire, as clerk of the Second District Court of Bristol, and a Catholic, Honorable Frank M. Silvia, as one of its Special Justices; Catholic Church, fraternal and charitable organizations seemingly without number; Catholic laymen as leaders in the industrial, business and social pursuits of the municipality. Fall River has certainly taken its place in the sun as one of the bright sparkling centers of Catholicity in these United States!

Notre Dame School is a historic former school building located at 34 St. Joseph's Street in Fall River, Massachusetts. It was built in 1899, and designed by local architect and parish member Louis G. Destremps, who also designed the nearby St. Joseph's Orphanage and Notre Dame de Lourdes Church.

Notre Dame de Lourdes, then known as St. Bernadette Parish, is a former Roman Catholic parish in Fall River, Massachusetts. The parish was established in 1874 to serve the growing French-Canadian population located in the city's Flint Village section. Since its founding, the parish has occupied three different church buildings; a wooden structure (1874–1893), a spectacular granite church (1906–1982) and the current modern church (1986-2018). The parish complex over time has also consisted of other multiple buildings, including St. Joseph's Orphanage, The Jesus Marie Convent, a school, the church rectory, the Brothers' residence, and the former Msgr. Prevost High School. The parish also includes Notre Dame Cemetery, located in the city's south end.
question_src: Je! Kanisa la Mtakatifu Joseph ni nini huko Fall River?
pos_context_title_src: Kanisa la Mtakatifu Joseph (Fall River, Massachusetts)
pos_context_src: Kanisa la St. Joseph ni kanisa la kihistoria lililoko 1355 North Main Street huko Fall River, Massachusetts. Ilijengwa mnamo 1880 kwa mtindo wa uamsho wa Gothic na kuongezwa kwenye Jalada la Kitaifa la Maeneo ya kihistoria mnamo 1983. Iliundwa na mbunifu mashuhuri wa kanisa Patrick C. Keely.

Kanisa la Notre Dame de Lourdes (Fall River, Massachusetts)
neg_context_src: Na upotezaji wa mashehe wa kanisa hilo walihamishwa kwenda kwa kituo cha watoto yatima cha Mtakatifu Joseph hadi kanisa jipya liweze kujengwa. Jumamosi na Jumapili mashehe ilifanyika katika Shule ya Upili ya Askofu Connolly. Wakati magofu yalipotafutwa iligundulika kuwa kidogo sana kutoka kwa moto. Dirisha moja lenye glasi, "ndege kwenda Misri", iliokolewa uharibifu kwa sababu ya kuwa katika Connecticut kwa ukarabati. Notre Dame ya tatu ilibuniwa na kujengwa karibu na dirisha hili. Malaika watatu ambao walikuwa wamepamba taa ya patakatifu na mishumaa mbili, ingawa katikati ya moto, walifanikiwa kuishi kwa inferno. Hizi pia ni sehemu ya kanisa mpya. Monument ya Moyo Mtakatifu pia ilinusurika kwa miujiza hiyo moto hata ingawa ilikuwa karibu na kanisa. Haikuwa hadi 1986 ambapo kanisa jipya lilijengwa na tayari kutumika. Mwelekeo wa jengo jipya ni kubadili kile cha zamani kilikuwa. Makanisa mapya "Front" yanakaa katika nyayo za makanisa ya zamani "nyuma". Mnamo mwaka wa 2012, ilifunuliwa kuwa parokia ya Notre Dame de Lourdes ingekuwa ikiungana na parokia ya dhana ya kutokuwepo katika Mto Fall. Hii ilitokea mnamo Juni 2012 na watakuwa wakitumia Notre Dame kama kanisa lao, wakichukua jina la St. Bernadette.
Orphanage ya St. Joseph ni ya kihistoria ya zamani ya watoto yatima na shule iliyoko katika 56 St Joseph Street huko Fall River, Massachusetts.
Wadhamini wa kanisa hilo ni Henry J. Whalen na James H. O'Neil.

Mwisho ulikuja Ash Jumatano, Februari 18, L885, na maneno ya mwisho ambayo alitoa maoni haya ni haya: "Nimechoka; nataka kwenda nyumbani!" Siku ya Ijumaa ya wiki hiyo, Februari 20, sherehe za mazishi zilifanyika na ibada ya kwanza ya kidini katika kanisa hilo mpya, maafisa wa Misa Kuu ya Requiem kuwa: mtu mashuhuri, Mchungaji baba McCabe wa Fall River; Deacon, Mchungaji Baba Roach wa Taunton; Mtoaji mdogo, Mchungaji Baba Neema wa Fall River; Mwalimu wa Sherehe, Mchungaji Baba Briscoe wa Fall River. Eulogy ilitolewa na Mchungaji Baba Kinnerney wa Pawtucket, R.I., na kufutwa na baraka ya mwisho na mkuu wa Dayosisi, Mchungaji wa kulia Askofu Hendricken. Kama ilivyo katika kifo cha mwanzilishi wa parokia hiyo, mwili wa Mchungaji Baba Brady ulilazwa katika chumba cha kulala katika basement ya kanisa.

The Jesus Marie Convent ni kihistoria cha zamani cha kihistoria kilichopo katika Mtaa wa 138 wa St Joseph huko Fall River, Massachusetts. Ilijengwa mnamo 1887 na iliyoundwa na mbunifu wa ndani na mjumbe wa parokia Louis G. Destread, ambaye pia alibuni nyumba ya watoto yatima, shule na kanisa.
Chombo cha bomba la kanisa hilo kilijengwa mnamo 1883 na W.K. Adams & Wana katika Providence RI. Ni moja wapo kubwa iliyojengwa nao. Wakati mmoja iliendeshwa na maji na kisha kwa kengele.

Maneno yaliyosemwa kweli, kweli. Kile mji wa Fall River ulipangwa kuwa, Mungu pekee alijua wakati huo. Lakini kwa mtazamo wa kupatikana tena juu ya kurasa za kurasa na za lazima za historia ya kanisa la mitaa kufunika zaidi ya miongo nne ya wakati, tunapata nini leo kama mambo ya maarifa ya kawaida ambayo Wakatoliki moja na wote wanaweza kujisikia kiburi? Fall River, mtazamaji wa Episcopal, chini ya mwongozo wa busara wa Mchungaji wa kulia Daniel F. Feehan kama mrithi wa Mchungaji wa kulia wa Marehemu William Stang, Askofu wake wa kwanza; Makanisa 23 ya Katoliki ambapo, pamoja na lugha ya Kiingereza, waabudu ni wawakilishi wa mataifa ya Ufaransa, Kireno, Kipolishi, Italia, na Syria; mji ulio na idadi ya kuongezeka kwa asilimia 128,000 na zaidi ya asilimia 80 ya Wakatoliki; Mkatoliki, mwenye heshima John W. Cummings kama rais wa Chama cha Fall River Bar na rais wa zamani wa Chama cha Jimbo la Massachusetts; Mkatoliki, Heshima Hugo A. Dubuque, kama haki ya Mahakama Kuu ya Massachusetts; Mkatoliki, mwenye heshima Edward F. Hanify kama haki ya Mahakama ya Pili ya Wilaya ya Bristol; Mkatoliki, mwenye heshima Edmond P. Talbot, kama meya wa jiji; Mkatoliki, Hector L.Belisle, kama msimamizi wa shule; Mkatoliki, Martin Feeney, kama mkuu wa polisi; Mkatoliki, Jeremiah F. Sullivan, kama mkuu wa Idara ya Moto; Wakatoliki kama wakuu wa ofisi kadhaa muhimu katika Jumba la Jiji; Wakatoliki wawili, Heshima John T. Coughlin na Heshima Thomas F. Higgins, meya wa zamani na washiriki wa parokia hii; Mkatoliki, na vivyo hivyo ni parishioner, Michael J. Orpen, Esquire, kama karani wa Mahakama ya Pili ya Wilaya ya Bristol, na Mkatoliki, Heshima Frank M. Silvia, kama mmoja wa majaji wake maalum; Kanisa Katoliki, mashirika ya kidugu na ya hisani inaonekana bila idadi; Wakatoliki wa Katoliki kama viongozi katika harakati za viwanda, biashara na kijamii za manispaa. Mto wa Fall hakika umechukua mahali pake kwenye jua kama moja ya kung'aa mkali Vituo vya Ukatoliki katika Amerika haya!

Notre Dame School ni jengo la kihistoria la zamani la shule lililopo katika Mtaa wa 34 wa St Joseph huko Fall River, Massachusetts. Ilijengwa mnamo 1899, na iliyoundwa na mbunifu wa ndani na mjumbe wa parokia Louis G. Destread, ambaye pia alibuni kanisa la Orphanage la karibu la St Joseph na Notre Dame de Lourdes.

Notre Dame de Lourdes, wakati huo anajulikana kama Parokia ya St. Bernadette, ni parokia ya zamani ya Roma Katoliki huko Fall River, Massachusetts. Parokia hiyo ilianzishwa mnamo 1874 kutumikia idadi kubwa ya watu wa Ufaransa na Canada iliyoko katika sehemu ya kijiji cha Flint. Tangu kuanzishwa kwake, parokia hiyo imechukua majengo matatu tofauti ya kanisa; Muundo wa mbao (1874-1893), Kanisa la Granite la kuvutia (1906-1982) na Kanisa la kisasa la kisasa (1986-2018). Ugumu wa parokia hiyo kwa wakati pia umejumuisha majengo mengine mengi, pamoja na kituo cha watoto yatima cha St Joseph, Jesus Marie Convent, shule, kumbukumbu ya kanisa, makazi ya ndugu, na Msgr wa zamani. Prevost High School. Parokia hiyo pia ni pamoja na Makaburi ya Notre Dame, ambayo iko katika mwisho wa jiji.

question_en: Is sperm donation safe?
pos_context_en: Where sperm banks are allowed to operate they are often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child, but which may also provide a compromise between the conflicting views which surround their operation. A particular example of this is the control which is often placed on the number of children which a single donor may father and which may be designed to protect against consanguinity. However, such legislation usually cannot prevent a sperm bank from supplying donor sperm outside the jurisdiction in which it operates, and neither can it prevent sperm donors from donating elsewhere during their lives. There is an acute shortage of sperm donors in many parts of the world and there is obvious pressure from many quarters for donor sperm from those willing and able to provide it to be made available as safely and as freely as possible.
neg_context_en: In Israel, sperm donation is mandated by the Ministry of Health. There are 12 authorized sperm banks and hospitals across the country, and 2 more in private research facilities. Only unmarried, healthy men under the age of 30 are allowed to donate sperm, and they are financially compensated for it. Men who want to donate must get to the hospital, pass an interview and blood-checks. They are also prohibited from donating sperm in more than one sperm bank. Finally, anonymity is kept indefinitely; the donor would never receive information regarding offsprings, and vice versa.

The number of children permitted from a single donor varies by law and practice. These laws are designed to protect the children produced by sperm donation as well as the donor's natural children from consanguinity in later life: they are not intended to protect the donor himself and those donating sperm will be aware that their donations may give rise to numerous pregnancies in different jurisdictions. Such laws, where they exist, vary from jurisdiction to jurisdiction, and a sperm bank may also impose its own limits. The latter will be based on the reports of pregnancies which the sperm bank receives, although this relies upon the accuracy of the returns and the actual number of pregnancies may therefore be somewhat higher. Nevertheless, sperm banks frequently impose a lower limit on geographical numbers than some jurisdictions and may also limit the overall number of pregnancies permitted from a single donor. The limitation on the number of children which a donor's sperm may give rise to is usually expressed in terms of 'families', on the expectation that children within the family are prohibited from sexual relations under incest laws. In effect, the term "family" means a "woman" and usually includes the donor's partner or ex-partner, so that multiple donations to the same woman are not counted in the limit. The limits usually apply within one jurisdiction, so that donor sperm may be used in other jurisdictions. There is no limit on the number of donations that can be made to the same woman.

The growth of sperm banks and fertility clinics, the use of sperm agencies and the availability of anonymous donor sperm have served to make sperm donation a more respectable, and therefore a more socially acceptable, procedure. The intervention of doctors and others may be seen as making the whole process a respectable and merely a medical procedure which raises no moral issues, where donor inseminations may be referred to as 'treatments' and donor children as 'resulting from the use of a donor's sperm', or 'born following donation' and subsequent children may be described as 'born using the same donor' rather than as biological children of the same male.

Sperm donation laws vary by country. Most countries have laws on sperm donation and place limits on how many children a sperm donor may give rise to. Other laws include a prohibition on use of donor semen after the donor has died, or to the payment to sperm donors. Other laws may restrict use of donor sperm for in vitro fertilisation (IVF) treatment, which may itself be banned or restricted in some way, such as to married heterosexual couples, banning such treatment to single women or lesbian couples.

A sperm donor is generally not intended to be the legal or "de jure" father of a child produced from his sperm. The law may however, make implications in relation to legal fatherhood or the absence of a father. The law may also govern the fertility process through sperm donation in a fertility clinic. It may make provision as to whether a sperm donor may be anonymous or not, and it might give an adult donor conceived offspring the right to trace his or her biological father. Where sperm is donated by natural insemination, i.e. where the donor has sexual intercourse with the recipient woman, the law in every country will always provide that the male is the father of any child produced, even where the sperm is provided by a third party male who is not the woman's usual sexual partner and where the express intention was to secure a pregnancy.

In the United Kingdom, the Warnock Committee was formed in July 1982 to consider issues of sperm donation and assisted reproduction techniques. Donor insemination was already available in the UK through unregulated clinics such as BPAS. Many of these clinics had started to offer sperm donation before the widespread use of freezing techniques. 'Fresh sperm' was donated to order by donors at the fertile times of patients requiring treatments. Commonly, infertility of a male partner or sterilisation was a reason for treatment. Donations were anonymous and unregulated.

Sperm may be donated publicly and directly to the intended donor, or through a sperm bank or fertility clinic. Sperm donation enables a man to father a child for third-party women, and is therefore, categorized as a form of third party reproduction. Pregnancies are usually achieved by using donor sperm in assisted reproductive technology (ART) techniques which include artificial insemination (either by intracervical insemination (ICI) or intrauterine insemination (IUI) in a clinic, or intravaginal insemination at home). Less commonly, donor sperm may be used in in vitro fertilization (IVF). The primary recipients of donor sperm are single women, lesbian couples and heterosexual couples suffering from male infertility.

Where a donor donates sperm through a sperm bank, the sperm bank will generally undertake a number of checks to ensure that the donor produces sperm of sufficient quantity and quality and that the donor is healthy and will not pass diseases through the use of his sperm. The donor's sperm must also withstand the freezing and thawing process necessary to store and quarantine the sperm. The cost to the sperm bank for such tests is considerable, which normally means that clinics may use the same donor to produce a number of pregnancies in multiple women.

Donor sperm and 'fertility treatments' using donor sperm may be obtained at a sperm bank or fertility clinic. Sperm banks or clinics may be subject to state or professional regulations, including restrictions on donor anonymity and the number of offspring that may be produced, and there may be other legal protections of the rights and responsibilities of both recipient and donor. Some sperm banks, either by choice or regulation, limit the amount of information available to potential recipients; a desire to obtain more information on donors is one reason why recipients may choose to use a known donor or private donation (i.e. a de-identified donor). However conception is achieved, the nature and course of the pregnancy will be the same as one achieved by sexual intercourse, and the male donor will be the biological father of any child born from his donations.
question_src: Je! Mchango wa manii uko salama?
pos_context_src: Ambapo benki za manii zinaruhusiwa kufanya kazi mara nyingi hudhibitiwa na sheria za mitaa ambazo zinakusudiwa kumlinda mtoto ambaye hajazaliwa, lakini ambayo pia inaweza kutoa maelewano kati ya maoni yanayopingana ambayo yanazunguka operesheni yao. Mfano fulani wa hii ni udhibiti ambao mara nyingi huwekwa kwa idadi ya watoto ambao wafadhili mmoja anaweza baba na ambayo inaweza kubuniwa kulinda dhidi ya uboreshaji. Walakini, sheria kama hizo kawaida haziwezi kuzuia benki ya manii kusambaza manii ya wafadhili nje ya mamlaka ambayo inafanya kazi, na wala haiwezi kuzuia wafadhili wa manii kutoa mahali pengine wakati wa maisha yao. Kuna uhaba mkubwa wa wafadhili wa manii katika sehemu nyingi za ulimwengu na kuna shinikizo dhahiri kutoka kwa robo nyingi kwa manii ya wafadhili kutoka kwa wale walio tayari na kuweza kuipatia kupatikana kwa usalama na kwa uhuru iwezekanavyo.
neg_context_title_src: Sheria za uchangiaji wa manii na nchi
Sheria za uchangiaji wa manii na nchi
neg_context_src: Katika Israeli, mchango wa manii umeamriwa na Wizara ya Afya. Kuna benki 12 za manii zilizoidhinishwa na hospitali kote nchini, na 2 zaidi katika vituo vya utafiti vya kibinafsi. Wanaume ambao hawajaoa tu, wenye afya chini ya umri wa miaka 30 wanaruhusiwa kutoa manii, na wanalipwa kifedha kwa hiyo. Wanaume ambao wanataka kuchangia lazima wafike hospitalini, kupitisha mahojiano na ukaguzi wa damu. Pia ni marufuku kutoa manii katika benki zaidi ya manii. Mwishowe, kutokujulikana huhifadhiwa kwa muda usiojulikana; Mfadhili hatapokea habari kuhusu watoto, na kinyume chake.

Idadi ya watoto wanaoruhusiwa kutoka kwa wafadhili mmoja hutofautiana na sheria na mazoezi. Sheria hizi zimetengenezwa kulinda watoto wanaozalishwa na mchango wa manii na vile vile watoto wa asili wa wafadhili kutoka kwa maisha ya baadaye: hawakusudiwa kulinda wafadhili na wale wanaotoa manii watajua kuwa michango yao inaweza kusababisha ujauzito kadhaa katika mamlaka tofauti. Sheria kama hizo, ambapo zipo, zinatofautiana kutoka kwa mamlaka hadi mamlaka, na benki ya manii inaweza pia kuweka mipaka yake. Mwisho huo utatokana na ripoti za ujauzito ambazo benki ya manii hupokea, ingawa hii inategemea usahihi wa mapato na idadi halisi ya ujauzito inaweza kuwa ya juu zaidi. Walakini, benki za manii mara nyingi huweka kikomo cha chini kwa idadi ya kijiografia kuliko mamlaka fulani na pia inaweza kupunguza idadi ya jumla ya ujauzito unaoruhusiwa kutoka kwa wafadhili mmoja. Kizuizi juu ya idadi ya watoto ambayo manii ya wafadhili inaweza kutoa kawaida huonyeshwa kwa suala la 'familia', kwa matarajio kwamba watoto ndani ya familia ni marufuku kutoka kwa uhusiano wa kijinsia chini ya sheria za uchumba. Kwa kweli, neno "familia" linamaanisha "mwanamke" na kawaida linajumuisha mwenzi wa wafadhili au mwenzi wa zamani, ili michango mingi kwa mwanamke huyo huyo haihesabiwi kwa kikomo. Mipaka kawaida inatumika ndani ya mamlaka moja, ili manii ya wafadhili iweze kutumiwa katika mamlaka zingine. Hakuna kikomo juu ya idadi ya michango ambayo inaweza kufanywa kwa mwanamke yule yule.

Ukuaji wa benki za manii na kliniki za uzazi, utumiaji wa mashirika ya manii na kupatikana kwa manii ya wafadhili wasiojulikana wamefanya kazi ya kutoa mchango wa manii kuwa na heshima zaidi, na kwa hivyo utaratibu unaokubalika zaidi wa kijamii. Uingiliaji wa madaktari na wengine unaweza kuonekana kama kufanya mchakato mzima kuwa wa heshima na utaratibu wa matibabu ambao hauzuilii maswala ya maadili, ambapo wafadhili wanaweza kutajwa kama 'matibabu' na watoto wafadhili kama 'kusababisha utumiaji wa manii ya wafadhili', au 'kuzaliwa kwa mchango' na watoto wanaofuata wanaweza kuelezewa kama 'mzaliwa wa watoto' badala ya watoto sawa.

Sheria za michango ya manii hutofautiana na nchi. Nchi nyingi zina sheria juu ya mchango wa manii na mipaka ya mahali juu ya watoto wafadhili wa manii anaweza kutoa. Sheria zingine ni pamoja na marufuku juu ya matumizi ya shahawa wa wafadhili baada ya wafadhili kufariki, au malipo kwa wafadhili wa manii. Sheria zingine zinaweza kuzuia utumiaji wa manii ya wafadhili kwa matibabu ya mbolea ya vitro (IVF), ambayo yenyewe inaweza kupigwa marufuku au kuzuiliwa kwa njia fulani, kama vile wenzi wa ndoa ya jinsia moja, kupiga marufuku matibabu kama hayo kwa wanawake au wenzi wa jinsia moja.

Mfadhili wa manii kwa ujumla hajakusudiwa kuwa baba wa kisheria au "de jure" anayezalishwa kutoka kwa manii yake. Sheria inaweza hata hivyo, kufanya athari katika uhusiano na baba wa kisheria au kutokuwepo kwa baba. Sheria inaweza pia kudhibiti mchakato wa uzazi kupitia mchango wa manii katika kliniki ya uzazi. Inaweza kutoa kifungu ikiwa wafadhili wa manii anaweza kuwa asiyejulikana au la, na inaweza kumpa mfadhili wa watu wazima kuwa na haki ya kufuatilia baba yake wa kibaolojia. Ambapo manii hutolewa kwa kuingizwa kwa asili, i.e. ambapo wafadhili ana uhusiano wa kimapenzi na mwanamke mpokeaji, sheria katika kila nchi itatoa kila wakati kwamba mwanaume ni baba wa mtoto yeyote anayezalisha, hata ambapo manii hutolewa na mtu wa tatu ambaye sio mwenzi wa kawaida wa mwanamke na mahali ambapo nia ya kusudi la kupata ujauzito.

Huko Uingereza, Kamati ya Warnock iliundwa mnamo Julai 1982 kuzingatia maswala ya michango ya manii na mbinu za kusaidia uzazi. Uingizaji wa wafadhili ulikuwa tayari unapatikana nchini Uingereza kupitia kliniki ambazo hazijasimamiwa kama BPAs. Wengi wa kliniki hizi walikuwa wameanza kutoa mchango wa manii kabla ya utumiaji wa mbinu za kufungia. 'Manii safi' ilichangiwa ili kuagiza na wafadhili wakati wa rutuba ya wagonjwa wanaohitaji matibabu. Kawaida, utasa wa mwenzi wa kiume au sterilization ilikuwa sababu ya matibabu. Mchango haukujulikana na haujadhibitiwa.

Manii inaweza kutolewa kwa umma na moja kwa moja kwa wafadhili waliokusudiwa, au kupitia benki ya manii au kliniki ya uzazi. Mchango wa manii humwezesha mwanaume kuzaa mtoto kwa wanawake wa chama cha tatu, na kwa hivyo, huwekwa kama aina ya uzazi wa mtu wa tatu. Mimba kawaida hupatikana kwa kutumia manii ya wafadhili katika mbinu za usaidizi wa kuzaa (ART) ambayo ni pamoja na kuingiza bandia (ama kwa kuingizwa kwa ndani (ICI) au kuingizwa kwa intrauterine (IUI) katika kliniki, au kuingizwa kwa ndani nyumbani). Chini ya kawaida, manii ya wafadhili inaweza kutumika katika mbolea ya vitro (IVF). Wapokeaji wa msingi wa manii ya wafadhili ni wanawake wasio na wenzi, wenzi wa jinsia moja na wenzi wa jinsia moja wanaougua utasa wa kiume.

Ambapo mfadhili huchangia manii kupitia benki ya manii, benki ya manii kwa ujumla itafanya ukaguzi kadhaa ili kuhakikisha kuwa wafadhili hutoa manii ya idadi kubwa na ubora na kwamba wafadhili ni afya na hatapita magonjwa kupitia matumizi ya manii yake. Manii ya wafadhili lazima pia iweze kuhimili mchakato wa kufungia na kuchafua muhimu ili kuhifadhi na kuweka karibiti manii. Gharama kwa benki ya manii kwa vipimo kama hivyo ni kubwa, ambayo kawaida inamaanisha kuwa kliniki zinaweza kutumia wafadhili sawa kutoa idadi ya ujauzito kwa wanawake wengi.

Manii ya wafadhili na 'matibabu ya uzazi' kwa kutumia manii ya wafadhili inaweza kupatikana katika benki ya manii au kliniki ya uzazi. Benki za manii au kliniki zinaweza kuwa chini ya kanuni za serikali au za kitaalam, pamoja na vizuizi kwa kutokujulikana kwa wafadhili na idadi ya watoto ambayo inaweza kuzalishwa, na kunaweza kuwa na ulinzi mwingine wa kisheria wa haki na majukumu ya mpokeaji na wafadhili. Baadhi ya benki za manii, ama kwa chaguo au kanuni, zinapunguza kiwango cha habari inayopatikana kwa wapokeaji wanaoweza; Tamaa ya kupata habari zaidi juu ya wafadhili ni sababu moja kwa nini wapokeaji wanaweza kuchagua kutumia wafadhili wanaojulikana au mchango wa kibinafsi (i.e. wafadhili waliotambuliwa). Walakini mawazo yanapatikana, asili na kozi ya ujauzito itakuwa sawa na ile inayopatikana na ngono, na wafadhili wa kiume atakuwa baba wa kibaolojia wa mtoto yeyote aliyezaliwa kutokana na michango yake.
report_src: Kwa ujumla mchango wa manii hupewa ulinzi fulani kupitia sheria za mitaa zinazodhibiti benki za manii, ambazo hulenga kumlinda mtoto ambaye hajazaliwa na kupunguza hatari kama vile uhusiano wa karibu wa damu kwa kuweka kikomo cha idadi ya watoto ambao wafadhili mmoja anaweza kuwapata [1]. Hata hivyo usalama si mkamilifu, kwa kuwa kanuni hizo haziwezi kuzuia benki kusambaza manii nje ya mamlaka yao wala kuzuia wafadhili kuchangia kwingineko katika maisha yao, jambo linaloweza kuongeza hatari za kimaumbile na kisheria ikiwa takwimu za watoto hazifuatiliwi ipasavyo [1]. Kwa hivyo, ingawa mifumo iliyopo inafanya mchango wa manii kuwa salama kwa kiwango kikubwa, bado kuna mapungufu yanayohitaji tahadhari na ufuatiliaji endelevu.

question_en: How many people died during The Battle of Kyongju?
pos_context_en: While this action was in progress near Yonil Airfield, the week-long battle for Hill 300 north of Kyongju came to an end. A regiment of the ROK 3rd Division captured the hill on September 11. In midafternoon the 3rd Battalion, US 19th Infantry, relieved the South Korean troops there. Scattered over Hill 300 lay 257 counted North Korean dead and great quantities of abandoned equipment and weapons, some of it American. In this fighting for Hill 300, the US 3rd Battalion, 19th Infantry, 37 men killed.
neg_context_en: In October 22, 2,000 rebels were killed in the consequent Battle of Jajak Pass, the largest battle in Gangwon Province before the Korean War. The rebels lacked guns, and they used birch branches as weapons. They also lacked pots, and cooked rice over cattle hide. Because of the narrowness of the pass, the rebels were crowded, and it was easy for Maeng's troops to fire into the camp and kill rebels. Maeng himself reports that "it was impossible to see how many died", but descendants have given an estimate of 1,800~2,000. Descendants also report that the battle continued for three or four days. The Seonang Pass was renamed Jajak Pass, because the blood made a 'Jajak' sound as it rolled down the pass.

Winfield Toll Bridge, also known as the Ross Booth Memorial Bridge, is a historic three-span cantilever Warren Truss bridge located at Winfield and Red House, Putnam County, West Virginia. It was built in 1955, and spans the Kanawha River, carrying West Virginia Route 34. The cantilever through-truss consists of two anchor spans each 245 feet in length and the main span 462 feet in length between pier center lines. The main span consists of two 128 feet, 4 inch, cantilever arms and a 205 feet, 4 inch, suspended span.

The expected North Korean attack on Kyongju, however, never came. The North Koreans turned east, crossed the highway north of the town, and headed toward Yonil Airfield. The next day the US Air Force, attacking North Korean gun positions north of Kyongju along the road, found many targets in the Kigye-Kyongju-P'ohang-dong triangle as they caught the North Koreans advancing in the open.

According to the May 18 Bereaved Family Association, at least 165 people died between May 18 and 27. Another 76 are still missing and presumed dead. Twenty-three soldiers and four policemen were killed during the uprising, including 13 soldiers killed in the friendly-fire incident between troops in Songam-dong. Figures for police casualties are likely to be higher, due to reports of several policemen being killed by soldiers for releasing captured rioters.

According to "", an estimated 100,000 people died in one of the worst factional struggles in Guangxi in January–April 1968, before Premier Zhou sent the PLA to intervene. Zheng Yi's "" alleged "systematic killing and cannibalization of individuals in the name of political revolution and 'class struggle' among the Zhuang people in Wuxuan County, Guangxi, during that period. Zheng was criticized in China for reliance on unpublished interviews and for negative portrayal of a Chinese ethnic minority, although senior party historians corroborated allegations of cannibalism. Sinologist Gang Yue questioned how "systematic" the cannibalism could have been, given the inherent factionalism of the Cultural Revolution. In "Mao's Last Revolution" (2006), MacFarquhar and Schoenhals also dispute that it was communism that compelled the Zhuang in this area towards cannibalism, noting that similar incidents occurred under pressure from the Kuomintang secret police in the republican period.

The Commission verified over 14,000 civilians were killed in the Jeju uprising (1948–49) that involved South Korean military and paramilitary units against pro-North Korean guerrillas on the island of Jeju southwest of tip of the peninsula. Although most of the fighting subsided by 1949, it continued until 1950. The Commission estimates 86% of the civilians were killed by South Korean forces. The Americans on the island documented the events, but never intervened.

On December 11, the Human Rights Watch found that 150 or more Congolese civilians had died at the hands of Congolese rebels in the town of Kiwanja. Earlier estimates had placed the death toll at 30. Mai-Mai militia, aligned with the government, had also "deliberately killed people". MONUC peacekeepers, who had been away at the time but had not been protecting it, were criticized for not supervising the town, which was one of several that had been taken over by rebel forces (another prominent one being the territorial capital of Rutshuru). The report stated that "Due to the importance of these two towns as centers for humanitarian assistance, MONUC considered them a priority protection zone, yet the peacekeepers did not protect the towns from a rebel takeover or halt the destruction of displacement camps. Nor did they stop the mass killing of civilians in Kiwanja where they had an important field base." HRW alleged that "following the Kiwanja killings, CNDP and Mai-Mai combatants continue to kill, rape, forcibly recruit children, and otherwise mistreat civilians in and around Kiwanja, the neighbouring town of Rutshuru, and in areas further north." Also, it reported another "18 deliberate killings in November and December perpetrated by the CNDP, the Mai-Mai and their allies", and received reports of "another 25 deaths, although ongoing insecurity has made it impossible to verify all such information."

The following morning the Australians remained in position, and at daybreak they found more than 150 North Korean dead within the 3 RAR defensive position. Coad subsequently brought the Middlesex forward to secure his northern flank, while 3 RAR moved forward to the Talchon River, taking up positions in the hills overlooking Chongju by 11:00. During the advance the Australians had clashed with a number of North Korean stragglers, killing 12 and capturing 10 in skirmishes. It became clear that organised resistance had ceased however, with the successful Australian assault and the subsequent defence of its objectives the day before breaking the North Koreans locally. In the north the Middlesex pushed forward to the riverbank, while in the afternoon the Argylls forded the river with two platoons of Shermans. Meanwhile, aerial reconnaissance reported the presence of North Korean tanks to the west of Chongju. Regardless, that afternoon the Argylls encountered no further opposition as they entered and cleared the ruined and burning town, securing it by 17:00. The brigade then moved into divisional reserve for the US 24th Infantry Division, with Church ordering the US 21st Infantry Regiment to take its place in the lead in order to give the British and Australian infantry a much needed respite. The tanks and infantry of the US 21st Infantry Regiment subsequently moved through the brigade.

The Japanese had at least 1,895 men killed of an estimated 6,000 casualties. Allied casualties were 1,111 men killed, 1,167 missing and 1,362 wounded. Allied dead, including British, Canadian and Indian soldiers, were eventually interred at Sai Wan Military Cemetery and the Stanley Military Cemetery. C Force casualties in the battle were 23 officers and 267 other ranks killed or died of wounds, including five officers and 16 other ranks of the brigade headquarters, seven officers and 123 men of the Royal Rifles and 11 officers and 128 men of the Winnipeg Grenadiers. C Force also had 28 officers and 465 men wounded. Some of the dead were murdered by Japanese soldiers during or after surrender. Japanese soldiers committed a number of atrocities on 19 December, when the aid post at the Salesian Mission near Sau Ki Wan was overrun. A total of 1,528 soldiers, mainly Commonwealth (predominantly Indians and Canadians), are either buried or commemorated there. There are also graves of other Allied combatants who died in the region during the war, including some Dutch sailors who were re-interred in Hong Kong after the war.
question_src: Ni watu wangapi walikufa wakati wa vita vya Kyongju?
pos_context_src: Wakati hatua hii ilikuwa inaendelea karibu na uwanja wa ndege wa Yonil, vita vya wiki nzima kwa Hill 300 kaskazini mwa Kyongju vilimalizika. Kikosi cha Idara ya 3 ya ROK kiliteka kilima mnamo Septemba 11. Katikati ya miaka ya 3, Kikosi cha 3, watoto wachanga wa 19, waliwaondoa askari wa Korea Kusini hapo. Iliyotawanyika juu ya Hill 300 iliyowekwa 257 iliyohesabiwa Korea Kaskazini iliyokufa na idadi kubwa ya vifaa na silaha zilizotengwa, zingine ni za Amerika. Katika mapigano haya kwa Hill 300, Kikosi cha 3 cha Amerika, watoto wachanga wa 19, wanaume 37 waliuawa.
neg_context_src: Mnamo Oktoba 22, waasi 2000 waliuawa katika vita vya Jajak Pass, vita kubwa zaidi katika mkoa wa Gangwon kabla ya Vita vya Korea. Waasi walikosa bunduki, na walitumia matawi ya birch kama silaha. Pia walikosa sufuria, na walipika mchele juu ya ngozi ya ng'ombe. Kwa sababu ya kupunguka kwa kupita, waasi walikuwa wamejaa, na ilikuwa rahisi kwa askari wa Maeng kuwasha moto ndani ya kambi na kuua waasi. Maeng mwenyewe anaripoti kwamba "haikuwezekana kuona ni wangapi walikufa", lakini wazao wametoa makisio ya 1,800 ~ 2000. Descendants pia wanaripoti kwamba vita iliendelea kwa siku tatu au nne. Pass ya Seonang ilipewa jina la Jajak Pass, kwa sababu damu ilifanya sauti ya 'jajak' wakati ikizunguka kupita.

Winfield Toll Bridge, pia inajulikana kama Ross Booth Memorial Bridge, ni kihistoria wa kihistoria wa Cantilever Warren Truss Bridge iliyoko Winfield na Red House, Kaunti ya Putnam, West Virginia. Ilijengwa mnamo 1955, na inachukua Mto wa Kanawha, iliyobeba West Virginia Route 34. Cantilever kupitia-truss ina nafasi mbili za nanga kila futi 245 kwa urefu na urefu wa futi 462 kwa urefu kati ya mistari ya kituo cha pier. Span kuu ina futi mbili 128, inchi 4, mikono ya cantilever na miguu 205, inchi 4, iliyosimamishwa.

Shambulio linalotarajiwa la Korea Kaskazini kwa Kyongju, hata hivyo, halikuja kamwe. Wakorea wa Kaskazini waligeuka mashariki, walivuka barabara kuu kaskazini mwa mji, na kuelekea Yonil Airfield. Siku iliyofuata Jeshi la Anga la Amerika, kushambulia nafasi za bunduki za Korea Kaskazini kaskazini mwa Kyongju kando ya barabara, walipata malengo mengi katika pembetatu ya Kigye-Kyongju-P'ohang-Dong wakati walipowakamata Wakorea wa Kaskazini wakiendelea wazi.

Kulingana na Chama cha Familia cha Mei 18, watu wasiopungua 165 walikufa kati ya Mei 18 na 27. Wengine 76 bado wanakosekana na kudhaniwa kuwa wamekufa. Askari ishirini na tatu na polisi wanne waliuawa wakati wa ghasia, pamoja na askari 13 waliouawa katika tukio la moto kati ya askari huko Songam-Dong. Takwimu za majeruhi wa polisi zinaweza kuwa kubwa, kwa sababu ya ripoti za polisi kadhaa kuuawa na askari kwa kuwaachilia waandamanaji waliotekwa.

Kulingana na "", inakadiriwa kuwa watu 100,000 walikufa katika moja ya mapambano mabaya kabisa huko Guangxi mnamo Januari -Aprili 1968, kabla ya Waziri Mkuu Zhou kupeleka PLA kuingilia kati. "" "" " Cannibalism inaweza kuwa, kwa sababu ya asili ya mapinduzi ya kitamaduni.

Tume hiyo ilithibitisha zaidi ya raia 14,000 waliuawa katika Jeju Upprising (1948-49) ambayo ilihusisha vitengo vya jeshi la Korea Kusini na vitengo dhidi ya waandamanaji wa Korea Kaskazini kwenye kisiwa cha Jeju Kusini magharibi mwa Peninsula. Ingawa mapigano mengi yalipungua mnamo 1949, iliendelea hadi 1950. Tume inakadiria asilimia 86 ya raia waliuawa na vikosi vya Korea Kusini. Wamarekani kwenye kisiwa hicho waliandika matukio hayo, lakini hawakuwahi kuingilia kati.

Mnamo Desemba 11, saa ya haki za binadamu iligundua kuwa raia 150 au zaidi wa Kongo walikuwa wamekufa mikononi mwa waasi wa Kongo katika mji wa Kiwanja. Makadirio ya mapema yalikuwa yameweka idadi ya vifo saa 30. Wanamgambo wa Mai-Mai, walioambatana na serikali, pia walikuwa "waliwauwa watu kwa makusudi". Walinda amani wa MONUC, ambao walikuwa mbali wakati huo lakini hawakuwa wanalinda, walikosolewa kwa kutosimamia mji, ambayo ilikuwa moja ya kadhaa ambayo ilichukuliwa na vikosi vya waasi (mwingine maarufu kuwa mji mkuu wa Rutshuru). Ripoti hiyo ilisema kwamba "kwa sababu ya umuhimu wa miji hii miwili kama vituo vya msaada wa kibinadamu, MONUC aliwachukulia kama eneo la ulinzi wa kipaumbele, lakini walinda amani hawakuwalinda miji kutokana na kuchukua kwa waasi au kusimamisha uharibifu wa kambi za kuhamishwa. Wala hawakuzuia mauaji ya raia huko Kiwanja ambapo walikuwa na uwanja muhimu." HRW ilidai kwamba "kufuatia mauaji ya Kiwanja, CNDP na wapiganaji wa Mai-Mai wanaendelea kuua, ubakaji, kwa nguvu watoto, na vinginevyo kuwadhulumu raia ndani na karibu na Kiwanja, mji wa jirani wa Rutshuru, na katika maeneo zaidi kaskazini." Pia, iliripoti "mauaji mengine 18 ya makusudi mnamo Novemba na Desemba yalifanywa na CNDP, Mai-Mai na washirika wao", na walipokea ripoti za "vifo vingine 25, ingawa ukosefu wa usalama unaoendelea umefanya iwezekani kuthibitisha habari zote hizo."

Asubuhi iliyofuata Waaustralia walibaki katika nafasi, na wakati wa mapambazuko walipata zaidi ya 150 Korea Kaskazini wakiwa wamekufa ndani ya nafasi 3 ya kujihami ya RAR. Coad baadaye ilileta Middlesex mbele ili kupata ubao wake wa kaskazini, wakati 3 Rar alisogea mbele kwenye Mto wa Talchon, akichukua nafasi katika vilima vinavyozunguka Chongju ifikapo 11:00. Wakati wa mapema Waaustralia walikuwa wamegongana na idadi ya wagombea wa Korea Kaskazini, na kuua 12 na kukamata 10 kwa skirmishes. Ilibainika kuwa upinzani ulioandaliwa ulikuwa umekoma, na shambulio la Australia lililofanikiwa na utetezi wa baadaye wa malengo yake siku moja kabla ya kuvunja Wakorea wa Kaskazini ndani. Katika kaskazini Middlesex ilisukuma mbele kwa mto wa mto, wakati alasiri Argylls walipanda mto na vijiko viwili vya Shermans. Wakati huo huo, uchunguzi wa angani uliripoti uwepo wa mizinga ya Korea Kaskazini magharibi mwa Chongju. Bila kujali, alasiri hiyo Argylls hawakukutana na upinzani zaidi wakati wanaingia na kusafisha mji ulioharibiwa na unaowaka, ukipata ifikapo 17:00. Brigade basi ilihamia katika akiba ya Idara ya watoto wachanga wa 24, na kanisa likiamuru Kikosi cha watoto wachanga cha 21 kuchukua nafasi yake katika kuongoza ili kuwapa watoto wachanga wa Uingereza na Australia kuhitajika sana. Mizinga na watoto wachanga wa Kikosi cha watoto wachanga cha 21 cha Amerika baadaye kilihamia kupitia Brigade.

Wajapani walikuwa na watu wasiopungua 1,895 waliouawa kwa takriban majeruhi 6,000. Majeruhi wa Allies walikuwa wanaume 1,111 waliuawa, 1,167 walikosa na 1,362 walijeruhiwa. Washirika waliokufa, pamoja na askari wa Uingereza, Canada na India, mwishowe waliingiliwa kwenye kaburi la jeshi la Sai Wan na kaburi la jeshi la Stanley. C Kikosi cha vikosi katika vita walikuwa maafisa 23 na safu zingine 267 waliuawa au kufa kwa majeraha, kutia ndani maafisa watano na safu zingine 16 za makao makuu ya Brigade, maafisa saba na wanaume 123 wa Rifles wa Royal na maafisa 11 na wanaume 128 wa Winnipeg Grenadiers. C Nguvu pia ilikuwa na maafisa 28 na wanaume 465 walijeruhiwa. Baadhi ya wafu waliuawa na askari wa Japani wakati wa kujisalimisha au baada ya kujisalimisha. Askari wa Japani walifanya dhuluma kadhaa mnamo Desemba 19, wakati Msaada wa Msaada katika Ujumbe wa Salesian karibu na Sau Ki Wan ulizidiwa. Jumla ya askari 1,528, haswa Jumuiya ya Madola (Wahindi wengi na Canada), wamezikwa au kukumbukwa huko. Kuna pia makaburi ya wapiganaji wengine washirika ambao walikufa katika mkoa huo wakati wa vita, pamoja na mabaharia wengine wa Uholanzi ambao waliingizwa tena huko Hong Kong baada ya vita.
report_src: Katika mapigano ya Kilima 300 ambayo yalikuwa sehemu kuu ya Vita vya Kyongju, wanajeshi 257 wa Korea Kaskazini waliuawa na, upande wa Umoja wa Mataifa, wanajeshi 37 wa Kikosi cha 3 cha Marekani cha Jeshi la Miguu (19th Infantry) waliangamia, hivyo idadi ya vifo vilivyothibitishwa kufikia 294 [1].
all_claims: Katika mapigano ya Kilima 300 ambayo yalikuwa sehemu kuu ya Vita vya Kyongju, wanajeshi 257 wa Korea Kaskazini waliuawa na, upande wa Umoja wa Mataifa, wanajeshi 37 wa Kikosi cha 3 cha Marekani cha Jeshi la Miguu (19th Infantry) waliangamia, hivyo idadi ya vifo vilivyothibitishwa kufikia 294 [1].
