question_en: When was the Game Show Network created?
pos_context_en: Game Show Network launched at 7:00 p.m. ET on December 1, 1994. The first aired game show was "What's My Line?". From 1994 until about 1997, the network aired classic pre-1972 game shows as well as game shows made after 1972, most of which came from the Mark Goodson–Bill Todman library. The network aired game shows in a 24-hour cycle, and also used live interstitials as wraparound programming. In its first few months, GSN's commercials consisted of public service announcements (PSAs), promotions for its programming and commercials related to network parent company Sony. By 1995, when the network began to expand, the network began accepting conventional advertising as it gained new sponsorships. On March 17, 1997, the Game Show Network rebranded with a new presentation package and a new logo (which had the network's name in boxes and a colorful swirling ball) and a new slogan "All Play, All Day". While the logo changed, its programming remained unchanged, the network also debuted new promos and new idents on that day, which were designed by graphics agency Lee Hunt Associates.
neg_context_en: On April 18, 1998, Game Show Network bought back the rights to the Goodson-Todman library. In late 1998, GSN eliminated all of its live programming, replacing them with in-show advertisements like "Win TV". In 1999, the network began a slate of original programming, including "Inquizition", "All New 3's a Crowd", and "Hollywood Showdown". The channel also launched original shows such as "Extreme Gong" (a remake of the classic "Gong Show"). In 2000, the network faced another setback when GSN lost the rights to broadcast "The Price Is Right", with the last episode airing on April 3 of that year.

"The Line" was first mentioned March 18, 2014 at Game Show Network's (GSN's) 2014−15 upfront presentation in New York City. The series, created by ITV Studios, was green-lit on July 15, 2014, with Davis and Bailey being announced as co-hosts of the show. When discussing the show's format, GSN's Executive Vice President of programming and development Amy Introcaso-Davis explained, "We have taken something most people dislike – waiting in line – and turned it into the most fun you have ever had, with cash, prizes and 500 new friends."

In the fall of 2003, Game Show Network picked up the rights to the ABC version of "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire" with Regis Philbin, and in December, began airing "GSN Video Games", the first program to air on the network that had nothing to do with traditional game shows. Although the show - a repackaging of somewhat dated British video game review shows (mostly Gamer.tv) - was short-lived, it was a sign of the network's change of format from Game Show Network's "all game shows, all the time" to what eventually became "GSN: The Network for Games". Its last program using Game Show Network was "Lingo".

The next year Barris began "The Newlywed Game", originally created by Nick Nicholson and E. Roger Muir, also for ABC. The combination of the newlywed couples' humorous candor and host Bob Eubanks's sly questioning made the show another hit for Barris. The show is the longest lasting of any developed by his company, broadcast until 1985, for a total of 19 full years on both "first run" network TV and syndication. Game Show Network airs a current version with Sherri Shepherd. Interviewed on the NPR program "Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!" on August 1, 2009, Barris said that "The Newlywed Game" was the easiest program he had developed: "All I needed was four couples, eight questions, and a washer-dryer."

The networks that broadcast the NFL were the first networks to create and air pre-game shows. CBS was the first to broadcast a sports pre-game show in 1964, when the network launched a 15-minute regional sports program that interviewed players and coaches and featured news and features about the league. The show aired immediately before games on CBS. The show originated in studio and live from the fields, and featured broadcaster Jack Buck. In 1967, the show grew to 30 minutes in length and in 1976, aired a new 90-minute “Super Bowl Special” before Super Bowl X. The show moved to two hours long in 1984 and featured 11 broadcasters, 13 producers and four directors.

GSN premiered the original series "America Says", hosted by John Michael Higgins, on June 18, 2018, and the video clip game show "Caroline & Friends", hosted by actress Caroline Rhea, on July 16, 2018. On October 1, 2018, the network officially dropped the "GSN" branding, reverted its name back to Game Show Network for the first time since March 15, 2004, and introduced a new logo to coincide with the return to the Game Show Network branding.

On May 7, 1992, Sony Pictures Entertainment joined forces with the United Video Satellite Group to launch Game Show Channel, which was set to launch in 1993. The announcement of the channel was made by SPE president Mel Harris. Sony Pictures' holdings included those by Merv Griffin Enterprises and Barris Industries, Inc. SPE was in competition with The Family Channel in launching a game show-oriented channel when The Family Channel announced the launch of its own service called Game Channel.

The network has run blocks of classic game shows on Saturday nights, and for the first few months of 2006 programmed back-to-back episodes of "Match Game" in a block billed as "That '70s Hour" (a pun on "That '70s Show"), which showed the original production slate before each episode as well as "Match Game" trivia and brief clips of an interview with host Gene Rayburn produced shortly before his death. Although production slates had been aired by the network prior to this, "That '70s Hour" was the first time the network "intentionally" did so. During the Summer of 2006, the network began a special seven-week run of "The 50 Greatest Game Shows of All Time".

On February 25, 2008, GSN returned to live television games and debuted "GSN Live", a live interactive call-in show, hosted by Heidi Bohay and Fred Roggin. The show was similar in format to a former Game Show Network program, "Club A.M.", and aired weekdays from Noon to 3:00 p.m. ET during breaks between the programming line-up at the time. The show featured calls from viewers, interviews with classic game show hosts and behind-the-scenes features of game shows. At three separate points in each day, interactive games were played with at-home contestants. Contestants could win anything from jewelry to GSN merchandise, or during month-long contests, a new car or a hot tub.
question_src: Mtandao wa onyesho la mchezo uliundwa lini?
pos_context_src: Mtandao wa onyesho la mchezo ulizinduliwa saa 7:00 p.m. ET mnamo Desemba 1, 1994. Maonyesho ya kwanza ya mchezo wa hewani yalikuwa "Je! Mstari wangu ni nini?". Kuanzia 1994 hadi karibu 1997, mtandao ulirusha maonyesho ya mchezo wa mapema wa 1972 na maonyesho ya mchezo yaliyotengenezwa baada ya 1972, ambayo mengi yalitoka kwa Maktaba ya Mark Goodson-Bill Todman. Mchezo wa kurushwa hewani unaonyesha katika mzunguko wa masaa 24, na pia ulitumia njia za moja kwa moja kama programu iliyoangaziwa. Katika miezi yake ya kwanza, matangazo ya GSN yalikuwa na Matangazo ya Huduma za Umma (PSAS), matangazo kwa programu yake na matangazo yanayohusiana na kampuni ya mzazi wa mtandao Sony. Kufikia 1995, mtandao ulipoanza kupanuka, mtandao ulianza kukubali matangazo ya kawaida kwani yalipata udhamini mpya. Mnamo Machi 17, 1997, mtandao unaonyesha mtandao uliowekwa tena na kifurushi kipya cha uwasilishaji na nembo mpya (ambayo ilikuwa na jina la mtandao kwenye masanduku na mpira wa kupendeza) na kauli mbiu mpya "All Play, Siku nzima". Wakati nembo ilibadilika, programu yake ilibaki bila kubadilika, mtandao pia ulijadili matangazo mapya na vitambulisho vipya siku hiyo, ambayo ilibuniwa na wakala wa michoro Lee Hunt Associates.
neg_context_src: Mnamo Aprili 18, 1998, Mtandao wa Maonyesho ya Mchezo ulinunua haki za Maktaba ya Goodson-Todman. Mwishowe 1998, GSN iliondoa programu zake zote za moja kwa moja, ikibadilisha na matangazo ya ndani kama "Win TV". Mnamo mwaka wa 1999, mtandao ulianza slate ya programu ya asili, pamoja na "Uchunguzi", "Umati wote mpya wa 3, na" Hollywood Showdown ". Kituo pia kilizindua vipindi vya asili kama "Extreme Gong" (kumbukumbu ya "show ya gong" ya kawaida). Mnamo 2000, mtandao ulikabiliwa na marudio mengine wakati GSN ilipoteza haki ya kutangaza "Bei ni sawa", na sehemu ya mwisho ya kuangazia Aprili 3 ya mwaka huo.

"Mstari" ulitajwa kwa mara ya kwanza Machi 18, 2014 katika mchezo wa Mtandao wa Show (GSN's) 2014−15 katika New York City. Mfululizo huo, ulioundwa na ITV Studios, ulikuwa kijani-kijani mnamo Julai 15, 2014, na Davis na Bailey wakitangazwa kama washirika wa show. Wakati wa kujadili muundo wa onyesho, makamu wa rais mtendaji wa GSN wa Programu na Maendeleo Amy Introcaso-Davis alielezea, "Tumechukua kitu ambacho watu wengi hawapendi-wakingojea katika mstari-na tukabadilisha kuwa raha zaidi ambayo umewahi kupata, na pesa, zawadi na marafiki wapya 500."

Mnamo msimu wa 2003, Mtandao wa Maonyesho ya Mchezo ulichukua haki ya toleo la ABC la "Nani anataka kuwa milionea" na Regis Philbin, na mnamo Desemba, alianza kupeperusha "Michezo ya Video ya GSN", mpango wa kwanza wa hewa kwenye mtandao ambao haukuwa na uhusiano wowote na vipindi vya mchezo wa jadi. Ingawa onyesho - kumbukumbu ya maonyesho ya ukaguzi wa mchezo wa video wa Uingereza (zaidi ya Gamer.tv) - ilikuwa ya muda mfupi, ilikuwa ishara ya mabadiliko ya muundo wa mtandao kutoka kwa onyesho la mchezo wa mchezo wa "Maonyesho yote ya Mchezo, wakati wote" kwa ile ambayo baadaye ikawa "GSN: Mtandao wa Michezo". Programu yake ya mwisho kutumia mtandao wa onyesho la mchezo ilikuwa "Lingo".

Mwaka uliofuata Barris alianza "Mchezo mpya", ambao uliundwa na Nick Nicholson na E. Roger Muir, pia kwa ABC. Mchanganyiko wa ucheshi wa wenzi wa ndoa mpya na mwenyeji wa Bob Eubanks Sly Kuhoji alifanya onyesho lingine kwa Barris. Kipindi hicho ni cha kudumu zaidi cha yoyote iliyotengenezwa na kampuni yake, iliyotangazwa hadi 1985, kwa jumla ya miaka 19 kamili kwenye TV zote mbili za "Run Run" na ushirika. Mchezo Onyesha Mtandao Airs Toleo la sasa na Sherri Mchungaji. Alihojiwa kwenye mpango wa NPR "Subiri ... Usiniambie!" Mnamo Agosti 1, 2009, Barris alisema kwamba "mchezo mpya" ndio mpango rahisi kabisa ambao alikuwa ametengeneza: "Nilichohitaji ni wanandoa wanne, maswali nane, na kavu ya washer."

Mitandao ambayo ilitangaza NFL ilikuwa mitandao ya kwanza kuunda na maonyesho ya mchezo wa mapema. CBS ilikuwa ya kwanza kutangaza onyesho la mchezo wa kabla ya michezo mnamo 1964, wakati mtandao ulipozindua programu ya michezo ya kikanda ya dakika 15 ambayo iliwahoji wachezaji na makocha na ilionyesha habari na sifa kuhusu ligi. Kipindi kilirushwa mara moja kabla ya michezo kwenye CBS. Kipindi hicho kilitokea katika studio na kuishi kutoka shambani, na alionyesha mtangazaji Jack Buck. Mnamo 1967, onyesho lilikua hadi dakika 30 kwa urefu na mnamo 1976, lilirusha dakika mpya 90 "Super Bowl Special" kabla ya Super Bowl X. Maonyesho hayo yalisonga hadi masaa mawili mnamo 1984 na kuonyesha watangazaji 11, wazalishaji 13 na wakurugenzi wanne.

GSN ilichangia mfululizo wa awali "Amerika inasema", iliyohudhuriwa na John Michael Higgins, mnamo Juni 18, 2018, na mchezo wa video wa video "Caroline & Marafiki", uliyoshikiliwa na mwigizaji Caroline Rhea, mnamo Julai 16, 2018. Mnamo Oktoba 1, mtandao wa kwanza iliongezeka kwa muda wa kuanzishwa kwa tarehe 5, tarehe ya kuanzishwa kwa tarehe ya kwanza. Sanjari na kurudi kwa chapa ya mchezo wa onyesho la mchezo.

Mnamo Mei 7, 1992, Burudani ya Picha ya Sony ilijiunga na vikosi na Kikundi cha Satellite cha United ili kuzindua Kituo cha Maonyesho ya Mchezo, ambacho kiliwekwa kuzinduliwa mnamo 1993. Matangazo ya kituo hicho yalifanywa na Rais wa SPE Mel Harris. Holdings za Picha za Sony ni pamoja na zile za Merv Griffin Enterprise na Barris Viwanda, Inc SPE ilikuwa kwenye mashindano na kituo cha familia katika kuzindua kituo kilichoelekezwa kwenye mchezo wakati kituo cha familia kilitangaza kuzinduliwa kwa huduma yake inayoitwa Game Channel.

Mtandao umeendesha vizuizi vya maonyesho ya mchezo wa kawaida Jumamosi usiku, na kwa miezi michache ya kwanza ya 2006 iliyopangwa sehemu za nyuma za "mchezo wa mechi" kwenye kizuizi kilichochapishwa kama "saa 70s" (pun kwenye "Hiyo '70s Show"), ambayo ilionyesha utengenezaji wa asili kabla ya kila sehemu ya "mahojiano" ya kwanza na mahojiano. Ingawa slate za uzalishaji zilirushwa na mtandao kabla ya hii, "kwamba saa 70s" ilikuwa mara ya kwanza mtandao "kwa makusudi" kufanya hivyo. Wakati wa msimu wa joto wa 2006, mtandao ulianza kukimbia maalum kwa wiki saba ya "Maonyesho ya Mchezo Mkubwa zaidi ya Wakati wote".

Mnamo Februari 25, 2008, GSN ilirudi kwenye michezo ya runinga moja kwa moja na kujadiliwa "GSN Live", onyesho la moja kwa moja la simu, lililohudhuriwa na Heidi Bohay na Fred Roggin. Kipindi hicho kilikuwa sawa katika muundo wa programu ya zamani ya mchezo wa show, "Club A.M.", na siku za wiki zilizorushwa kutoka saa sita hadi 3:00 p.m. ET wakati wa mapumziko kati ya safu ya programu wakati huo. Kipindi kilionyesha simu kutoka kwa watazamaji, mahojiano na majeshi ya onyesho la mchezo wa kawaida na sifa za nyuma za maonyesho ya mchezo. Katika alama tatu tofauti katika kila siku, michezo inayoingiliana ilichezwa na wagombea wa nyumbani. Wagombea wanaweza kushinda chochote kutoka kwa vito vya mapambo hadi bidhaa za GSN, au wakati wa mashindano ya mwezi mzima, gari mpya au bomba la moto.
report_src: Mtandao wa onyesho la mchezo (Game Show Network) uliundwa na kuzinduliwa rasmi saa 7:00 jioni ET mnamo 1 Desemba 1994 [1].
all_claims: Mtandao wa onyesho la mchezo (Game Show Network) uliundwa na kuzinduliwa rasmi saa 7:00 jioni ET mnamo 1 Desemba 1994 [1].
claims_w_citations: Mtandao wa onyesho la mchezo (Game Show Network) uliundwa na kuzinduliwa rasmi saa 7:00 jioni ET mnamo 1 Desemba 1994 [1].
claims_retained: Mtandao wa onyesho la mchezo (Game Show Network) uliundwa na kuzinduliwa rasmi saa 7:00 jioni ET mnamo 1 Desemba 1994 [1].

question_en: What year were specialty drugs designated?
pos_context_title_en: Specialty drugs in the United States
pos_context_en: Specialty drugs or specialty pharmaceuticals are a recent designation of pharmaceuticals that are classified as high-cost, high complexity and/or high touch. Specialty drugs are often biologics—"drugs derived from living cells" that are injectable or infused (although some are oral medications). They are used to treat complex or rare chronic conditions such as cancer, rheumatoid arthritis, hemophilia, H.I.V. psoriasis, inflammatory bowel disease and hepatitis C. In 1990 there were 10 specialty drugs on the market, in the mid-1990s there were fewer than 30, by 2008 there were 200, and by 2015 there were 300. Drugs are often defined as specialty because their price is much higher than that of non-specialty drugs. Medicare defines any drug for which the negotiated price is $670 per month or more, as a specialty drug which is placed in a specialty tier that requires a higher patient cost sharing. Drugs are also identified as specialty when there is a special handling requirement or the drug is only available via a limited distributions network. By 2015 "specialty medications accounted for one-third of all spending on drugs in the United States, up from 19 percent in 2004 and heading toward 50 percent in the next 10 years", according to IMS Health, which tracks prescriptions. According to a 2010 article in Forbes, specialty drugs for rare diseases became more expensive "than anyone imagined" and their success came "at a time when the traditional drug business of selling medicines to the masses" was "in decline". In 2015 analysis by "The Wall Street Journal" suggested the large premium was due to the perceived value of rare disease treatments which usually are very expensive when compared to treatments for more common diseases.

neg_context_en: On September 27, 2007 President George W. Bush amended the Food and Drug Administration Amendments Act of 2007 (FDAAA) to authorize the FDA to require Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies (REMS) on medications if necessary to minimize the risks associated with some drugs". These medications were designated as specialty drugs and required specialty pharmacies. When the FDA approves a new drug they may require a REMS program which "may contain any combination of 5 criteria: Medication Guide, Communication Plan, Elements to Assure Safe Use, Implementation System, and Timetable for Submission of Assessments". "In 2010, 48% of all new molecular entities, and 60% of all new specialty drug approvals, required a REMS program." Risk-reduction mechanisms can include the "use of specialized distribution partners", special pharmacy.

In 1991 the FDA approved the first version of Genzyme's orphan drug Alglucerase (brand name Ceredase), the only treatment for Gaucher's disease. At that time, according to Genzyme CEO Henri Termeer — a pioneer in the biotechnology industry business model — one treatment of Ceredase for one patient took 22,000 placentas annually to manufacture, a difficult and expensive procedure. A new version of Ceredase, called Cerezyme, Imiglucerase which Genzyme produced in 1994 using genetically modified cells in vitro, was cheaper and easier to produce, was approved in several countries. In 2005 there were only about 4,500 patients on Cerezyme. In marketing imiglucerase, Termeer introduced the innovative and successful business strategy that became a model for the biotechnology or life sciences industry in general and specialty pharmacy in particular. Genzyme's added revenue from profits on the highly priced orphan or specialty drugs like imiglucerase, which had no competition, was used to undertake research and development for other drugs and to allow them to fund programs that distribute a small portion of production for free. In 2005 he then created what would eventually become a feature service of specialty pharmacy, by hiring 34 people to help patients acquire insurance plans that would cover the cost of their drugs. By 2005 although Cerezyme cost the average patient (including babies) $200,000 a year, it could cost a single adult patient as much as $520,000 a year even though it cost Genzyme less than $52,000 to manufacture, because the alternative is severe debilitation and early death. In 2005 there were only about 4,500 patients on Cerezyme.

Specialty drugs may also be designated as orphan drugs or ultra-orphan drugs under the U. S. Orphan Drug Act of 1983. This was enacted to facilitate development of orphan drugs—drugs for rare diseases such as Huntington's disease, myoclonus, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, Tourette syndrome and muscular dystrophy which affect small numbers of individuals residing in the United States.

In 2003 the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act was enacted—the largest overhaul of Medicare in the public health program's 38-year history—included Medicare Part D an entitlement benefit for prescription drugs, through tax breaks and subsidies. In 2004 the U. S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) prepared a report on final guidance regarding access to drug coverage enacted under in which they included the specialty drugs tier in the prescription drug formulary. At that time CMS guidelines included four tiers: tier 1 includes preferred generics, tier 2 includes preferred brands, tier 3 includes non-preferred brands and generics and tier 4 included specialty drugs. By January 1, 2006, the controversial Medicare Part D was put in effect. It was a massive expansion of the federal government's provision of prescription drug coverage to previously uninsured Americans, particularly seniors. In 2006 in the United States there was no standard nomenclature, so sellers could call the plan anything they wanted and cover whatever drugs they wanted.

On February 3, 2015 New York-based Pfizer's drug Ibrance was approved through the FDA's Breakthrough Therapy designation program as a treatment for advanced breast cancer. It can only be ordered through specialty pharmacies and sells for "$9,850 for a month or $118,200 per year". According to a statement by the New York-based Pfizer the price "is not the cost that most patients or payors pay" since most prescriptions are dispensed through health plans, which negotiate discounts for medicines or get government-mandated price concessions.

In 2013 the FDA introduced the breakthrough therapy designation program which cut the development process of new therapies by several years. This meant that the FDA could "introduce important medicines to the market based on very promising phase 2 rather than phase 3 clinical trial results". Shortly after the law was enacted, Ivacaftor, in January 2013, became the first drug to receive the breakthrough therapy designation.

When Randy Vogenberg of the Institute for Integrated Healthcare in Massachusetts and a co-leader of the Midwest Business Group initiative, began investigating specialty drugs in 2003, it "wasn't showing up on the radar". By 2009 specialty drugs had started doubling in cost and payers such as employers began to question. Vogenberg observed that by 2014 health care reform had changed the landscape for specialty drugs. There is a shift away from a marketplace based on a predominately clinical perspective, to one that puts economics first and clinical second.

2010 marked the 50th anniversary of the first publication of "CPS" (although not the 50th edition—there were some years in which "CPS" was not published). "CPS" has been published annually since 1967. There have been numerous changes and additions to "CPS" over the years including the first French edition in 1968, a move from hard-cover to soft-cover in 1981, and the introduction of e-CPS in 2004. With each passing year there are more drug monographs and information in "CPS", which has resulted in a steadily increasing volume size. Sales have continued to grow as "CPS" remains the most comprehensive and frequently used reference for safely and accurately prescribing drugs in Canada.

In 1992 Stadtlanders Pharmacy — a subsidiary of Bergen Brunswig Corporation — was a grassroots company in Pittsburgh that occupied one floor of a seven-story office building and had only a handful of employees and sold drugs by mail-order to patients with chronic conditions with "higher-than-average prescription prices". In 1992 this included "ancillary to primary therapy to manage side effects, as well as HIV, transplant, and a new growth area, multiple sclerosis (MS)." By 1995 Stadtlanders added others, including growth hormones. Compared to retail drugstores that dealt in high volumes of lower margin drugs, Stadtlanders successful business model focused on lower volumes of higher priced drugs resulting in "healthier revenues." By about 1995 there were fewer than 30 specialty drugs on the market.

Not all specialty drugs are orphan drugs. According to Thomson Reuters in their 2012 publication "The Economic Power of Orphan Drugs", there has been increased investing in orphan drug research and development partly since the U.S. Congress enacted the Orphan Drug Act, giving an extra monopoly for drugs for "orphan diseases" that affected fewer than 200,000 people in the country. Similar acts came into existence in other regions of the world, many driven by "high-profile philanthropic funding". According to a 2010 article in "Forbes", prior to 1983 drug companies largely ignored rare diseases and focused on drugs that affected millions of patients.
question_src: Je! Dawa za utaalam ziliteuliwa mwaka gani?
pos_context_src: Dawa maalum au dawa maalum ni jina la hivi karibuni la dawa ambazo zimeorodheshwa kama gharama kubwa, ugumu wa juu na/au kugusa kwa hali ya juu. Dawa maalum mara nyingi ni biolojia - "dawa zinazotokana na seli hai" ambazo zinaweza kuingizwa au kuingizwa (ingawa zingine ni dawa za mdomo). Zinatumika kutibu hali ngumu au adimu kama saratani, ugonjwa wa arheumatoid arthritis, hemophilia, H.I.V. Psoriasis, ugonjwa wa matumbo ya uchochezi na hepatitis C. Mnamo 1990 kulikuwa na dawa maalum za soko, katikati ya miaka ya 1990 kulikuwa na chini ya 30, kufikia 2008 kulikuwa na 200, na kufikia 2015 kulikuwa na dawa 300. Mara nyingi hufafanuliwa kama utaalam kwa sababu bei yao ni kubwa zaidi kuliko ile ya dawa zisizo za utambuzi. Medicare inafafanua dawa yoyote ambayo bei iliyojadiliwa ni $ 670 kwa mwezi au zaidi, kama dawa maalum ambayo imewekwa kwenye tier maalum ambayo inahitaji kugawana gharama ya mgonjwa. Dawa za kulevya pia zinatambuliwa kama maalum wakati kuna mahitaji maalum ya utunzaji au dawa inapatikana tu kupitia mtandao mdogo wa usambazaji. Kufikia mwaka 2015 "Dawa maalum ziligundua theluthi moja ya matumizi yote kwenye dawa za kulevya nchini Merika, kutoka asilimia 19 mnamo 2004 na kuelekea asilimia 50 katika miaka 10 ijayo", kulingana na IMS Health, ambayo inafuatilia maagizo. Kulingana na nakala ya 2010 huko Forbes, dawa maalum za magonjwa adimu zikawa ghali zaidi "kuliko mtu yeyote alivyofikiria" na mafanikio yao yalikuja "wakati ambao biashara ya jadi ya kuuza dawa kwa mashehe" ilikuwa "kupungua". Mnamo mwaka wa 2015 uchambuzi wa "Jarida la Wall Street" ulipendekeza malipo makubwa yalitokana na thamani ya matibabu ya magonjwa ambayo kawaida ni ghali sana ikilinganishwa na matibabu ya magonjwa ya kawaida.
neg_context_src: Mnamo Septemba 27, 2007 Rais George W. Bush alirekebisha Sheria ya Marekebisho ya Utawala wa Chakula na Dawa ya 2007 (FDAAA) kuidhinisha FDA kuhitaji tathmini ya hatari na mikakati ya kupunguza (REMs) juu ya dawa ikiwa ni lazima kupunguza hatari zinazohusiana na dawa zingine. ya vigezo 5: mwongozo wa dawa, mpango wa mawasiliano, vitu vya kuhakikisha matumizi salama, mfumo wa utekelezaji, na ratiba ya uwasilishaji wa tathmini "." Mnamo mwaka wa 2010, 48% ya vyombo vyote vipya vya Masi, na 60% ya idhini zote mpya za dawa, zinahitajika mpango wa REMS. "Njia za kupunguza hatari zinaweza kujumuisha" matumizi ya washirika maalum wa usambazaji.

Mnamo 1991 FDA iliidhinisha toleo la kwanza la alglucerase ya madawa ya Orphan (jina la brand Ceredase), matibabu pekee ya ugonjwa wa Gaucher. Wakati huo, kulingana na Mkurugenzi Mtendaji wa Genzyme Henri Termeer - painia katika mfano wa biashara ya tasnia ya bioteknolojia - matibabu moja ya Ceredase kwa mgonjwa mmoja alichukua placentas 22,000 kila mwaka kutengeneza, utaratibu mgumu na wa gharama kubwa. Toleo jipya la ceredase, inayoitwa cerezyme, imiglucerase ambayo genzyme ilizalisha mnamo 1994 kwa kutumia seli zilizobadilishwa genetiki katika vitro, ilikuwa rahisi na rahisi kutengeneza, ilipitishwa katika nchi kadhaa. Mnamo 2005 kulikuwa na wagonjwa karibu 4,500 kwenye cerezyme. Katika uuzaji wa imiglucerase, Termeer alianzisha mkakati wa ubunifu na mafanikio wa biashara ambao ukawa mfano wa tasnia ya bioteknolojia au sayansi ya maisha kwa jumla na maduka ya dawa maalum. Mapato ya Genzyme yaliyoongezwa kutoka kwa faida juu ya dawa ya watoto yatima yenye bei ya juu au maalum kama imiglucerase, ambayo haikuwa na ushindani, ilitumika kufanya utafiti na maendeleo kwa dawa zingine na kuwaruhusu kufadhili mipango ambayo inasambaza sehemu ndogo ya uzalishaji bure. Mnamo 2005 basi aliunda kile ambacho baadaye kingekuwa huduma ya maduka ya dawa maalum, kwa kuajiri watu 34 kusaidia wagonjwa kupata mipango ya bima ambayo ingegharimu gharama ya dawa zao. Kufikia 2005 ingawa cerezyme ilimgharimu mgonjwa wa wastani (pamoja na watoto) $ 200,000 kwa mwaka, inaweza kugharimu mgonjwa mmoja wa watu wazima kama $ 520,000 kwa mwaka hata iligharimu Genzyme chini ya $ 52,000 kutengeneza, kwa sababu mbadala ni mjadala mkali na kifo cha mapema. Mnamo 2005 kulikuwa na wagonjwa karibu 4,500 kwenye cerezyme.

Dawa maalum zinaweza pia kuteuliwa kama dawa za watoto yatima au dawa za juu-orphan chini ya Sheria ya Dawa ya Orphan ya U. S. ya 1983. Hii ilitungwa ili kuwezesha maendeleo ya dawa za watoto yatima-dawa za kulevya kwa magonjwa adimu kama vile ugonjwa wa Huntington, myoclonus, amyotrophic sclerosis, syndrome ya umoja wa watu.

Mnamo 2003 Sheria ya Dawa ya Maagizo ya Medicare, Uboreshaji, na kisasa ilitekelezwa-mabadiliko makubwa zaidi ya Medicare katika historia ya miaka 38 ya mpango wa afya-pamoja na Medicare Sehemu D faida ya dawa ya kuagiza, kupitia mapumziko ya ushuru na ruzuku. Mnamo 2004 Vituo vya U. S. vya Huduma za Medicare na Medicaid (CMS) viliandaa ripoti juu ya mwongozo wa mwisho kuhusu upatikanaji wa chanjo ya dawa iliyotungwa chini ambayo walijumuisha tier ya dawa maalum katika mfumo wa dawa. Wakati huo miongozo ya CMS ni pamoja na tiers nne: Tier 1 ni pamoja na jenereta zinazopendekezwa, Tier 2 ni pamoja na bidhaa zinazopendelea, Tier 3 ni pamoja na chapa ambazo hazitapendezwa na jenereta na Tier 4 pamoja na dawa maalum. Kufikia Januari 1, 2006, sehemu ya Medicare ya ubishani ilitekelezwa. Ilikuwa upanuzi mkubwa wa utoaji wa serikali ya shirikisho la dawa ya dawa kwa Wamarekani ambao hawakuhifadhiwa hapo awali, haswa wazee. Mnamo 2006 huko Merika hakukuwa na nomenclature ya kawaida, kwa hivyo wauzaji wanaweza kuita mpango huo wanataka na kufunika dawa yoyote wanayotaka.

Mnamo Februari 3, 2015 New York-msingi wa dawa ya kulevya ya Pfizer ilipitishwa kupitia mpango wa uteuzi wa tiba ya FDA kama matibabu ya saratani ya matiti ya hali ya juu. Inaweza kuamuru tu kupitia maduka ya dawa maalum na kuuza kwa "$ 9,850 kwa mwezi au $ 118,200 kwa mwaka". Kulingana na taarifa ya Pfizer ya msingi wa New York bei "sio gharama ambayo wagonjwa wengi au walipaji hulipa" kwani maagizo mengi yanasambazwa kupitia mipango ya afya, ambayo inajadili punguzo la dawa au kupata makubaliano ya bei ya serikali.

Mnamo 2013 FDA ilianzisha mpango wa uteuzi wa tiba ya mafanikio ambayo ilikata mchakato wa maendeleo wa matibabu mpya kwa miaka kadhaa. Hii ilimaanisha kuwa FDA inaweza "kuanzisha dawa muhimu kwenye soko kulingana na awamu ya 2 ya kuahidi badala ya matokeo ya majaribio ya kliniki ya 3". Muda kidogo baada ya sheria kutekelezwa, Ivacaftor, mnamo Januari 2013, ikawa dawa ya kwanza kupokea uteuzi wa tiba ya mafanikio.

Wakati Randy Vogenberg wa Taasisi ya Huduma ya Afya Jumuishi huko Massachusetts na kiongozi mwenza wa mpango wa Kikundi cha Biashara cha Midwest, alianza kuchunguza dawa maalum mnamo 2003, "haikuonekana kwenye rada". Kufikia 2009 dawa za utaalam zilikuwa zimeanza kuongezeka mara mbili kwa gharama na walipa kama waajiri walianza kuhoji. Vogenberg aligundua kuwa ifikapo mwaka 2014 mageuzi ya utunzaji wa afya yalibadilisha mazingira ya dawa maalum. Kuna mabadiliko mbali na soko kulingana na mtazamo wa kliniki, kwa moja ambayo inaweka uchumi wa kwanza na kliniki ya pili.

2010 iliashiria kumbukumbu ya miaka 50 ya uchapishaji wa kwanza wa "CPS" (ingawa sio toleo la 50 - kulikuwa na miaka ambayo "CPS" haikuchapishwa). "CPS" imechapishwa kila mwaka tangu 1967. Kumekuwa na mabadiliko kadhaa na nyongeza ya "CPS" kwa miaka ikiwa ni pamoja na toleo la kwanza la Ufaransa mnamo 1968, hatua kutoka kwa kufunika ngumu hadi kufunika laini mnamo 1981, na kuanzishwa kwa E-CPS mnamo 2004. Kwa kila mwaka unaopita kuna ukubwa zaidi wa dawa za kulevya na habari katika "CPS", ambayo imesababisha kuongezeka kwa kiasi. Uuzaji umeendelea kukua kama "CPS" inabaki kuwa kumbukumbu kamili na inayotumika mara kwa mara kwa dawa za kuagiza salama na kwa usahihi nchini Canada.

Mnamo 1992 maduka ya dawa ya Stadtlanders-kampuni ndogo ya Bergen Brunswig Corporation-ilikuwa kampuni ya chini huko Pittsburgh ambayo ilichukua sakafu moja ya jengo la ofisi ya hadithi saba na ilikuwa na wafanyikazi wachache tu na kuuza dawa kwa kuagiza kwa barua kwa wagonjwa walio na hali sugu na "bei ya juu ya wastani". Mnamo 1992 hii ni pamoja na "kuongezea tiba ya msingi kusimamia athari mbaya, na vile vile VVU, kupandikiza, na eneo mpya la ukuaji, sclerosis nyingi (MS)." Kufikia 1995 Stadtlanders iliongeza wengine, pamoja na homoni za ukuaji. Ikilinganishwa na maduka ya dawa ya rejareja ambayo yalishughulikia viwango vya juu vya dawa za chini, Stadtlanders mafanikio ya mtindo wa biashara yalilenga viwango vya chini vya dawa za bei ya juu kusababisha "mapato bora." Kufikia karibu 1995 kulikuwa na dawa za chini ya 30 kwenye soko.

Sio dawa zote maalum ni dawa za watoto yatima. Kulingana na Thomson Reuters katika chapisho lao la 2012 "Nguvu ya Uchumi ya Dawa za Yatima", kumekuwa na kuongezeka kwa uwekezaji katika utafiti wa dawa za watoto yatima na maendeleo kwa sehemu tangu Bunge la Merika kutekeleza Sheria ya Dawa ya Yatima, na kutoa ukiritimba zaidi kwa dawa za "magonjwa ya watoto yatima" ambayo iliathiri watu wasiopungua 200,000 nchini. Vitendo kama hivyo vilitokea katika mikoa mingine ya ulimwengu, nyingi zinazoendeshwa na "ufadhili wa hali ya juu". Kulingana na nakala ya 2010 katika "Forbes", kabla ya kampuni za madawa ya kulevya za 1983 zilipuuza magonjwa adimu na yalilenga dawa zilizoathiri mamilioni ya wagonjwa.

question_en: How old is Margaret Claire Hoover?
pos_context_en:
Margaret Claire Hoover (born December 11, 1977) is an American political commentator, political strategist, media personality, feminist, gay rights activist, author, and great-granddaughter of Herbert Hoover, the 31st U.S. President. She is the best-selling author of the book "American Individualism: How A New Generation of Conservatives Can Save the Republican Party", published by Crown Forum in July 2011. Hoover is currently host of PBS's reboot of the conservative interview show "Firing Line".
Hoover was born in Colorado, the daughter of Jean (Williams), a flight attendant, and Andrew Hoover, a mining engineer.
neg_context_en: On the evening of February 26, 1973, William "Pooky" Young, a 19-year old neighborhood youth drug dealer, was abducted and later shot to death in an alley near 68th Street and Union Avenue in Chicago's Englewood neighborhood. His killing was ordered by Hoover after his name was mentioned as one of three people accused of stealing drugs and money from the gang five days earlier. On March 16, 1973, Hoover and Young's killer, Gangster Disciple member Andrew Howard, were both arrested. In November 1973, Howard and Hoover were both charged with murder and sentenced to 150 to 200 years in prison. Hoover was sent to Stateville Correctional Center in Crest Hill, Illinois, to serve out his term.

Margaret Hale is nineteen years old and before she was 10, lived in Helstone in Hampshire, in the south of England, with her parents—Richard, a Anglican minister, and Maria—and older brother, Frederick. When she was nine years old, Margaret was sent to live in London with her aunt, Mrs Shaw, and cousin. Edith and Margaret were the same age, and became fast friends.

Winfield Toll Bridge, also known as the Ross Booth Memorial Bridge, is a historic three-span cantilever Warren Truss bridge located at Winfield and Red House, Putnam County, West Virginia. It was built in 1955, and spans the Kanawha River, carrying West Virginia Route 34. The cantilever through-truss consists of two anchor spans each 245 feet in length and the main span 462 feet in length between pier center lines. The main span consists of two 128 feet, 4 inch, cantilever arms and a 205 feet, 4 inch, suspended span.

question_src: Margaret Claire Hoover ana umri gani?
pos_context_src:
Margaret Claire Hoover (amezaliwa Desemba 11, 1977) ni mtangazaji wa kisiasa wa Amerika, mkakati wa kisiasa, utu wa vyombo vya habari, mwanaharakati, mwanaharakati wa haki za mashoga, mwandishi, na mjukuu wa Herbert Hoover, rais wa 31 wa Merika. Yeye ndiye mwandishi anayeuzwa vizuri zaidi wa kitabu "Ubinafsi wa Amerika: Jinsi Kizazi kipya cha Conservatives kinaweza kuokoa Chama cha Republican", kilichochapishwa na Jukwaa la Crown mnamo Julai 2011. Hoover kwa sasa ni mwenyeji wa PBS wa kuanza tena mahojiano ya kihafidhina "Line ya Kurusha".
Hoover alizaliwa huko Colorado, binti ya Jean (Williams), mhudumu wa ndege, na Andrew Hoover, mhandisi wa madini.
neg_context_src: Jioni ya Februari 26, 1973, William "Pooky" Young, muuzaji wa dawa za kulevya za vijana wa kitongoji, alitekwa nyara na baadaye akapigwa risasi na kuuawa katika barabara kuu karibu na Barabara ya 68 na Union Avenue katika kitongoji cha Englewood cha Chicago. Uuaji wake uliamriwa na Hoover baada ya jina lake kutajwa kama mmoja wa watu watatu anayeshtakiwa kwa kuiba dawa na pesa kutoka kwa genge hilo siku tano mapema. Mnamo Machi 16, 1973, muuaji wa Hoover na Young, mwanachama wa mwanafunzi wa genge Andrew Howard, wote walikamatwa. Mnamo Novemba 1973, Howard na Hoover wote walishtakiwa kwa mauaji na kuhukumiwa kifungo cha miaka 150 hadi 200 gerezani. Hoover alitumwa katika Kituo cha Urekebishaji cha Stateville huko Crest Hill, Illinois, kutumikia muda wake.

Margaret Hale ana umri wa miaka kumi na tisa na kabla ya miaka 10, aliishi Helstone huko Hampshire, kusini mwa England, na wazazi wake - Richard, waziri wa Anglikana, na Maria - na kaka mkubwa, Frederick. Wakati alikuwa na umri wa miaka tisa, Margaret alitumwa kuishi London na shangazi yake, Bi Shaw, na binamu. Edith na Margaret walikuwa wazee, na wakawa marafiki wa haraka.

Winfield Toll Bridge, pia inajulikana kama Ross Booth Memorial Bridge, ni kihistoria wa kihistoria wa Cantilever Warren Truss Bridge iliyoko Winfield na Red House, Kaunti ya Putnam, West Virginia. Ilijengwa mnamo 1955, na inachukua Mto wa Kanawha, iliyobeba West Virginia Route 34. Cantilever kupitia-truss ina nafasi mbili za nanga kila futi 245 kwa urefu na urefu wa futi 462 kwa urefu kati ya mistari ya kituo cha pier. Span kuu ina futi mbili 128, inchi 4, mikono ya cantilever na miguu 205, inchi 4, iliyosimamishwa.

question_en: When was Bangkok founded?
pos_context_en: Bangkok Noi was established as an amphoe on 15 October 1915. Originally named Amphoe Ammarin, it was renamed on 11 July 1916 to Amphoe Bangkok Noi to match with the historical name of the area. It became a khet in 1972 when Thon Buri and Bangkok were merged. Later on 9 November 1989 the Bang Phlat district was created from four of Bangkok Noi's sub-districts, leaving Bangkok Noi with four remaining sub-districts: Siri Rat, Ban Chang Lo, Bang Khun Non, and Bang Khun Si. On 12 December 1991 a small part of Bang Phlat district was moved back to Bangkok Noi, creating the new Arun Ammarin sub-district.
neg_context_title_en: Postage stamps and postal history of Bangkok
neg_context_en: Bangkok F.C. was founded in 1999. Its first name was Bangkok Bravo F.C., and then it was renamed to Bangkok F.C., in 2010 when Natthaphol Teepsuwan became the owner and the chairman of the club. He also changed the logo to be a bull on a background of the Giant Swing, which is a symbol of Bangkok. At that time Bangkok F.C. used Chaloem Phrakiat Bang Mod Stadium as their home field.

The Indian National Council was founded in December 1941 in Bangkok by another group of Indian nationalists resident in Thailand. This organisation was founded from the Thai-Bharat Cultural Lodge on 22 December 1941. The founding president of the Council was Swami Satyananda Puri, along with Debnath Das as the founding secretary. Along with the Indian Independence League, it came to be one of the two prominent Indian associations that corresponded with I Fujiwara's F Kikan on the scopes of Japanese assistance to the Indian movement. However, the Indian National Council emphasised solidarity with the Indian National Congress and, at a time when Japan began its successful Malayan Campaign, the council reflected the Congress leadership's reluctance to appear Quisling of the Japanese. The council also had differences with the Indian Independence League, with Puri openly questioning Tokyo's anti-imperialist credibility in light of her actions in Korea and China. Puri was killed in a plane crash, along with Giani Pritam Singh en route to the Conference in Tokyo in 1942 that saw Rash Behari Bose accepted as the leader of the expatriate Indian movement in South-east Asia. Later, the council sent delegates to attend the Bangkok Conference.

The history of Bangkok dates at least back to the early 15th century, when it was a village on the west bank of the Chao Phraya River, under the rule of Ayutthaya. Because of its strategic location near the mouth of the river, the town gradually increased in importance. Bangkok initially served as a customs outpost with forts on both sides of the river, and was the site of a siege in 1688 in which the French were expelled from Siam. After the fall of Ayutthaya to the Burmese Empire in 1767, the newly crowned King Taksin established his capital at the town, which became the base of the Thonburi Kingdom. In 1782, King Phutthayotfa Chulalok (Rama I) succeeded Taksin, moved the capital to the eastern bank's Rattanakosin Island, thus founding the Rattanakosin Kingdom. The City Pillar was erected on 21 April 1782, which is regarded as the date of foundation of the present city.

Over the past few decades the general trend of pursuing a university degree has prompted the founding of new universities to meet the needs of Thai students. Bangkok became not only a place where immigrants and provincial Thais go for job opportunities, but also for a chance to receive a university degree. Ramkhamhaeng University emerged in 1971 as Thailand's first open university; it now has the highest enrolment in the country. The demand for higher education has led to the founding of many other universities and colleges, both public and private. While many universities have been established in major provinces, the Greater Bangkok region remains home to the greater majority of institutions, and the city's tertiary education scene remains over-populated with non-Bangkokians. The situation is not limited to higher education, either. In the 1960s, 60 to 70 percent of 10- to 19-year-olds who were in school had migrated to Bangkok for secondary education. This was due to both a lack of secondary schools in the provinces and perceived higher standards of education in the capital. Although this discrepancy has since largely abated, tens of thousands of students still compete for places in Bangkok's leading schools. Education has long been a prime factor in the centralization of Bangkok and will play a vital role in the government's efforts to decentralize the country.

Bangkok's Chinatown is one of the largest Chinatowns in the world. It was founded in 1782 when the city was established as the capital of the Rattanakosin Kingdom, and served as the home of the mainly Teochew immigrant Chinese population, who soon became the city's dominant ethnic group. Originally centred around Sampheng, the core of Chinatown now lies along Yaowarat Road, which serves as its main artery and sometimes lends its name to the entire area, which is often referred to as Yaowarat (). Chinatown's entire area is roughly coterminous with Samphanthawong District, and includes neighbourhoods such as Song Wat and Talat Noi along the Chao Phraya River, and Charoen Chai, Khlong Thom and Nakhon Khasem along Charoen Krung Road.

By 1900, rural market zones in Bangkok began developing into residential districts. The Memorial Bridge was constructed in 1932 to connect Thonburi to Bangkok which was believed to promote economic growth and modernization in a period when infrastructure was developing considerably. Bangkok became the centre stage for power struggles between the military and political elite as the country abolished absolute monarchy in 1932. It was subject to Japanese occupation and Allied bombing during World War II. With the war over in 1945 British and Indian troops landed in September, and during their brief occupation of the city disarmed the Japanese troops. A significant event following the return of the young king Ananda Mahidol, intended to defuse post-war tensions lingering between Bangkok's ethnic Chinese and Thai people, was his visit to Bangkok's Chinatown Sam Peng Lane ().

A majority of Bangkok's population is of Thai ethnicity, although details on the city's ethnic make-up are unavailable, as the national census does not document race. Bangkok's cultural pluralism dates back to the early days of its founding: several ethnic communities were formed by immigrants and forced settlers included the Khmer, northern Thai, Lao, Vietnamese, Tavoyan, Mon and Malay. Most prominent were the Chinese, who played major roles in the city's trade and became the majority of Bangkok's population—estimates include up to three-fourths in 1828 and almost half in the 1950s. Chinese immigration was restricted from the 1930s and effectively ceased after the Chinese Revolution in 1949. Their prominence subsequently declined as younger generations of Thai Chinese integrated and adopted a Thai identity. Bangkok is still nevertheless home to a large Chinese community, with the greatest concentration in Yaowarat, Bangkok's Chinatown.

Initially, postage stamps of India were used here and throughout the Straits Settlements. This lasted until 1867 when Straits Settlements stamps were first produced. When Honorary Postmaster Gardner complained in 1881 that he should be compensated for the increasing amount of work that was required of him it was agreed that a portion of the revenue for stamp sales would be retained. This led to the overprinting during 1882 of Straits Settlement with the letter B, representing Bangkok, for use there. The Bangkok 30mm diameter circular date stamp postmark was also introduced during this period. Most outbound mail was still sent to enter the postal system at Singapore (for European destinations). Some Hong Kong stamps continued to be used throughout this time for mail forwarded through Hong Kong to Chinese, Japanese, and United States destinations. A few British stamps are also known to have been used in Bangkok. Inbound mail from steamboats was kept at the post office for people to come to pick up.

The Bangkok Dock Company (1957) Limited () is a Thai shipbuilding company. It operates as a state enterprise under the oversight of the Ministry of Defence. It was founded in 1865 as the Bangkok Dock Co by Captain John Bush, the harbour master of Bangkok, and was acquired by the Royal Thai Navy in 1957. The company now has two facilities: the original Bangkok dockyard on Charoen Krung Road next to Wat Yan Nawa, and a newer main facility operating at the Mahidol Adulyadej Naval Dockyard at Sattahip in Chonburi Province.
question_src: Bangkok ilianzishwa lini?
pos_context_src: Bangkok Noi ilianzishwa kama Amphoe mnamo 15 Oktoba 1915. Hapo awali iliitwa Amphoe Ammarin, ilipewa jina mnamo 11 Julai 1916 hadi Amphoe Bangkok Noi ili mechi na jina la kihistoria la eneo hilo. Ikawa Khet mnamo 1972 wakati Thon Buri na Bangkok waliunganishwa. Baadaye mnamo Novemba 9 1989 Wilaya ya Bang Phlat iliundwa kutoka kwa wanne wa wilaya ndogo za Bangkok Noi, na kumuacha Bangkok Noi na wilaya nne zilizobaki: Siri Rat, Ban Chang Lo, Bang Khun Non, na Bang Khun Si. Mnamo Desemba 12, 1991 sehemu ndogo ya wilaya ya Bang Phlat ilihamishwa kurudi Bangkok Noi, na kuunda wilaya mpya ya Arun Ammarin.
neg_context_title_src: Mihuri ya posta na historia ya posta ya Bangkok
neg_context_src: Bangkok F.C. Ilianzishwa mnamo 1999. Jina lake la kwanza lilikuwa Bangkok Bravo F.C., na kisha likapewa jina la Bangkok F.C., mnamo 2010 wakati Natthaphol Teepsuwan alikua mmiliki na mwenyekiti wa kilabu. Alibadilisha pia nembo kuwa ng'ombe kwenye msingi wa swing kubwa, ambayo ni ishara ya Bangkok. Wakati huo Bangkok F.C. walitumia Uwanja wa Chaloem Phrakiat Bang Mod kama uwanja wao wa nyumbani.

Baraza la Kitaifa la India lilianzishwa mnamo Desemba 1941 huko Bangkok na kikundi kingine cha wakazi wa kitaifa wa India nchini Thailand. Shirika hili lilianzishwa kutoka Lodge ya kitamaduni ya Thai-Bharat mnamo 22 Desemba 1941. Rais mwanzilishi wa baraza hilo alikuwa Swami Satyananda Puri, pamoja na Debnath Das kama katibu mwanzilishi. Pamoja na Ligi ya Uhuru wa India, ikawa moja ya vyama viwili maarufu vya India ambavyo viliambatana na mimi Fujiwara's F Kikan kwenye wigo wa msaada wa Kijapani kwa harakati za India. Walakini, Baraza la Kitaifa la India lilisisitiza mshikamano na Bunge la Kitaifa la India na, wakati ambao Japan ilipoanza kampeni yake ya Malaya, baraza lilionyesha kusita kwa uongozi wa Congress kuonekana kuwa wa Japani. Baraza pia lilikuwa na tofauti na Ligi ya Uhuru ya India, na Puri akihoji waziwazi uaminifu wa Tokyo wa kupinga-imtoni kwa kuzingatia vitendo vyake huko Korea na Uchina. Puri aliuawa katika ajali ya ndege, pamoja na Giani Pritam Singh wakiwa njiani kwenda kwenye Mkutano huko Tokyo mnamo 1942 ambao ulimwona Rash Beenda Bose akikubali kama kiongozi wa harakati za India huko Kusini-Mashariki mwa Asia. Baadaye, baraza lilipeleka wajumbe kuhudhuria Mkutano wa Bangkok.

Historia ya Bangkok ilianzia angalau karne ya 15, wakati ilikuwa kijiji kwenye benki ya magharibi ya Mto Chao Phraya, chini ya utawala wa Ayutthaya. Kwa sababu ya eneo lake la kimkakati karibu na mdomo wa mto, mji polepole uliongezeka kwa umuhimu. Hapo awali Bangkok aliwahi kuwa uwanja wa nje wa forodha na ngome pande zote za mto, na ilikuwa tovuti ya kuzingirwa mnamo 1688 ambayo Wafaransa walifukuzwa kutoka Siam. Baada ya kuanguka kwa Ayutthaya kwa Dola ya Burmese mnamo 1767, Mfalme mpya Taksin alianzisha mji wake mkuu katika mji huo, ambao ukawa msingi wa Ufalme wa Thonburi. Mnamo 1782, Mfalme Phutthayotfa Chulalok (Rama I) alifaulu Taksin, akahamisha mji mkuu katika kisiwa cha Rattanakosin cha Benki ya Mashariki, na hivyo kuanzisha Ufalme wa Rattanakosin. Nguzo ya jiji ilijengwa tarehe 21 Aprili 1782, ambayo inachukuliwa kama tarehe ya msingi wa mji wa sasa.

Katika miongo michache iliyopita mwenendo wa jumla wa kufuata digrii ya chuo kikuu umesababisha kuanzishwa kwa vyuo vikuu vipya kukidhi mahitaji ya wanafunzi wa Thai. Bangkok haikuwa mahali tu ambapo wahamiaji na Thais wa mkoa huenda kwa fursa za kazi, lakini pia kwa nafasi ya kupata digrii ya chuo kikuu. Chuo Kikuu cha Ramkhamhaeng kiliibuka mnamo 1971 kama chuo kikuu cha kwanza cha Thailand; Sasa ina uandikishaji wa hali ya juu nchini. Mahitaji ya elimu ya juu yamesababisha kuanzishwa kwa vyuo vikuu vingine vingi na vyuo vikuu, vya umma na vya kibinafsi. Wakati vyuo vikuu vingi vimeanzishwa katika majimbo makubwa, mkoa mkubwa wa Bangkok unabaki nyumbani kwa idadi kubwa ya taasisi, na eneo la elimu ya juu ya jiji linabaki na watu wasio wa Bangkokians. Hali hiyo sio mdogo kwa elimu ya juu, ama. Mnamo miaka ya 1960, asilimia 60 hadi 70 ya watoto wa miaka 10 hadi 19 ambao walikuwa shuleni walikuwa wamehamia Bangkok kwa elimu ya sekondari. Hii ilitokana na ukosefu wa shule za sekondari katika majimbo na kugundua viwango vya juu vya elimu katika mji mkuu. Ingawa utofauti huu umepungua sana, makumi ya maelfu ya wanafunzi bado wanashindana kwa maeneo katika shule zinazoongoza za Bangkok. Elimu kwa muda mrefu imekuwa sababu kuu katika ujumuishaji wa Bangkok na itachukua jukumu muhimu katika juhudi za serikali za kuibadilisha nchi.

Chinatown ya Bangkok ni moja wapo ya Chinatown kubwa ulimwenguni. Ilianzishwa mnamo 1782 wakati mji ulianzishwa kama mji mkuu wa ufalme wa Rattanakosin, na kutumika kama nyumba ya wahamiaji wa China wahamiaji, ambao hivi karibuni wakawa kabila kuu la jiji. Hapo awali ililenga karibu na Sampheng, msingi wa Chinatown sasa uko kando ya Barabara ya Yaowarat, ambayo hutumika kama artery yake kuu na wakati mwingine hukopesha jina lake kwa eneo lote, ambalo mara nyingi hujulikana kama Yaowarat (). Sehemu nzima ya Chinatown ni karibu sana na wilaya ya Samphanthawong, na inajumuisha vitongoji kama vile Wimbo Wat na Talat Noi kando ya Mto Chao Phraya, na Charoen Chai, Khlong Thom na Nakhon Khasem kando na Barabara ya Charoen Krung.

Kufikia 1900, maeneo ya soko la vijijini huko Bangkok alianza kukuza katika wilaya za makazi. Daraja la Ukumbusho lilijengwa mnamo 1932 kuunganisha Thonburi na Bangkok ambayo iliaminika kukuza ukuaji wa uchumi na kisasa katika kipindi ambacho miundombinu ilikuwa inaendelea sana. Bangkok ikawa hatua ya katikati ya mapambano ya nguvu kati ya wasomi wa kijeshi na kisiasa kwani nchi hiyo ilikomesha kifalme kabisa mnamo 1932. Ilikuwa chini ya kazi ya Wajapani na kulipua mabomu wakati wa Vita vya Kidunia vya pili. Pamoja na vita mnamo 1945 vikosi vya Uingereza na India vilifika mnamo Septemba, na wakati wa kazi yao fupi ya mji huo uliwaondoa askari wa Japani. Tukio muhimu kufuatia kurudi kwa mfalme wa vijana Ananda Mahidol, lilikusudia kutenganisha mvutano wa baada ya vita kati ya watu wa kabila la Wachina na Thai la Bangkok, ilikuwa ziara yake kwa Chinatown Sam Peng Lane ().

Idadi kubwa ya idadi ya watu wa Bangkok ni ya kabila la Thai, ingawa maelezo juu ya utengenezaji wa kabila la jiji hayapatikani, kwani sensa ya kitaifa haina hati ya mbio. Utamaduni wa kitamaduni wa Bangkok ulianza siku za kwanza za kuanzishwa kwake: jamii kadhaa za kabila ziliundwa na wahamiaji na walowezi kulazimishwa ni pamoja na Khmer, Kaskazini mwa Thai, Lao, Vietnamese, Tavoyan, Mon na Mala. Mashuhuri zaidi walikuwa Wachina, ambao walicheza majukumu makubwa katika biashara ya jiji hilo na wakawa idadi kubwa ya watu wa Bangkok-wahusika ni pamoja na hadi theluthi tatu mnamo 1828 na karibu nusu ya miaka ya 1950. Uhamiaji wa Wachina ulizuiliwa kutoka miaka ya 1930 na ulikoma vizuri baada ya Mapinduzi ya Wachina mnamo 1949. Umaarufu wao baadaye ulipungua kama vizazi vichache vya Wachina wa Thai vilijumuishwa na kupitisha kitambulisho cha Thai. Bangkok bado ni nyumbani kwa jamii kubwa ya Wachina, na mkusanyiko mkubwa zaidi katika Yaowarat, Chinatown ya Bangkok.

Hapo awali, mihuri ya posta ya India ilitumiwa hapa na katika makazi yote ya Straits. Hii ilidumu hadi 1867 wakati mihuri ya makazi ya Straits ilitengenezwa kwanza. Wakati mkuu wa heshima Gardner alilalamika mnamo 1881 kwamba anapaswa kulipwa fidia kwa kuongezeka kwa kazi ambayo inahitajika kwake ilikubaliwa kuwa sehemu ya mapato ya uuzaji wa stempu itahifadhiwa. Hii ilisababisha uchapaji wakati wa 1882 wa makazi ya Straits na barua B, inayowakilisha Bangkok, kwa matumizi huko. Bangkok 30mm kipenyo cha mduara wa muhuri pia ilianzishwa katika kipindi hiki. Barua nyingi za nje bado zilitumwa kuingia kwenye mfumo wa posta huko Singapore (kwa miishilio ya Ulaya). Baadhi ya mihuri ya Hong Kong iliendelea kutumiwa wakati wote huu kwa barua iliyopelekwa kupitia Hong Kong kwenda kwa Wachina, Kijapani, na Amerika. Stampu chache za Uingereza pia zinajulikana kuwa zimetumika huko Bangkok. Barua ya ndani kutoka kwa Steamboats ilihifadhiwa katika ofisi ya posta kwa watu kuja kuchukua.

Kampuni ya Bangkok Dock (1957) Limited () ni kampuni ya ujenzi wa meli ya Thai. Inafanya kazi kama biashara ya serikali chini ya usimamizi wa Wizara ya Ulinzi. It was founded in 1865 as the Bangkok Dock Co by Captain John Bush, the harbour master of Bangkok, and was acquired by the Royal Thai Navy in 1957. The company now has two facilities: the original Bangkok dockyard on Charoen Krung Road next to Wat Yan Nawa, and a newer main facility operating at the Mahidol Adulyadej Naval Dockyard at Sattahip in Chonburi Mkoa.
report_src: Kulingana na chanzo pekee kilichotolewa, taarifa inapatikana kuhusu wilaya ya Bangkok Noi tu: ilianzishwa kama Amphoe tarehe 15 Oktoba 1915 na kubadilishwa kuwa Khet mwaka 1972 wakati Thon Buri na Bangkok ziliunganishwa [1]; hata hivyo, hati hii haielezi tarehe rasmi ya kuanzishwa kwa jiji lote la Bangkok, hivyo hakuna data sahihi kuhusu “Bangkok ilianzishwa lini” inayopatikana katika nyaraka zilizoletwa.

question_en: When was New Zealand first settled?
pos_context_en: The precise date at which the first inhabitants of New Zealand reached Otago and the extreme south (known to later Māori as "Murihiku") remains uncertain. Māori descend from a race of Polynesian sea-wanderers who, moved from East Asia and south-east Asia to the islands of the Pacific. Tradition tells of their further journeyings from Hawaiki to New Zealand, and some commentators have identified this homeland as Havai'i, an island in the Society Group. Overpopulation, scarcity of food and civil war forced many of them to migrate once more, and New Zealand became their new home. Māori settled New Zealand between AD 1280–1320. They quickly learnt to hunt the numerous species of moa and seals in New Zealand and settled across the North and South islands in less than a few decades. There is a change in the pollen record from inland Otago from 600 years ago from a forest to bracken flora. It has been inferred that this relates to fires being lit during Maori exploration.
neg_context_en: The history of New Zealand dates back at least 700 years to when it was discovered and settled by Polynesians, who developed a distinct Māori culture centred on kinship links and land. The first European explorer to sight New Zealand was Dutch navigator Abel Tasman on 13 December 1642. The Dutch were also the first non-natives to explore and chart New Zealand's coastline. Captain James Cook, who reached New Zealand in October 1769 on the first of his three voyages, was the first European explorer to circumnavigate and map New Zealand. From the late 18th century, the country was regularly visited by explorers and other sailors, missionaries, traders and adventurers. In 1840 the Treaty of Waitangi was signed between the British Crown and various Māori chiefs, bringing New Zealand into the British Empire and giving Māori the same rights as British subjects. There was extensive British settlement throughout the rest of the century and into the early part of the next century. War and the imposition of a European economic and legal system led to most of New Zealand's land passing from Māori to Pākehā (European) ownership, and most Māori subsequently became impoverished.

The military history of New Zealand is an aspect of the history of New Zealand that spans several hundred years. When first settled by Māori almost a millennium ago, there was much land and resources, but war began to break out as the country's carrying capacity was approached. Initially being fought with close range weapons of wood and stone, this continued on and off until Europeans arrived, bringing with them new weapons such as muskets. Colonisation by Britain led to the New Zealand land wars in the 19th century in which settler and imperial troops and their Māori allies fought against other Māori and a handful of Pākehā. In the first half of the 20th century, New Zealanders of all races fought alongside Britain in the Boer War and both World Wars. In the second half of the century and into this century the New Zealand Defence Force has provided token assistance to the United States in several conflicts. New Zealand has also contributed troops extensively to multilateral peacekeeping operations.

The History of New Zealand dates back to at least 700 years to when it was discovered and settled by Polynesians, who developed a distinct Māori culture centred on kinship links and land. The first European explorer, the Dutch Abel Tasman, came to New Zealand in 1642. From the late 18th century, the country was regularly visited by explorers and other sailors, missionaries, traders and adventurers. In 1840 the Treaty of Waitangi was signed between the British Crown and various Māori chiefs, bringing New Zealand into the British Empire and giving Māori equal rights with British citizens. There was extensive European and some Asian settlement throughout the rest of the century. War and the imposition of a European economic and legal system led to most of New Zealand's land passing from Māori to European ownership, and most Māori subsequently became impoverished.

Polynesians in the South Pacific were the first to discover the landmass of New Zealand. Eastern Polynesian explorers had settled in New Zealand by approximately the thirteenth century CE with most evidence pointing to an arrival date of about 1280. Their arrival gave rise to the Māori culture and the Māori language, both unique to New Zealand, although very closely related to analogues in other parts of Eastern Polynesia. Evidence from Wairau Bar and the Chatham Islands shows that the Polynesian colonists maintained many parts of their east Polynesian culture such as burial customs for at least 50 years. Especially strong resemblances link Māori to the languages and cultures of the Cook and Society Islands, which are regarded as the most likely places of origin. Moriori settled the Chatham Islands during the 15th century from SE South Island of New Zealand.

Several Baptists settled in New Zealand in the 1840s, but the first Baptist minister, Decimus Dolamore from Yorkshire, England, did not arrive until May 1851. Dolamore settled in Nelson and was involved in the formation of the first Baptist Church in New Zealand - Nelson Baptist Church - that same year. He was instrumental in obtaining a change in the law to allow Baptist ministers to perform marriage ceremonies; until 1854, only Catholic and Anglican priests were allowed to do so. Dolamore later went to Christchurch and was the first minister for that congregation.

After receiving a compilation on forming Assemblies they then returned to New Zealand in December 1925. They also returned with some dust from the Tomb of Bahá'u'lláh which was placed in New Zealand soil at Stevenson's home in a ceremony held on 14 February 1926. Later in 1926 the Bahá'ís in Auckland were able to properly elect their first Bahá'í Local Spiritual Assembly. In 1928 there were seven assemblies between New Zealand and Australia - by 1939 the number of assemblies had reduced to 4 but the locations with Bahá'ís increased to 17 and by 1940 the count of assemblies reached 19 while there were still 17 other locations with smaller groups of Bahá'ís. In 1931 Keith Ransom-Kehler also visited. In 1934 Bahá'ís from Australia and New Zealand elected a regional National Assembly - there were three delegates from Auckland, three from Sydney and three from Adelaide. From 1934 to 1939 Stevenson served on the regional National Spiritual Assembly of Australia and New Zealand and then died shortly thereafter in 1941. In 1940 the community held its first season school. In 1947 Alvin and Gertrude Blum left the United States for New Zealand where they lived until 1953 when they pioneered and became Knights of Bahá'u'lláh for the Solomon Islands.
In 1948 the first person of Māori descent to accept the Bahá’í Faith was Albert White, who was one quarter Māori. In 1949 the first Persian Bahá'í pioneer, Manoochehr Ala’i, arrived as a student at Massey College. In 1953 the first standing Hand of the Cause, the highest appointed position in the religion open to all, `Alí-Akbar Furútan, visited New Zealand. In 1957 the New Zealand community held its first independent convention to elect its own National Spiritual Assembly with three delegates from Auckland and two each from Devonport, New Plymouth and Wellington. This convention elected the first National Spiritual Assembly of New Zealand. In 1958 Hand of the Cause of God, Enoch Olinga visited the Ngaruawahia Marae and talked with elders and four years later, when Hand of the Cause of God, Dr Muhajir visited, Ephraim Te Paa, a Kaumatua (Māori elder) from Ahipara converted to the religion. In 1963 with the election of the Universal House of Justice the Hands of the Cause updated and published a kind of census of the religion. At that time there were four assemblies -Auckland, Devonport, Hamilton, Wellington - and 18 localities with smaller groups of Bahá'ís - see maps. The story of one convert in 1964 includes her concern for her bi-racial children and despair at the bigotry of interracial marriage among the very minorities her children were members (she being Celt and married a Māori) when she found this kind of marriage highly accepted among Bahá'ís. The members of the National Assembly, who participated in the convention for the first election of the Universal House of Justice, were: Hugh Blundell, John Carr, Margaret Harnish, Linda Hight, Percy Leadley, Phyllis Milne, Jean Simmons, Douglas Weeks, and Terry Stirling. The New Zealand Bahá'í community came to the assistance of refugees in 1979 from the persecution of Bahá'ís in Iran who were allowed to settle in New Zealand. Between 1987 and 1989, a further 142 Iranian Bahá'ís settled in New Zealand.

From the 1790s, New Zealand was visited by British, French and American whaling, sealing and trading ships. Their crews traded European goods with the indigenous Māori. The first settlers to New Zealand were mainly from Australia, many of them ex-convicts or escaped convicts. Sailors, explorers and traders from Australia and other parts of Europe also settled.

New Zealand's religious history after the arrival of Europeans saw substantial missionary activity, with Māori generally converting to Christianity voluntarily (compare forced conversions elsewhere in the world). The Anglican Church Missionary Society (CMS) sent missionaries to settle in New Zealand. Samuel Marsden of the Church Missionary Society (chaplain in New South Wales) officiated at its first service on Christmas Day in 1814, at Oihi Bay in the Bay of Islands. The CMS founded its first mission at Rangihoua in the Bay of Islands in 1814 and over the next decade established farms and schools in the area. In June 1823 Wesleydale, the first Wesleyan Methodist mission in New Zealand, was established at Kaeo, near Whangaroa Harbour. Jean Baptiste Pompallier arrived in 1838 and became the first Catholic bishop in New Zealand. With a number of Marist Brothers, Pompallier organised the Catholic Church throughout the country. In 1892 the New Zealand Church Missionary Society (NZCMS) formed in a Nelson church hall and the first New Zealand missionaries were sent overseas soon after.

Sometime between 1250 and 1300, Polynesians settled in the islands that later were named New Zealand and developed a distinctive Māori culture. In 1642, Dutch explorer Abel Tasman became the first European to sight New Zealand. In 1840, representatives of the United Kingdom and Māori chiefs signed the Treaty of Waitangi, which declared British sovereignty over the islands. In 1841, New Zealand became a colony within the British Empire and in 1907 it became a dominion; it gained full statutory independence in 1947 and the British monarch remained the head of state. Today, the majority of New Zealand's population of 4.9 million is of European descent; the indigenous Māori are the largest minority, followed by Asians and Pacific Islanders. Reflecting this, New Zealand's culture is mainly derived from Māori and early British settlers, with recent broadening arising from increased immigration. The official languages are English, Māori, and NZ Sign Language, with English being very dominant.
question_src: New Zealand ilitulia lini kwanza?
pos_context_src: Tarehe sahihi ambayo wenyeji wa kwanza wa New Zealand walifika Otago na kusini mwa kusini (inayojulikana baadaye Māori kama "MuriHiku") bado haijulikani. Māori anaanguka kutoka kwa mbio za watazamaji wa bahari ya Polynesian ambao, walihama kutoka Asia ya Mashariki na Asia ya Kusini-Mashariki hadi visiwa vya Pasifiki. Mila inaelezea juu ya safari zao zaidi kutoka Hawaiiki kwenda New Zealand, na watoa maoni wengine wamegundua nchi hii kama Havai'i, kisiwa katika kundi la jamii. Kuzidi, uhaba wa chakula na vita vya wenyewe kwa wenyewe ulilazimisha wengi wao kuhamia tena, na New Zealand ikawa nyumba yao mpya. Māori alitulia New Zealand kati ya AD 1280-1320. Walijifunza haraka kuwinda spishi nyingi za MOA na mihuri huko New Zealand na kuishi katika visiwa vya Kaskazini na Kusini chini ya miongo michache. Kuna mabadiliko katika rekodi ya poleni kutoka Inland Otago kutoka miaka 600 iliyopita kutoka msitu hadi mimea ya bracken. Imewekwa kwamba hii inahusiana na moto kuwa umewashwa wakati wa uchunguzi wa Maori.
neg_context_title_src: Historia ya kijeshi ya New Zealand
Umoja wa Baptist wa New Zealand
Imani ya Bahá'í huko New Zealand
neg_context_src: Historia ya New Zealand ilianzia angalau miaka 700 hadi ilipogunduliwa na kutulia na Polynesians, ambao walitengeneza utamaduni tofauti wa Māori uliolenga viungo vya ujamaa na ardhi. Mvumbuzi wa kwanza wa Ulaya kuona New Zealand alikuwa msafiri wa Uholanzi Abel Tasman mnamo 13 Desemba 1642. Waholanzi pia walikuwa wa kwanza wasiokuwa wa kwanza kuchunguza na kuorodhesha pwani ya New Zealand. Kapteni James Cook, ambaye alifika New Zealand mnamo Oktoba 1769 mnamo safari yake ya kwanza tatu, alikuwa mchunguzi wa kwanza wa Ulaya kuzunguka na ramani New Zealand. Kuanzia mwishoni mwa karne ya 18, nchi hiyo ilitembelewa mara kwa mara na wachunguzi na mabaharia wengine, wamishonari, wafanyabiashara na watangazaji. Mnamo 1840 Mkataba wa Waitangi ulitiwa saini kati ya taji ya Uingereza na wakuu mbali mbali wa Māori, na kuleta New Zealand katika Dola ya Uingereza na kumpa Māori haki sawa na raia wa Uingereza. Kulikuwa na makazi ya Briteni kwa muda wote wa karne na mwanzoni mwa karne ijayo. Vita na kuwekwa kwa mfumo wa kiuchumi na kisheria wa Ulaya ulisababisha ardhi nyingi za New Zealand kupita kutoka Māori kwenda kwa umiliki wa Pākehā (Uropa), na baadaye Māori wakawa masikini.

Historia ya kijeshi ya New Zealand ni sehemu ya historia ya New Zealand ambayo inachukua miaka mia kadhaa. Wakati wa kwanza kutulia na Māori karibu milenia iliyopita, kulikuwa na ardhi nyingi na rasilimali, lakini vita ilianza kuzuka wakati uwezo wa kubeba nchi ulipofikiwa. Hapo awali walipiganwa na silaha za karibu za kuni na jiwe, hii iliendelea na mbali hadi Wazungu walipofika, na kuleta silaha mpya kama vile vijiti. Ukoloni wa Uingereza ulisababisha vita vya ardhi vya New Zealand katika karne ya 19 ambayo askari wa makazi na wa kifalme na washirika wao wa Māori walipigana dhidi ya Māori wengine na wachache wa Pākehā. Katika nusu ya kwanza ya karne ya 20, New Zealanders ya jamii zote walipigana kando na Uingereza katika Vita vya Boer na Vita vya Kidunia. Katika nusu ya pili ya karne na katika karne hii Kikosi cha Ulinzi cha New Zealand kimetoa msaada wa ishara kwa Merika katika mizozo kadhaa. New Zealand pia imechangia vikosi vingi katika shughuli za kulinda amani za kimataifa.

Historia ya New Zealand ilianzia angalau miaka 700 hadi ilipogunduliwa na kutulia na Polynesians, ambao walitengeneza utamaduni tofauti wa Māori uliolenga viungo vya ujamaa na ardhi. Mchunguzi wa kwanza wa Uropa, Abeli ​​wa Uholanzi, alifika New Zealand mnamo 1642. Kuanzia mwishoni mwa karne ya 18, nchi hiyo ilitembelewa mara kwa mara na wachunguzi na mabaharia wengine, wamishonari, wafanyabiashara na watangazaji. Mnamo 1840 Mkataba wa Waitangi ulitiwa saini kati ya taji ya Uingereza na wakuu mbali mbali wa Māori, na kuleta New Zealand katika Dola ya Uingereza na kumpa haki za Māori sawa na raia wa Uingereza. Kulikuwa na eneo kubwa la Ulaya na makazi ya Asia katika karne yote. Vita na kuwekwa kwa mfumo wa kiuchumi na kisheria wa Ulaya ulisababisha ardhi nyingi za New Zealand kupita kutoka Māori kwenda kwa umiliki wa Ulaya, na Māori wengi baadaye wakawa masikini.

Polynesians katika Pasifiki ya Kusini walikuwa wa kwanza kugundua mmiliki wa ardhi wa New Zealand. Wachunguzi wa Mashariki wa Polynesia walikuwa wamekaa New Zealand na takriban karne ya kumi na tatu CE na ushahidi mwingi kuashiria tarehe ya kuwasili ya takriban 1280. Kufika kwao kulileta tamaduni ya Māori na lugha ya Māori, ya kipekee kwa New Zealand, ingawa ilihusiana sana na analogues katika sehemu zingine za Mashariki ya Polynesia. Ushahidi kutoka Wairau Bar na Visiwa vya Chatham unaonyesha kwamba wakoloni wa Polynesian walidumisha sehemu nyingi za tamaduni yao ya Mashariki ya Polynesia kama mila ya mazishi kwa angalau miaka 50. Kufanana kwa nguvu huunganisha Māori na lugha na tamaduni za visiwa vya Cook na Society, ambavyo huchukuliwa kama mahali pa asili pa asili. Moriori alitulia Visiwa vya Chatham wakati wa karne ya 15 kutoka Kisiwa cha SE Kusini mwa New Zealand.

Wabatisti kadhaa walikaa New Zealand mnamo miaka ya 1840, lakini mhudumu wa kwanza wa Baptist, Decimus Dolamore kutoka Yorkshire, England, hakufika hadi Mei 1851. Dolamore alikaa Nelson na alihusika katika malezi ya Kanisa la Kwanza la Baptist huko New Zealand - Nelson Baptist Church - mwaka huo huo. Alikuwa muhimu katika kupata mabadiliko katika sheria ili kuruhusu mawaziri wa Baptist kufanya sherehe za ndoa; Hadi 1854, makuhani wa Katoliki na Anglikana pekee waliruhusiwa kufanya hivyo. Baadaye Dolamore alikwenda Christchurch na alikuwa waziri wa kwanza kwa mkutano huo.

Baada ya kupokea mkusanyiko juu ya kuunda makusanyiko basi walirudi New Zealand mnamo Desemba 1925. Pia walirudi na vumbi kutoka kaburi la Bahá'u'lláh ambalo liliwekwa katika mchanga wa New Zealand nyumbani kwa Stevenson katika sherehe iliyofanyika tarehe 14 Februari 1926. Baadaye 1926 The Bahá's wa Absel. Mnamo 1928 kulikuwa na makusanyiko saba kati ya New Zealand na Australia - mnamo 1939 idadi ya makusanyiko ilikuwa imepungua hadi 4 lakini maeneo yaliyo na Bahá'ís yaliongezeka hadi 17 na mnamo 1940 hesabu ya makusanyiko ilifikia 19 wakati kulikuwa na maeneo mengine 17 na vikundi vidogo vya Bahá'ís. Mnamo 1931 Keith RANSOM-KEHLER pia alitembelea. Mnamo 1934 Bahá'ís kutoka Australia na New Zealand walichagua Bunge la Kitaifa la Mkoa - kulikuwa na wajumbe watatu kutoka Auckland, watatu kutoka Sydney na watatu kutoka Adelaide. Kuanzia 1934 hadi 1939 Stevenson alihudumu kwenye Bunge la Kitaifa la Kiroho la Australia na New Zealand na kisha akafa muda mfupi baadaye mnamo 1941. Mnamo 1940 jamii ilifanya shule yake ya kwanza ya msimu. Mnamo 1947 Alvin na Gertrude Blum waliondoka Amerika kwenda New Zealand ambapo waliishi hadi 1953 wakati walipofanya upainia na kuwa Knights wa Bahá'u'lláh kwa Visiwa vya Solomon. Mnamo 1948 mtu wa kwanza wa asili ya Māori kukubali imani ya Bahá'í alikuwa Albert White, ambaye alikuwa robo moja Māori. Mnamo 1949 painia wa kwanza wa Bahá'í, Manoochehr Ala'i, alifika kama mwanafunzi katika Chuo cha Massey. Mnamo 1953 mkono wa kwanza wa sababu, nafasi ya juu kabisa katika dini iliyofunguliwa kwa wote, `Alí-Akbar Furútan, alitembelea New Zealand. Mnamo 1957 jamii ya New Zealand ilifanya mkutano wake wa kwanza wa kujitegemea kuchagua mkutano wake wa kiroho wa kitaifa na wajumbe watatu kutoka Auckland na wawili kila mmoja kutoka Devonport, New Plymouth na Wellington. Mkutano huu ulichagua mkutano wa kwanza wa kiroho wa kitaifa wa New Zealand. Mnamo 1958 mkono wa sababu ya Mungu, Enoki Olinga alitembelea Ngaruawahia Marae na kuongea naye Wazee na miaka minne baadaye, wakati mkono wa sababu ya Mungu, Dk Muhajir alitembelea, Efraimu te Paa, Kaumatua (mzee wa Māori) kutoka Ahipara alibadilisha dini hiyo. Mnamo 1963 na uchaguzi wa Jumba la Haki Universal mikono ya sababu iliyosasishwa na kuchapisha aina ya sensa ya dini hiyo. Wakati huo kulikuwa na makusanyiko manne -auckland, Devonport, Hamilton, Wellington - na maeneo 18 na vikundi vidogo vya Bahá'ís - tazama ramani. Hadithi ya mtu mmoja aliyebadilika mnamo 1964 ni pamoja na wasiwasi wake kwa watoto wake wa rangi mbili na kukata tamaa katika ndoa ya ndoa za kitamaduni kati ya watoto wake wachache walikuwa washiriki (alikuwa akiolewa na kuoa Māori) wakati alipopata ndoa ya aina hii iliyokubaliwa sana kati ya Bahá'ís. Wajumbe wa Bunge la Kitaifa, ambao walishiriki katika Mkutano wa Uchaguzi wa Kwanza wa Nyumba ya Sheria ya Universal, walikuwa: Hugh Blundell, John Carr, Margaret Harnish, Linda Hight, Percy Leadley, Phyllis Milne, Jean Simmons, Wiki za Douglas, na Terry Stirling. Jumuiya ya New Zealand Bahá'í ilisaidia msaada wa wakimbizi mnamo 1979 kutokana na mateso ya Bahá'ís huko Iran ambao waliruhusiwa kuishi New Zealand. Kati ya mwaka wa 1987 na 1989, Bahá'ís zaidi ya 142 ya Irani ilikaa New Zealand.

Kuanzia miaka ya 1790, New Zealand ilitembelewa na meli za Uingereza, Ufaransa na Amerika, kuziba na meli za biashara. Wafanyikazi wao waliuza bidhaa za Ulaya na Māori asilia. Wakaaji wa kwanza kwenda New Zealand walikuwa hasa kutoka Australia, wengi wao wakamfungia au walitoroka wafungwa. Wasafiri, wachunguzi na wafanyabiashara kutoka Australia na sehemu zingine za Ulaya pia walitulia.

Historia ya kidini ya New Zealand baada ya kuwasili kwa Wazungu waliona shughuli kubwa za umishonari, na kwa ujumla Māori akigeukia Ukristo kwa hiari (linganisha ubadilishaji wa kulazimishwa mahali pengine ulimwenguni). Jumuiya ya Wamishonari ya Kanisa la Anglikana (CMS) ilituma wamishonari kuishi New Zealand. Samuel Marsden wa Jumuiya ya Wamishonari wa Kanisa (Chaplain huko New South Wales) aliongoza katika huduma yake ya kwanza siku ya Krismasi mnamo 1814, huko Oihi Bay katika Bay ya Visiwa. CMS ilianzisha utume wake wa kwanza huko Rangihoua katika Bay ya Visiwa mnamo 1814 na katika muongo mmoja uliofuata shamba na shule katika eneo hilo. Mnamo Juni 1823 Wesleydale, ujumbe wa kwanza wa Wesleyan Methodist huko New Zealand, ulianzishwa huko Kaeo, karibu na Bandari ya Whangaroa. Jean Baptiste Pompallier alifika mnamo 1838 na kuwa Askofu wa kwanza Katoliki huko New Zealand. Na ndugu kadhaa wa Marist, Pompallier alipanga Kanisa Katoliki kote nchini. Mnamo 1892 Jumuiya ya Wamishonari ya Kanisa la New Zealand (NZCMS) iliundwa katika Jumba la Kanisa la Nelson na wamishonari wa kwanza wa New Zealand walitumwa nje ya nchi mara baada ya.

Wakati fulani kati ya 1250 na 1300, Polynesians walikaa katika visiwa ambavyo baadaye viliitwa New Zealand na kuendeleza utamaduni wa kipekee wa Māori. Mnamo 1642, mtaftaji wa Uholanzi Abel Tasman alikua wa kwanza wa Ulaya kuona New Zealand. Mnamo 1840, wawakilishi wa Uingereza na wakuu wa Māori walitia saini Mkataba wa Waitangi, ambao ulitangaza uhuru wa Uingereza juu ya visiwa. Mnamo 1841, New Zealand ikawa koloni ndani ya Dola ya Uingereza na mnamo 1907 ikawa Dominion; Ilipata uhuru kamili wa kisheria mnamo 1947 na mfalme wa Uingereza alibaki mkuu wa nchi. Leo, idadi kubwa ya watu wa New Zealand wa milioni 4.9 ni asili ya Ulaya; Māori asilia ni wachache zaidi, ikifuatiwa na Waasia na Visiwa vya Pasifiki. Kuonyesha hii, tamaduni ya New Zealand inatokana na Māori na walowezi wa mapema wa Uingereza, na kupanuka hivi karibuni kutoka kwa uhamiaji ulioongezeka. Lugha rasmi ni Kiingereza, Māori, na lugha ya ishara ya NZ, na Kiingereza kuwa kubwa sana.
