question_en: When was psychology founded?
pos_context_en: Psychology was a branch of the domain of philosophy until the 1870s, when it developed as an independent scientific discipline in Germany and the United States. Psychology as a self-conscious field of experimental study began in 1879, in Leipzig Germany, when Wilhelm Wundt founded the first laboratory dedicated exclusively to psychological research in Germany. Wundt was also the first person to refer to himself as "a psychologist". Other important early contributors to the field include Hermann Ebbinghaus (a pioneer in the study of memory), William James (the American father of pragmatism), and Ivan Pavlov (who developed the procedures associated with classical conditioning).
neg_context_title_en: Society for the Teaching of Psychology
neg_context_en: The field began to organize under the name "clinical psychology" in 1917 with the founding of the American Association of Clinical Psychology. This only lasted until 1919, after which the American Psychological Association (founded by G. Stanley Hall in 1892) developed a section on Clinical Psychology, which offered certification until 1927. Growth in the field was slow for the next few years when various unconnected psychological organizations came together as the American Association of Applied Psychology in 1930, which would act as the primary forum for psychologists until after World War II when the APA reorganized. In 1945, the APA created what is now called Division 12, its division of clinical psychology, which remains a leading organization in the field. Psychological societies and associations in other English-speaking countries developed similar divisions, including in Britain, Canada, Australia and New Zealand.

In 1893, fourteen years after Wilhelm Wundt founded the first psychology laboratory in the world, a Psychology Laboratory was built in Nassau Hall, the oldest building in the university, under the leadership of J. Mark Baldwin. In 1915, psychology received recognition in the title when the department was renamed Department of Philosophy and Psychology. It was not until 1920, however, that the Department of Psychology was established with Howard Warren as its first chairman. In 1924, Eno Hall was constructed to house the department. The building was named in honor of Henry Eno, the principal donor and research associate in psychology. Warren was also a donor, but he chose to keep his donation anonymous at the time. He commented that it was "the first laboratory in this country, if not in the world, dedicated solely to the teaching and investigation of scientific psychology." According to university president John Hibben, the laboratory was the realization of a dream that Warren had cherished for a long time.

By the second half of the 1800s, the scientific study of psychology was becoming well established in university laboratories. Although there were a few scattered voices calling for an applied psychology, the general field looked down upon this idea and insisted on "pure" science as the only respectable practice. This changed when Lightner Witmer (1867–1956), a past student of Wundt and head of the psychology department at the University of Pennsylvania, agreed to treat a young boy who had trouble with spelling. His successful treatment was soon to lead to Witmer's opening of the first psychological clinic at Penn in 1896, dedicated to helping children with learning disabilities. Ten years later in 1907, Witmer was to found the first journal of this new field, "The Psychological Clinic", where he coined the term "clinical psychology", defined as "the study of individuals, by observation or experimentation, with the intention of promoting change". The field was slow to follow Witmer's example, but by 1914, there were 26 similar clinics in the U.S.

Psychology & Social Critique was founded in 1977 as »Psychology & Society« (German: Psychologie und Gesellschaft) by Siegfied Grubitzsch and Günter Rexilius. Peter Mattes is the only founding member who belongs to the editorial team to this day. The journal was renamed »Psychology & Social Critique« in 1979 to mark its contrast from the book series called »Psychology & Society«. P&G was founded as a critical psychological journal but its authors pursued different paths than the Holzkamp school by consciously refraining from developing an overarching theoretical tradition. As a consequence, P&G refused to be pinned down to a unifying consensus. In contrast to Holzkamp’s Critical Psychology, Marxist social theory has become somewhat less significant in this process. P&G is characterized by key topics rather than a theoretical framework. These topics build the central nodes of critical psychological discussion at P&G. Selected topics (in chronological order) include: psychiatry, psychotherapy, psychosocial practice (1978–80); psychology and politics, psychology during National Socialism (1979/80); aesthetic practices, mass communication and the media (1981); measurements, the industrialized psyche (1982); therapeutic practice, institutional practice, social control (1983/84); women and social (from 1983); identity]], subjectivity]], subject and politics (1987/89); National Socialism, euthanasia, and modernization (1991); postmodern challenges, construction, being oneself (1992/93), subject construction and subjectification (1996ff.), gender, childhood, and adolescence (since 2002), critical-psychoanalytic topics and articles (since 2003), and, again and again, critical-deconstructivist reflections on diverse aspects of life, culture, and institutions. Since the 1990s, the journal has witnessed an increasing influence of poststructuralist and discourse analytic concepts and of French and North-American postmodernist philosophy as well as social constructionism. Psychology & Social Critique has considerably diversified social psychologies in the German speaking countries. The critique of psychology, as exemplified by Psychology & Social Critique, deconstructs power and seeks out possibilities, in and around psychology, to think differently, to entertain discourses of ‘desubjugation’ (Foucault), and to defy the dictates of normal scientific discourse. 
Since the mid 1990s, the journal is being edited by an editorial collective with alternating members. Editorial members came mostly from the German Federal Republic and the West Berlin scene initially and from German and Austrian universities, where they engaged in research and teaching that offered alternatives to the psychological mainstream, since the 1990s. A heavy focus lay on the universities Bielefeld, Oldenburg, GH Wuppertal, Bremen, FU Berlin, and later Munich, Erlangen-Nurnberg, and Vienna. Over the years, Psychology & Social Critique has reconstructed, accompanied, and actively influenced critical intellectual discourse in and around psychology with its core topics. 
Psychology & Social Critique is published as a German speaking journal quarterly (two of the four annual issues usually constitute a double issue). P&G is currently (as of 2014) in its 38th year and will publish its 150th thematic issue in 2014. P&G participates in the Social Science Open Access Repository (SSOAR) and provides of all articles for download. Papers published within the previous two years are not available for open access.

"Social Psychology" was established in 1970 as the "Zeitschrift für Sozialpsychologie" by Hubert Feger, Carl Friedrich Graumann, Klaus Holzkamp, and Martin Irle. Its publishing language was German, and the journal was published by Verlag Hans Huber (Bern, Switzerland). In the second half of the 1980s, the founding editors were successively replaced and terms have since been limited to about four years. In the year 2000, the journal adopted English as a second publishing language, which became the sole publishing language in 2008 when the journal moved to Hogrefe Publishing and its title was changed to "Social Psychology". Previous editors-in-chief include Gerd Bohner (Bielefeld University), Hans-Peter Erb (Helmut Schmidt University), and Christian Unkelbach (University of Cologne). Since spring 2016, Kai Epstude (University of Groningen) is the editor-in chief.

The journal was founded at Columbia University in 1904 as "The Journal of Philosophy, Psychology and Scientific Methods", under the editorship of Professor J. E. Woodbridge and Professor James McKeen Cattell. Wendell T. Bush became co-editor of the journal in 1906 and provided it with its endowment. The inaugural issue announced that the journal was founded with the intent of "covering the whole field of scientific philosophy, psychology, ethics and logic" so that "the relations between philosophy and psychology should remain intimate". In 1921 the name of the journal was shortened to "The Journal of Philosophy."

The STP was founded as Division 2 of APA in 1945. Past presidents include notable key figures in the field of psychology, such as Wilbert J. McKeachie, John Dashiell, Charles Brewer, Ludy T. Benjamin, and Diane Halpern. In its early years, the STP struggled to increase membership and clarify its professional identity and purpose. In 1947, Division 2 had only 184 registered members, lagging behind other divisions. In 1950, the STP created the Teaching of Psychology Newsletter. In 1951, the STP's 6th president Claude E. Buxton surveyed the membership to find out more about the current composition and possible future direction of the STP. Buxton found that the STP membership mainly consisted of educators interested in undergraduate liberal arts education, and lacked graduate-level instructors. Finding that most survey respondents saw a need to continue and improve the STP, Buxton worked on increasing membership, and a proposal requiring membership in another APA division before joining Division 2 was not adopted, as it seemed to subordinate the STP to other APA divisions. By the end of the 1950s, Division 2 had gained greater prestige, and included members of various disciplines in psychology (especially social, experimental, and clinical psychology) from both small and large institutions of higher education. In the early 1960s, Wilbert J. McKeachie gave the Teaching of Psychology newsletter a more polished image. Between 1960 and 1974, the STP saw a marked increase in membership, and the organization increased services to help teachers of psychology, and formulated more rigorous standards in the scholarship of teaching psychology.

The question, "Who Is to Develop Psychology and How?", was of such importance that Ivan Sechenov, a physiologist and doctor by training and a teacher in institutions of higher education, chose it as the title for an essay in 1873. His question was rhetorical, for he was already convinced that physiology was the scientific basis on which to build psychology. The response to Sechenov’s popular essay included one, in 1872–1873, from a liberal professor of law, Konstantin Kavelin. He supported a psychology drawing on ethnographic materials about national character, a program that had existed since 1847, when the ethnographic division of the recently founded Russian Geographical Society circulated a request for information on the people’s way of life, including “intellectual and moral abilities.” This was part of a larger debate about national character, national resources, and national development, in the context of which a prominent linguist, Alexander Potebnja, began, in 1862, to publish studies of the relation between mentality and language.

in January 1884, the philosophers Matvei Troitskii and Iakov Grot founded the Moscow Psychological Society. They wished to discuss philosophical issues, but because anything called “philosophical” could attract official disapproval, they used “psychological” as a euphemism. In 1907, Georgy Chelpanov announced a 3-year course in psychology based on laboratory work and a well-structured teaching seminar. In the following years, Chelpanov traveled in Europe and the United States to see existing institutes; the result was a luxurious four-story building for the Psychological Institute of Moscow with well-equipped laboratories, opening formally on March 23, 1914
question_src: Saikolojia ilianzishwa lini?
pos_context_src: Saikolojia ilikuwa tawi la kikoa cha falsafa hadi miaka ya 1870, wakati ilikua kama nidhamu huru ya kisayansi huko Ujerumani na Merika. Saikolojia kama uwanja wa kujitambua wa uchunguzi wa majaribio ulianza mnamo 1879, huko Leipzig Ujerumani, wakati Wilhelm Wundt alianzisha maabara ya kwanza iliyojitolea katika utafiti wa kisaikolojia nchini Ujerumani. Wundt pia alikuwa mtu wa kwanza kujiita kama "mwanasaikolojia". Wachangiaji wengine muhimu wa mapema kwenye uwanja huo ni pamoja na Hermann Ebbinghaus (painia katika utafiti wa kumbukumbu), William James (baba wa Amerika wa Pragmatism), na Ivan Pavlov (ambaye aliendeleza taratibu zinazohusiana na hali ya classical).
neg_context_title_src: Idara ya Saikolojia ya Chuo Kikuu cha Princeton
neg_context_src: Sehemu ilianza kuandaa chini ya jina "Saikolojia ya Kliniki" mnamo 1917 na kuanzishwa kwa Chama cha Saikolojia ya Kliniki ya Amerika. Hii ilidumu hadi 1919, baada ya hapo Jumuiya ya Saikolojia ya Amerika (iliyoanzishwa na G. Stanley Hall mnamo 1892) iliendeleza sehemu juu ya saikolojia ya kliniki, ambayo ilitoa udhibitisho hadi 1927. Ukuaji katika uwanja ulikuwa mwepesi kwa miaka michache ijayo wakati mashirika ya kisaikolojia ambayo hayakuungana. Mnamo 1945, APA iliunda kile kinachoitwa Idara ya 12, mgawanyiko wake wa Saikolojia ya Kliniki, ambayo inabaki kuwa shirika linaloongoza kwenye uwanja. Jamii za kisaikolojia na vyama katika nchi zingine zinazozungumza Kiingereza ziliendeleza mgawanyiko kama huo, pamoja na Uingereza, Canada, Australia na New Zealand.

Mnamo 1893, miaka kumi na nne baada ya Wilhelm Wundt kuanzisha maabara ya kwanza ya saikolojia ulimwenguni, maabara ya saikolojia ilijengwa huko Nassau Hall, jengo kongwe zaidi katika chuo kikuu, chini ya uongozi wa J. Mark Baldwin. Mnamo 1915, saikolojia ilipokea kutambuliwa katika kichwa wakati Idara ilipewa jina la Idara ya Falsafa na Saikolojia. Haikuwa hadi 1920, hata hivyo, kwamba Idara ya Saikolojia ilianzishwa na Howard Warren kama mwenyekiti wake wa kwanza. Mnamo 1924, Eno Hall ilijengwa ili kuweka idara. Jengo hilo liliitwa kwa heshima ya Henry Eno, wafadhili mkuu na mshirika wa utafiti katika saikolojia. Warren pia alikuwa wafadhili, lakini alichagua kuweka mchango wake bila kujulikana wakati huo. Alitoa maoni kwamba ilikuwa "maabara ya kwanza katika nchi hii, ikiwa sio ulimwenguni, iliyojitolea tu kwa ufundishaji na uchunguzi wa saikolojia ya kisayansi." Kulingana na Rais wa Chuo Kikuu John Hibben, maabara ilikuwa utambuzi wa ndoto ambayo Warren alikuwa amethamini kwa muda mrefu.

Kufikia nusu ya pili ya miaka ya 1800, utafiti wa kisayansi wa saikolojia ulikuwa unaanzishwa vizuri katika maabara ya vyuo vikuu. Ingawa kulikuwa na sauti chache zilizotawanyika zikitaka saikolojia iliyotumika, uwanja wa jumla uliangalia wazo hili na kusisitiza juu ya sayansi "safi" kama shughuli ya heshima tu. Hii ilibadilika wakati Lightner Witmer (1867-1956), mwanafunzi wa zamani wa Wundt na mkuu wa idara ya saikolojia katika Chuo Kikuu cha Pennsylvania, alikubali kutibu kijana mdogo ambaye alikuwa na shida na spelling. Matibabu yake ya mafanikio yalikuwa hivi karibuni kusababisha ufunguzi wa Witmer wa kliniki ya kwanza ya kisaikolojia huko Penn mnamo 1896, iliyojitolea kusaidia watoto wenye ulemavu wa kujifunza. Miaka kumi baadaye mnamo 1907, Witmer alipata jarida la kwanza la uwanja huu mpya, "Kliniki ya Saikolojia", ambapo aliunda neno "Saikolojia ya Kliniki", iliyofafanuliwa kama "Utafiti wa watu binafsi, kwa uchunguzi au majaribio, kwa kusudi la kukuza mabadiliko". Shamba lilikuwa polepole kufuata mfano wa Witmer, lakini kufikia 1914, kulikuwa na kliniki 26 kama hizo huko U.S.

Saikolojia na Uhakiki wa Jamii ilianzishwa mnamo 1977 kama »Saikolojia na Jamii« (Kijerumani: Saikolojia und Gesellschaft) na Siegfied Grubitzsch na Günter Rexilius. Peter Mattes ndiye mwanachama mwanzilishi ambaye ni wa timu ya wahariri hadi leo. Jarida lilipewa jina »Saikolojia na Uhakiki wa Jamii« Mnamo 1979 kuashiria tofauti yake kutoka kwa safu ya kitabu inayoitwa »Saikolojia na Jamii«. P&G ilianzishwa kama jarida muhimu la kisaikolojia lakini waandishi wake walifuata njia tofauti kuliko Shule ya Holzkamp kwa kukataa kwa uangalifu kukuza utamaduni wa kinadharia. Kama matokeo, P&G ilikataa kubomolewa kwa makubaliano ya kuunganisha. Kinyume na saikolojia muhimu ya Holzkamp, ​​nadharia ya kijamii ya Marxist imekuwa chini ya maana katika mchakato huu. P&G ni sifa ya mada muhimu badala ya mfumo wa nadharia. Mada hizi huunda nodi kuu za majadiliano muhimu ya kisaikolojia katika P&G. Mada zilizochaguliwa (kwa mpangilio wa wakati) ni pamoja na: magonjwa ya akili, matibabu ya kisaikolojia, mazoezi ya kisaikolojia (1978-80); Saikolojia na Siasa, Saikolojia wakati wa Ujamaa wa Kitaifa (1979/80); mazoea ya urembo, mawasiliano ya watu wengi na vyombo vya habari (1981); Vipimo, psyche iliyoendelea (1982); Mazoezi ya matibabu, mazoezi ya kitaasisi, udhibiti wa kijamii (1983/84); Wanawake na Jamii (kutoka 1983); kitambulisho]], ujanja]], somo na siasa (1987/89); Ujamaa wa Kitaifa, Euthanasia, na kisasa (1991); Changamoto za postmodern, ujenzi, kuwa wewe mwenyewe (1992/93), ujenzi wa somo na ubadilishaji (1996ff.), Jinsia, utoto, na ujana (tangu 2002), mada muhimu za kisaikolojia na nakala (tangu 2003), na, tena na tena, tafakari muhimu za kuamua juu ya hali tofauti za utamaduni, taasisi, taasisi, taasisi, taasisi. Tangu miaka ya 1990, jarida hilo limeshuhudia ushawishi unaoongezeka wa dhana za uchambuzi wa baada ya ujenzi na mazungumzo na falsafa ya Ufaransa na Amerika ya kaskazini-Amerika na pia ujenzi wa kijamii. Saikolojia na kukosoa kijamii imebadilisha sana saikolojia ya kijamii katika nchi zinazozungumza za Ujerumani. Kukosoa kwa saikolojia, kama ilivyoonyeshwa na saikolojia na kukosoa kijamii, huamua nguvu na kutafuta uwezekano, ndani na karibu na saikolojia, kufikiria tofauti, kuburudisha hotuba za 'desubjugation' (Foucault), na kupuuza maagizo ya hotuba ya kawaida ya kisayansi. Tangu katikati ya miaka ya 1990, jarida hilo linahaririwa na uhariri wa pamoja na washiriki wa kubadilisha. Washiriki wa wahariri walikuja zaidi kutoka Jamhuri ya Shirikisho la Ujerumani na eneo la Magharibi mwa Berlin na kutoka vyuo vikuu vya Ujerumani na Austria, ambapo walijishughulisha na utafiti na mafundisho ambayo yalitoa njia mbadala za utangulizi wa kisaikolojia, tangu miaka ya 1990. Umakini mzito uliowekwa kwenye vyuo vikuu Bielefeld, Oldenburg, GH Wuppertal, Bremen, Fu Berlin, na baadaye Munich, Erlangen-Nurnberg, na Vienna. Kwa miaka mingi, saikolojia na kukosoa kijamii imeunda upya, inaambatana, na imeathiri sana mazungumzo muhimu ya kielimu ndani na karibu na saikolojia na mada yake ya msingi. Saikolojia na kukosoa kijamii huchapishwa kama jarida la kuzungumza la Ujerumani Robo (mbili kati ya maswala manne ya kila mwaka kawaida huwa suala mara mbili). P&G kwa sasa ni (kama ya 2014) katika mwaka wake wa 38 na itachapisha toleo lake la 150 mnamo 2014. P&G inashiriki katika Jalada la Upataji wa Sayansi ya Jamii (SSOAR) na hutoa nakala zote za kupakuliwa. Karatasi zilizochapishwa ndani ya miaka miwili iliyopita hazipatikani kwa ufikiaji wazi.

"Saikolojia ya Jamii" ilianzishwa mnamo 1970 kama "Zeitschrift für Sozialpsychologie" na Hubert Feger, Carl Friedrich Graumann, Klaus Holzkamp, ​​na Martin Irle. Lugha yake ya kuchapisha ilikuwa ya Kijerumani, na jarida hilo lilichapishwa na Verlag Hans Huber (Bern, Uswizi). Katika nusu ya pili ya miaka ya 1980, wahariri wa mwanzilishi walibadilishwa kwa mafanikio na masharti yamekuwa mdogo hadi miaka nne. Mnamo mwaka wa 2000, Jarida lilipitisha Kiingereza kama lugha ya pili ya kuchapisha, ambayo ikawa lugha ya kuchapisha tu mnamo 2008 wakati Jarida lilihamia Hogrefe Publishing na kichwa chake kilibadilishwa kuwa "Saikolojia ya Jamii". Wahariri wa zamani wa wahariri ni pamoja na Gerd Bohner (Chuo Kikuu cha Bielefeld), Hans-Peter Erb (Chuo Kikuu cha Helmut Schmidt), na Christian Unkelbach (Chuo Kikuu cha Cologne). Tangu Spring 2016, Kai Epstude (Chuo Kikuu cha Groningen) ndiye mhariri mkuu.

Jarida hilo lilianzishwa katika Chuo Kikuu cha Columbia mnamo 1904 kama "Jarida la Falsafa, Saikolojia na Njia za Sayansi", chini ya uhariri wa Profesa J. E. Woodbridge na Profesa James McKeen Cattell. Wendell T. Bush alikua mhariri mwenza wa Jarida mnamo 1906 na akaipatia uwezo wake. Suala la uzinduzi lilitangaza kwamba jarida hilo lilianzishwa kwa kusudi la "kufunika uwanja wote wa falsafa ya kisayansi, saikolojia, maadili na mantiki" ili "uhusiano kati ya falsafa na saikolojia unapaswa kubaki karibu". Mnamo 1921 jina la jarida lilifupishwa kwa "Jarida la Falsafa."

STP ilianzishwa kama Idara ya 2 ya APA mnamo 1945. Marais wa zamani ni pamoja na takwimu muhimu katika uwanja wa saikolojia, kama vile Wilbert J. McKeachie, John Dashiell, Charles Brewer, Ludy T. Benjamin, na Diane Halpern. Katika miaka yake ya mapema, STP ilijitahidi kuongeza ushirika na kufafanua kitambulisho chake cha kitaalam na kusudi. Mnamo 1947, Idara ya 2 ilikuwa na washiriki 184 tu waliosajiliwa, wakilala nyuma ya mgawanyiko mwingine. Mnamo 1950, STP iliunda mafundisho ya jarida la saikolojia. Mnamo 1951, Rais wa 6 wa STP, Claude E. Buxton alikagua ushirika ili kujua zaidi juu ya muundo wa sasa na mwelekeo unaowezekana wa STP. Buxton aligundua kuwa ushirika wa STP ulikuwa na waelimishaji wanaovutiwa na elimu ya sanaa ya wahitimu wa kwanza, na walikosa waalimu wa kiwango cha wahitimu. Kugundua kuwa wahojiwa wengi wa uchunguzi waliona hitaji la kuendelea na kuboresha STP, Buxton alifanya kazi katika kuongeza ushirika, na pendekezo linalohitaji ushirika katika mgawanyiko mwingine wa APA kabla ya kujiunga na Idara ya 2 haukupitishwa, kwani ilionekana kuweka chini ya STP kwa mgawanyiko mwingine wa APA. Mwisho wa miaka ya 1950, Idara ya 2 ilikuwa imepata ufahari mkubwa, na ni pamoja na washiriki wa taaluma mbali mbali katika saikolojia (haswa kijamii, majaribio, na saikolojia ya kliniki) kutoka kwa taasisi ndogo na kubwa za elimu ya juu. Mnamo miaka ya 1960, Wilbert J. McKeachie alitoa mafundisho ya jarida la saikolojia picha iliyochafuliwa zaidi. Kati ya 1960 na 1974, STP iliona ongezeko kubwa la wanachama, na shirika liliongezea huduma kusaidia walimu wa saikolojia, na kuunda viwango vikali zaidi katika usomi wa saikolojia ya kufundisha.

Swali, "Ni nani atakayeendeleza saikolojia na vipi?", Ilikuwa ya umuhimu sana kwamba Ivan Sechenov, mtaalam wa figo na daktari kwa mafunzo na mwalimu katika taasisi za elimu ya juu, alichagua kama jina la insha mnamo 1873. Jibu la insha maarufu ya Sechenov ni pamoja na moja, mnamo 1872-1873, kutoka kwa profesa wa sheria, Konstantin Kavelin. Aliunga mkono kuchora saikolojia juu ya vifaa vya ethnographic kuhusu tabia ya kitaifa, mpango ambao ulikuwepo tangu 1847, wakati mgawanyiko wa ethnographic wa Jumuiya ya Jiografia iliyoanzishwa hivi karibuni ilizunguka ombi la habari juu ya njia ya maisha ya watu, pamoja na "uwezo wa kiakili na maadili." Hii ilikuwa sehemu ya mjadala mkubwa juu ya tabia ya kitaifa, rasilimali za kitaifa, na maendeleo ya kitaifa, katika muktadha ambao mtaalam maarufu wa lugha, Alexander Potebnja, alianza, mnamo 1862, kuchapisha masomo ya uhusiano kati ya mawazo na lugha.

Mnamo Januari 1884, wanafalsafa Matvei Troitskii na Iakov Grot walianzisha Jumuiya ya Saikolojia ya Moscow. Walitamani kujadili maswala ya kifalsafa, lakini kwa sababu kitu chochote kinachoitwa "falsafa" kinaweza kuvutia kukataliwa rasmi, walitumia "kisaikolojia" kama euphemism. Mnamo 1907, Georgy Chelpanov alitangaza kozi ya miaka 3 katika saikolojia kulingana na kazi ya maabara na semina iliyoandaliwa vizuri. Katika miaka iliyofuata, Chelpanov alisafiri huko Uropa na Merika kuona taasisi zilizopo; Matokeo yake yalikuwa jengo la kifahari la hadithi nne kwa Taasisi ya Saikolojia ya Moscow na maabara iliyo na vifaa vizuri, kufungua rasmi Machi 23, 1914
report_src: Saikolojia inatambuliwa kuwa ilianzishwa rasmi katika miaka ya 1870 kama nidhamu huru mbali na falsafa, na hasa mnamo 1879 huko Leipzig, Ujerumani, wakati Wilhelm Wundt alipoanzisha maabara ya kwanza ya utafiti wa kisaikolojia, hatua ambayo wengi huihesabu kama kuzaliwa kwa saikolojia ya kisasa ya majaribio [1].

question_en: When did Philip Melanchthon die?
pos_context_en: Philip Melanchthon (born Philipp Schwartzerdt; 16 February 1497 – 19 April 1560) was a German Lutheran reformer, collaborator with Martin Luther, the first systematic theologian of the Protestant Reformation, intellectual leader of the Lutheran Reformation, and an influential designer of educational systems. He stands next to Luther and John Calvin as a reformer, theologian, and molder of Protestantism. After Luther himself, he is the primary founder of Lutheranism.
neg_context_en: On the other hand, Luther wrote of Melanchthon, in the preface to Melanchthon's "Commentary on the Galatians" (1529), "I had to fight with rabble and devils, for which reason my books are very warlike. I am the rough pioneer who must break the road; but Master Philip comes along softly and gently, sows and waters heartily, since God has richly endowed him with gifts." Luther also did justice to Melanchthon's teachings, praising one year before his death in the preface to his own writings Melanchthon's revised "Loci" above them and calling Melanchthon "a divine instrument which has achieved the very best in the department of theology to the great rage of the devil and his scabby tribe." It is remarkable that Luther, who vehemently attacked men like Erasmus and Bucer, when he thought that truth was at stake, never spoke directly against Melanchthon, and even during his melancholy last years conquered his temper.

Both were aware of their mutual position and they thought of it as a divine necessity of their common calling. Melanchthon wrote in 1520, "I would rather die than be separated from Luther", whom he afterward compared to Elijah, and called "the man full of the Holy Ghost". In spite of the strained relations between them in the last years of Luther's life, Melanchthon exclaimed at Luther's death, "Dead is the horseman and chariot of Israel who ruled the church in this last age of the world!"

The composition now known as the "Augsburg Confession" was laid before the Diet of Augsburg in 1530, and would come to be considered perhaps the most significant document of the Protestant Reformation. While the confession was based on Luther's Marburg and Schwabach articles, it was mainly the work of Melanchthon; although it was commonly thought of as a unified statement of doctrine by the two reformers, Luther did not conceal his dissatisfaction with its irenic tone. Indeed, some would criticize Melanchthon's conduct at the Diet as unbecoming of the principle he promoted, implying that faith in the truth of his cause should logically have inspired Melanchthon to a firmer and more dignified posture. Others point out that he had not sought the part of a political leader, suggesting that he seemed to lack the requisite energy and decision for such a role and may simply have been a lackluster judge of human nature.

But all his caution and reservation did not hinder his opponents from continually working against him, accusing him of synergism and Zwinglianism. At the Colloquy of Worms in 1557 which he attended only reluctantly, the adherents of Flacius and the Saxon theologians tried to avenge themselves by thoroughly humiliating Melanchthon, in agreement with the malicious desire of the Roman Catholics to condemn all heretics, especially those who had departed from the Augsburg Confession, before the beginning of the conference. As this was directed against Melanchthon himself, he protested, so that his opponents left, greatly to the satisfaction of the Roman Catholics who now broke off the colloquy, throwing all blame upon the Protestants. The Reformation in the sixteenth century did not experience a greater insult, as Friedrich Nietzsche says. Nevertheless, Melanchthon persevered in his efforts for the peace of the church, suggesting a synod of the Evangelical party and drawing up for the same purpose the Frankfurt Recess, which he defended later against the attacks of his enemies.

The only care that occupied him until his last moment was the desolate condition of the church. He strengthened himself in almost uninterrupted prayer, and in listening to passages of Scripture. Especially significant did the words seem to him, "His own received him not; but as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God." When Caspar Peucer, his son-in-law, asked him if he wanted anything, he replied, "Nothing but heaven." His body was buried beside Luther's in the Schloßkirche in Wittenberg.

Philipp was only eleven when in 1508 both his grandfather (17 October) and father (27 October) died within eleven days. He and a brother were brought to Pforzheim to live with his maternal grandmother, Elizabeth Reuter, sister of Reuchlin.

Melanchthon himself perceived his faults in the course of time and repented of them, perhaps having to suffer more than was just in the displeasure of his friends and the hatred of his enemies. From now on until his death he was full of trouble and suffering. After Luther's death he became the "theological leader of the German Reformation", not indisputably, however; for the Gnesio-Lutherans with Matthias Flacius at their head accused him and his followers of heresy and apostasy. Melanchthon bore all accusations with patience, dignity, and self-control.

The last eventful and sorrowful period of his life began with controversies over the Interims and the Adiaphora (1547). It is true, Melanchthon rejected the Augsburg Interim, which the emperor tried to force upon the defeated Protestants; but in the high pressure negotiations concerning the so-called Leipzig Interim he made controversial concessions that would long be debated. In agreeing to various Roman usages, Melanchthon started from the opinion that they are adiaphora if nothing is changed in the pure doctrine and the sacraments which Jesus instituted, but he disregarded the position that concessions made under such circumstances have to be regarded as a denial of Evangelical convictions.

Melanchthon then settled into the comparative quiet of his academic and literary labours. His most important theological work of this period was the "Commentarii in Epistolam Pauli ad Romanos" (Wittenberg, 1532), noteworthy for introducing the idea that "to be justified" means "to be accounted just", whereas the Apology had placed side by side the meanings of "to be made just" and "to be accounted just". Melanchthon's increasing fame gave occasion for several honourable calls to Tübingen (September 1534), to France, and to England, but consideration of the elector caused him to refuse them.
question_src: Philip Melanchthon alikufa lini?
pos_context_src: Philip Melanchthon (mzaliwa wa Philipp Schwartzerdt; 16 Februari 1497 - 19 Aprili 1560) alikuwa mgeuzi wa Kilutheri wa Ujerumani, mshirika na Martin Luther, mwanatheolojia wa kwanza wa mageuzi ya Waprotestanti, kiongozi wa akili wa Matengenezo ya Kilutheri, na mbuni wa mifumo ya elimu. Yeye anasimama karibu na Luther na John Calvin kama mrekebishaji, mwanatheolojia, na mjumbe wa Uprotestanti. Baada ya Luther mwenyewe, yeye ndiye mwanzilishi wa msingi wa Kilutheri.
neg_context_src: Kwa upande mwingine, Luther aliandika juu ya Melanchthon, katika utangulizi wa Melanchthon "Maoni juu ya Wagalatia" (1529), "Ilinibidi nipigane na Rabble na Devils, kwa sababu hiyo vitabu vyangu ni kama vita sana. Mimi ndiye painia mbaya ambaye lazima avunje barabara; lakini Master Philip anakuja kwa upole na kwa upole, Maji ya Matamu, Tangu Mataifa. Luther pia alifanya haki kwa mafundisho ya Melanchthon, akisifu mwaka mmoja kabla ya kifo chake katika utangulizi kwa maandishi yake mwenyewe Melanchthon alirekebishwa "loci" juu yao na kumwita Melanchthon "chombo cha Mungu ambacho kimepata bora zaidi katika Idara ya Theolojia kwa ukali mkubwa wa Ibilisi na kabila lake la Scabby." Inashangaza kwamba Luther, ambaye alishambulia kwa nguvu wanaume kama Erasmus na Bucer, wakati alifikiria kwamba ukweli ulikuwa hatarini, hakuwahi kuongea moja kwa moja dhidi ya Melanchthon, na hata wakati wa melanini yake miaka iliyopita alikasirika.

Wote walikuwa wanajua msimamo wao wa pande zote na walifikiria kama hitaji la kimungu la wito wao wa kawaida. Melanchthon aliandika mnamo 1520, "Ningependa kufa kuliko kutengwa na Luther", ambaye baadaye alilinganisha na Eliya, na akamwita "mtu aliyejaa Roho Mtakatifu". Licha ya uhusiano kati yao katika miaka ya mwisho ya maisha ya Luther, Melanchthon alisema juu ya kifo cha Luther, "Dead ni farasi na gari la Israeli ambao walitawala kanisa katika umri huu wa mwisho wa ulimwengu!"

Muundo ambao sasa unajulikana kama "Augsburg Confession" uliwekwa kabla ya lishe ya Augsburg mnamo 1530, na ingezingatiwa labda hati muhimu zaidi ya Matengenezo ya Waprotestanti. Wakati kukiri ilikuwa msingi wa nakala za Luther's Marburg na Schwabach, ilikuwa kazi ya Melanchthon; Ingawa ilifikiriwa kawaida kama taarifa ya umoja ya mafundisho na warekebishaji hao wawili, Luther hakuficha kutoridhika kwake na sauti yake ya irenic. Kwa kweli, wengine wangekosoa mwenendo wa Melanchthon katika lishe kama isiyo ya kawaida ya kanuni aliyoikuza, ikimaanisha kuwa imani katika ukweli wa sababu yake ingekuwa imehimiza Melanchthon kwa mkao thabiti na mwenye hadhi zaidi. Wengine wanasema kwamba alikuwa hajatafuta sehemu ya kiongozi wa kisiasa, na kupendekeza kwamba alionekana kukosa nguvu na uamuzi wa jukumu kama hilo na labda alikuwa mwamuzi wa asili ya mwanadamu.

Lakini tahadhari yake yote na uhifadhi wake haukuzuia wapinzani wake kufanya kazi dhidi yake kila wakati, akimtuhumu kwa Synergism na Zwinglianism. Katika mkutano wa minyoo mnamo 1557 ambayo alihudhuria tu kwa kusita, wafuasi wa Flacius na wanatheolojia wa Saxon walijaribu kulipiza kisasi kwa kumdhalilisha Melanchthon, kwa kukubaliana na hamu mbaya ya Wakatoliki wa Kirumi kuhukumu wazushi wote, haswa wale ambao walikuwa wameondoka kutoka kwa kukiri kwa Augsburg, kabla ya mkutano huo. Kama hii ilielekezwa dhidi ya Melanchthon mwenyewe, alipinga, ili wapinzani wake wakaondoka, kwa kuridhika kwa Wakatoliki wa Kirumi ambao sasa walivunja colloquy, wakitoa lawama zote kwa Waprotestanti. Marekebisho katika karne ya kumi na sita hayakupata tusi kubwa, kama Friedrich Nietzsche anasema. Walakini, Melanchthon alivumilia katika juhudi zake za amani ya kanisa, na kupendekeza sinodi ya chama cha kiinjili na kuchora kwa kusudi moja la mapumziko ya Frankfurt, ambayo alitetea baadaye dhidi ya shambulio la maadui zake.

Utunzaji wa pekee ambao ulimchukua hadi wakati wake wa mwisho ulikuwa hali ya ukiwa ya kanisa. Alijiimarisha katika sala isiyoweza kuingiliwa, na katika kusikiliza vifungu vya maandiko. Maneno hayo ya muhimu sana yalionekana kwake, "Yake hayakumpokea; lakini wengi kama walivyompokea, kwao walimpa nguvu ya kuwa wana wa Mungu." Wakati Caspar Peucer, mkwewe, alipomuuliza ikiwa anataka chochote, akajibu, "Hakuna isipokuwa mbinguni." Mwili wake ulizikwa kando ya Luther huko Schloßkirche huko Wittenberg.

Philipp alikuwa kumi na moja tu wakati mnamo 1508 babu yake wote (17 Oktoba) na baba (Oktoba 27) walikufa ndani ya siku kumi na moja. Yeye na kaka walifikishwa Pforzheim kuishi na bibi yake mama, Elizabeth Reuter, dada ya Reuchlin.

Melanchthon mwenyewe aligundua makosa yake wakati wa muda na akatubu, labda ilibidi ateseke zaidi kuliko ilivyokuwa kwa kutofurahishwa na marafiki wake na chuki ya maadui zake. Kuanzia sasa hadi kifo chake alikuwa amejaa shida na mateso. Baada ya kifo cha Luther alikua "kiongozi wa kitheolojia wa Matengenezo ya Ujerumani", sio bila kutarajia; Kwa Wagiriki-Walutheri na Matthias Flacius kichwani mwao walimshutumu yeye na wafuasi wake kwa uzushi na uasi. Melanchthon alibeba mashtaka yote kwa uvumilivu, hadhi, na kujidhibiti.

Kipindi cha mwisho na cha kusikitisha cha maisha yake kilianza na mabishano juu ya mpito na Adiaphora (1547). Ni kweli, Melanchthon alikataa mpito wa Augsburg, ambao Mfalme alijaribu kulazimisha juu ya Waprotestanti walioshindwa; Lakini katika mazungumzo ya shinikizo kubwa juu ya ile inayoitwa Leipzig ya muda alifanya makubaliano ya ubishani ambayo yangejadiliwa kwa muda mrefu. Kwa kukubaliana na utumiaji mbali mbali wa Kirumi, Melanchthon alianza kutoka kwa maoni kwamba wao ni adiaphora ikiwa hakuna chochote kinachobadilishwa katika mafundisho safi na sakramenti ambazo Yesu alianzisha, lakini hakupuuza msimamo ambao makubaliano yaliyotolewa chini ya hali kama hiyo yanapaswa kuzingatiwa kama kukataliwa kwa imani ya kiinjili.

Melanchthon kisha akaishi katika utulivu wa kulinganisha wa taaluma yake ya kitaaluma na fasihi. Kazi yake ya kitheolojia muhimu zaidi ya kipindi hiki ilikuwa "maoni katika Epistolam Pauli ad Romanos" (Wittenberg, 1532), muhimu kwa kuanzisha wazo kwamba "kuhesabiwa haki" inamaanisha "kuhesabiwa tu", wakati msamaha ulikuwa umeweka kando na maana ya "kufanywa tu" na "kuhesabiwa tu". Umaarufu unaoongezeka wa Melanchthon ulitoa nafasi kwa simu kadhaa za heshima kwa Tübingen (Septemba 1534), kwenda Ufaransa, na kwa England, lakini kuzingatia wateule kulimfanya awakataa.
report_src: Philip Melanchthon alifariki dunia tarehe 19 Aprili 1560, akiwa na umri wa miaka 63 [1].

question_en: What does a project manager do?
pos_context_en: A project manager is a professional in the field of project management. Project managers have the responsibility of the planning, procurement and execution of a project, in any undertaking that has a defined scope, defined start and a defined finish; regardless of industry. Project managers are first point of contact for any issues or discrepancies arising from within the heads of various departments in an organization before the problem escalates to higher authorities. Project management is the responsibility of a project manager. This individual seldom participates directly in the activities that produce the end result, but rather strives to maintain the progress, mutual interaction and tasks of various parties in such a way that reduces the risk of overall failure, maximizes benefits, and minimizes costs.
neg_context_title_en: Corporate and Project Management Research Institute
neg_context_en: According to the view that programs deliver outcomes but projects deliver outputs, program management is concerned with doing the right projects. The program manager has been described as 'playing chess' and keeping the overview in mind, with the pieces to be used or sacrificed being the projects. In contrast, project management is about doing projects right. And also according to this view, successful projects deliver on time, to budget and to specification, whereas successful programs deliver long term improvements to an organization. Improvements are usually identified through benefits. An organization should select the group of programs that most take it towards its strategic aims while remaining within its capacity to deliver the changes. On the other hand, the view that programs are simply large projects or a set of projects allows that a program may need to deliver tangible benefits quickly.

The project architect can also assume the role of the project manager (PM) in a small studio, but typically, the project architect is only responsible for the design management of a building project, assisted by interns and other staff. A project architect is required to be registered as an architect in the state in which they are performing the role. Intern architects may perform the role under the supervision of a registered architect but may not sign or seal legal documents. The project architect may, but does not often, sign contracts, or seal construction documents or payment applications, which are most often legally signed and sealed by a state registered owner or partner of the architectural office. This liability is covered by the firm, and the legal responsibility for any architectural design errors and omissions ultimately falls on the registered architect, the owner or partner in an architectural firm who signs the documents.

A program designer is the person responsible for the overall design of an internet or interactive project. Relying on a broad base of visual, media and computing skills, the program designer shapes the project's look and functionality from initial stages to completed project. Unlike the project manager, who has broad budget and scheduling responsibility, the program designer oversees the artistic and functional direction, and therefore relays plans and specifications to the visual designers, interface designers, developers and project manager in order to construct the program. Similar to an information architect, the program designer does not necessarily dwell in the domain of information per se, but also may venture into instructional design, application design, and the overall design direction of those types of projects.

"We designed the building from the inside out, not the outside in,” said Loretta H. Cockrum, Foram’s founder, chairman and CEO. “We wanted the most efficient office building ever designed, with no wasted space or wasted energy. This is a building of the future more than a building of the present. A lot of love has gone into that building, and a lot of pride."

Old Appleton Bridge is a historic Pratt Truss Iron Bridge located at Old Appleton, Cape Girardeau County and Perry County, Missouri. It was built in 1879, and consists of a wrought iron, pin-connected, Pratt through truss main span, with two pin-connected, three panel Pratt pony-truss approach spans. It rests on limestone block masonry piers. The total length of the bridge is .

In the construction industry, site managers, often referred to as construction managers, site agents or building managers, are responsible for the day-to-day on site running of a construction project. Site managers are required to keep within the timescale and budget of a project, and manage any delays or problems encountered on-site during a construction project. Also involved in the role is the managing of quality control, health and safety checks and the inspection of work carried out. Many site managers will be involved before site activity takes place, and are responsible for managing communications between all parties involved in the on-site development of the project. Site managers are often required to deal with inquiries and communication with the public. Typically a site manager is employed by a construction company, contractor or civil engineering firm but they are often employed by local authorities to oversee the refurbishment of council owned properties.

question_src: Je! Meneja wa Mradi hufanya nini?
pos_context_src: Meneja wa mradi ni mtaalamu katika uwanja wa usimamizi wa mradi. Wasimamizi wa mradi wana jukumu la upangaji, ununuzi na utekelezaji wa mradi, katika ahadi yoyote ambayo ina wigo uliofafanuliwa, kuanza kufafanuliwa na kumaliza kufafanuliwa; bila kujali tasnia. Wasimamizi wa miradi ni hatua ya kwanza ya mawasiliano kwa maswala yoyote au utofauti unaotokana na wakuu wa idara mbali mbali katika shirika kabla ya shida kuongezeka kwa mamlaka ya juu. Usimamizi wa mradi ni jukumu la meneja wa mradi. Mara chache mtu huyu hushiriki moja kwa moja katika shughuli ambazo hutoa matokeo ya mwisho, lakini badala yake inajitahidi kudumisha maendeleo, mwingiliano wa pande zote na majukumu ya vyama mbali mbali kwa njia ambayo hupunguza hatari ya kutofaulu kwa jumla, kuongeza faida, na kupunguza gharama.
neg_context_title_src: Taasisi ya Utafiti wa Usimamizi wa Mradi na Mradi
neg_context_src: Kulingana na maoni kwamba programu hutoa matokeo lakini miradi hutoa matokeo, usimamizi wa programu unahusika na kufanya miradi sahihi. Meneja wa programu ameelezewa kama 'kucheza chess' na kuzingatia muhtasari, na vipande vya kutumiwa au kujitolea kuwa miradi. Kwa kulinganisha, usimamizi wa mradi ni juu ya kufanya miradi sawa. Na pia kulingana na maoni haya, miradi iliyofanikiwa hutoa kwa wakati, kwa bajeti na kwa vipimo, wakati mipango iliyofanikiwa inaleta maboresho ya muda mrefu kwa shirika. Maboresho kawaida hutambuliwa kupitia faida. Shirika linapaswa kuchagua kikundi cha programu ambazo nyingi huchukua kuelekea malengo yake ya kimkakati wakati unabaki ndani ya uwezo wake wa kuleta mabadiliko. Kwa upande mwingine, maoni kwamba programu ni miradi mikubwa tu au seti ya miradi inaruhusu kwamba mpango unaweza kuhitaji kutoa faida zinazoonekana haraka.

Mbunifu wa mradi pia anaweza kuchukua jukumu la Meneja wa Mradi (PM) katika studio ndogo, lakini kawaida, mbunifu wa mradi anawajibika tu kwa usimamizi wa muundo wa mradi wa ujenzi, uliosaidiwa na wanafunzi na wafanyikazi wengine. Mbunifu wa mradi inahitajika kusajiliwa kama mbuni katika jimbo ambalo wanafanya jukumu hilo. Wasanifu wa ndani wanaweza kutekeleza jukumu chini ya usimamizi wa mbuni aliyesajiliwa lakini hawawezi kusaini au kuweka hati za kisheria. Mbunifu wa mradi anaweza, lakini mara nyingi, saini mikataba, au hati za ujenzi wa muhuri au maombi ya malipo, ambayo mara nyingi husainiwa kisheria na kutiwa muhuri na mmiliki aliyesajiliwa au mshirika wa ofisi ya usanifu. Dhima hii inafunikwa na kampuni, na jukumu la kisheria kwa makosa yoyote ya usanifu wa usanifu na kuachwa hatimaye huanguka kwa mbuni aliyesajiliwa, mmiliki au mwenzi katika kampuni ya usanifu ambaye anasaini hati hizo.

Mbuni wa programu ndiye mtu anayehusika na muundo wa jumla wa mtandao au mradi wa maingiliano. Kutegemea msingi mpana wa ustadi wa kuona, media na kompyuta, mbuni wa programu huunda sura ya mradi na utendaji kutoka hatua za mwanzo hadi mradi uliokamilishwa. Tofauti na meneja wa mradi, ambaye ana bajeti pana na jukumu la kupanga, mbuni wa programu husimamia mwelekeo wa kisanii na wa kazi, na kwa hivyo anapeleka mipango na maelezo kwa wabuni wa kuona, wabuni wa kiufundi, watengenezaji na meneja wa mradi ili kujenga mpango. Sawa na mbuni wa habari, mbuni wa programu sio lazima aishi katika kikoa cha habari kwa sekunde, lakini pia anaweza kujipanga katika muundo wa kufundishia, muundo wa maombi, na mwelekeo wa jumla wa muundo wa aina hizo za miradi.

"Tulibuni jengo hilo kutoka ndani, sio nje," alisema Loretta H. Cockrum, mwanzilishi wa Foram, Mwenyekiti na Mkurugenzi Mtendaji. "Tulitaka jengo bora zaidi la ofisi lililowahi kubuniwa, bila nafasi ya kupoteza au nishati ya kupoteza. Hii ni jengo la siku zijazo zaidi ya jengo la sasa. Upendo mwingi umeingia kwenye jengo hilo, na kiburi sana."

Daraja la zamani la Appleton ni daraja la kihistoria la Pratt Truss Iron lililopo Old Appleton, Kata ya Cape Girardeau na Kata ya Perry, Missouri. Ilijengwa mnamo 1879, na ina chuma kilichotengenezwa, kilichounganishwa na pini, Pratt kupitia span kuu ya truss, na njia mbili zilizounganishwa na pini, tatu za Pratt Pony-Truss. Inakaa kwenye piers za uashi wa chokaa. Urefu wa daraja ni.

Katika tasnia ya ujenzi, wasimamizi wa wavuti, ambao mara nyingi hujulikana kama wasimamizi wa ujenzi, mawakala wa tovuti au wasimamizi wa jengo, wanawajibika kwa siku hadi siku kwenye tovuti inayoendesha mradi wa ujenzi. Wasimamizi wa wavuti wanahitajika kuweka ndani ya wakati na bajeti ya mradi, na kusimamia ucheleweshaji wowote au shida zilizokutana kwenye tovuti wakati wa mradi wa ujenzi. Pia inayohusika katika jukumu hilo ni usimamizi wa udhibiti wa ubora, ukaguzi wa afya na usalama na ukaguzi wa kazi uliofanywa. Wasimamizi wengi wa wavuti watahusika kabla ya shughuli za tovuti kufanyika, na wana jukumu la kusimamia mawasiliano kati ya pande zote zinazohusika katika maendeleo ya tovuti ya mradi huo. Wasimamizi wa wavuti mara nyingi wanahitajika kukabiliana na maswali na mawasiliano na umma. Kawaida meneja wa tovuti huajiriwa na kampuni ya ujenzi, kontrakta au kampuni ya uhandisi ya umma lakini mara nyingi huajiriwa na viongozi wa eneo hilo kusimamia ukarabati wa mali inayomilikiwa na baraza.

report_src: Meneja wa Mradi ni mtaalamu anayesimamia mchakato wote wa mradi kwa kuhakikisha upangaji, ununuzi na utekelezaji unatekelezwa ndani ya wigo, muda na malengo yaliyoainishwa [1]. Yeye ndiye kiungo cha kwanza cha mawasiliano kwa masuala yoyote au tofauti kutoka kwa wakuu wa idara mbalimbali kabla ya kupelekwa ngazi ya juu, hivyo huwezesha maamuzi ya haraka na uratibu mzuri [1]. Ingawa mara chache hushiriki moja kwa moja katika uzalishaji wa matokeo, jukumu lake kuu ni kudumisha maendeleo, kuratibu majukumu ya washikadau, kupunguza hatari ya kutofaulu, kuongeza faida na kupunguza gharama za jumla za mradi [1]. Kwa kufanya hivyo, meneja huyu huhakikisha rasilimali zinatumiwa kwa ufanisi na kwamba mradi unakamilika kwa viwango vya ubora vilivyotarajiwa [1].

question_en: What do red-eared firetails primarily eat?
pos_context_en: The red-eared firetail is a seed eating estrildid, discreet and unusually solitary for an Australian grass finch species. This species often remains unobserved in dense vegetation while foraging in the lower storey. Their presence is revealed by distinctive calls and the bird is most frequently seen when perched high on the limb of a tree such as marri. The individuals form mated pairs rather than grouping. Their individual range is an area around one to two hundred metres across and they may join others while feeding where their territories overlap. Earnest defence of sites only occurs close to the nest, so boundaries between pairs may intersect without incident. Fledglings are eventually fought and driven from the nest site.
neg_context_en: The red-eared firetail ("Stagonopleura oculata"), also known as the boorin, is a small finch-like species of bird. It occurs in dense wetland vegetation of coastal to sub-coastal regions in Southwest Australia. Its appearance is considered appealing, with white spots, black barring and vivid crimson marks at the ear and upper tail. Red-eared firetails are usually only glimpsed briefly, if at all, as they move rapidly and discreetly through their habitat. Most observations occur when their soft voice is heard, or in flight when flushed from the dense scrub. Males and females are similar in colouring and bond as lifelong pairs that occupy a territory centred on their roosting and brooding nest site. The species occupy a similar ecological niche to the beautiful firetail "Stagonopleura bella" found in the east of Australia, although unlike other species of the genus they only occasionally group together and are almost never seen in large flocks.

This subspecies eats geckos, house mice, birds, and marsupials, including the Tammar wallaby.
The young of brooding red-eared firetails, "Stagonopleura oculata", were taken from a nest being observed.

Specimens in captivity will eat green leaf matter, supported by an observation of probable feeding on clover leaves in a maintained lawn at Mundaring Reservoir. Captives have also been found to favour seed of "Lepidosperma gladiatum", ripened or not, twisting open the tough casing with a motion of their head. The species is attracted to the seed available in aviaries of parrots, bird feeders in suburban gardens, and managed parkland. It will visit these areas usually singularly or in pairs and sometimes with other bird species.

The red-eared firetail is rare in captivity, being neither recommended nor generally permitted, as they require expertise and a large specialised environment to maintain their secretive habits; however, the observations in avicultural literature have supported and contributed to knowledge of its behaviour. Despite their shyness toward other birds and people, they are known to be less so when venturing out to bird feeders. The species is not easily confused with other birds in its native habitat, excepting perhaps the red-browed finch ("Neochmia temporalis") that has escaped captivity and bred in the region.

The red-eared firetail is regarded as an attractive but difficult bird in aviculture: they are rare and expensive, require permits that are restricted to specific research purposes, and remain mostly hidden in large and elaborate aviaries that simulate their habitat. There is no record of the species being held in an aviary before 1938, Cayley noted that absence from the literature in 1932. The first record of captives was published in the British "Avicultural Magazine". The author, H. V. Highman of Perth, contracted a collector, who travelled two hundred kilometres, to trap and supply him with around twenty five birds. Highman maintained his personal collection of three pairs in a large aviary, measuring six by twenty four by twenty one metres, with living plants and several other bird species, including the beautiful firetail. A single specimen was sent to noted aviculturalist Simon Harvey in South Australia, though it did not survive long after. Highman reports that eight pairs were sent to Germany in 1933.

Observations of the species are usually made when it is disturbed and the individual will fly to a high perch and call briefly before relocating to another part of its territory. The behaviour of the red-eared firetail in captivity is also reported by aviculturalists as mostly secretive and the birds will become anxious in response to strangers. Birds in captivity will tolerate and watch a familiar person and they will eventually resume their movement about the cage. The individuals exhibit a tapping habit when closely observed, using their bill to strike twice or wipe across each branch it lands upon. The species is most active in the early morning, in movement and vocalisation, and curious about any novelty in their aviary. Adults and young use their aviary's roosting nest at night. They are seen bathing themselves in water for extended periods, becoming completely immersed at times.

The first study of the species in the field was by John Gilbert, whose notes were printed verbatim in Gould's handbook (1865) and cited by North (1914) and others; the accuracy of his reports has been verified in subsequent research.
An important source of information on the species resulted from a 1960 study undertaken by Klaus Immelmann at Wungong Gorge, a broad depression around permanent water with dense scrub interspersed with marri, where he observed the red-eared firetail's feeding and breeding habits. Knowledge of their behaviour in the field is also supported by the published observations of specialist breeders.

The red-eared firetail is an endemic species of the south-western corner of Australia. The species is uncommon to scarce within its range, although it may be locally common in undisturbed locations, which is typically heavy forests and dense heaths around gullies, rivers, and swamps. The population density increases toward coastal areas of its range, especially at the south. The distribution range along the southern coast extends past Esperance to the east. From the southern coast the species occurs as far north as Cape Naturaliste, Bridgetown, Lake Muir, the Stirling Range, Gairdner River (Calyerup) and the Ravensthorpe Range, and is present off the coast at Bald and Coffin Islands near the city of Albany., The eastern extent of the population at the Esperance Plains region occurs at Cape Arid National Park, and at offshore outcrops of the Recherche Archipelago, such as Middle and Woody islands. Records are more scarce north of Wungong Brook in the Darling and Stirling ranges, and there is decreasing population density toward inland regions of Fitzgerald River National Park and Ravensthorpe Range. The firetail is rare in the wheat belt and almost non-existent in the Swan Coastal Plain.

Immelmann remarked that the species' ability to negotiate the dense vegetation of its habitat was more adept than that of other Australian grassfinches. They move along branches by pivoting from "side to side in small hops in an arc-like pattern." Downward, the red-eared firetail moves quickly and acrobatically through the thick foliage.
question_src: Je! Firetails nyekundu-eared hula nini?
pos_context_src: Firetail iliyowekwa nyekundu ni mbegu ya kula, busara na isiyo ya kawaida kwa spishi ya nyasi ya Australia. Spishi hii mara nyingi hubaki bila kutunzwa katika mimea mnene wakati wa kutengeneza kwenye duka la chini. Uwepo wao unafunuliwa na simu tofauti na ndege huonekana mara nyingi wakati wa juu juu ya kiungo cha mti kama vile Marri. Watu huunda jozi zilizoandaliwa badala ya kuweka kikundi. Aina yao ya kibinafsi ni eneo karibu na mita moja hadi mia mbili na wanaweza kuungana na wengine wakati wa kulisha ambapo wilaya zao zinaingiliana. Utetezi wa dhati wa tovuti hufanyika tu karibu na kiota, kwa hivyo mipaka kati ya jozi inaweza kuingiliana bila tukio. Fledglings hatimaye hupigwa na kuendeshwa kutoka kwa tovuti ya kiota.
neg_context_src: Firetail-eared nyekundu ("Stagonopleura oculata"), pia inajulikana kama boorin, ni aina ndogo kama ya ndege. Inatokea katika mimea yenye unyevu wa ardhi ya pwani kwa mikoa ndogo ya pwani huko Australia Kusini. Muonekano wake unachukuliwa kuwa wa kupendeza, na matangazo meupe, kuzuia nyeusi na alama za wazi kwenye sikio na mkia wa juu. Firetails nyekundu-eared kawaida huangaziwa kwa ufupi tu, ikiwa kabisa, kwani wanaenda haraka na kwa busara kupitia makazi yao. Uchunguzi mwingi hufanyika wakati sauti yao laini inasikika, au kwa kukimbia wakati imejaa kutoka kwa mnene. Wanaume na wanawake ni sawa katika kuchorea na dhamana kama jozi za maisha ambazo zinachukua eneo linalozingatia tovuti yao ya viota na kufungia. Spishi hiyo inachukua niche sawa ya kiikolojia kwa "Stagonopleura Bella" nzuri inayopatikana mashariki mwa Australia, ingawa tofauti na spishi zingine za jenasi mara kwa mara huweka pamoja na karibu hawajawahi kuonekana kwenye kundi kubwa.

Subspecies hii inakula geckos, panya wa nyumba, ndege, na marsupials, pamoja na Tammar Wallaby.
Vijana wa kuchoma moto nyekundu-eared, "Stagonopleura oculata", walichukuliwa kutoka kwa kiota kilichozingatiwa.

Vielelezo katika utumwa vitakula kitu cha kijani kibichi, kinachoungwa mkono na uchunguzi wa kulisha kwa majani kwenye majani yaliyotunzwa kwenye hifadhi ya Mundaring. Watekaji nyara pia wamepatikana kupendelea mbegu ya "Lepidosperma gladiatum", imeiva au la, ikipotosha kufungua casing ngumu na mwendo wa kichwa chao. Spishi hiyo inavutiwa na mbegu inayopatikana katika ndege za parrots, malisho ya ndege katika bustani za miji, na uwanja uliosimamiwa. Itatembelea maeneo haya kawaida kwa umoja au jozi na wakati mwingine na spishi zingine za ndege.

Firetail-eared nyekundu ni nadra katika uhamishoni, haipendekezi au kwa ujumla inaruhusiwa, kwani zinahitaji utaalam na mazingira makubwa maalum ya kudumisha tabia zao za usiri; Walakini, uchunguzi katika fasihi ya kitamaduni umeunga mkono na kuchangia ufahamu wa tabia yake. Licha ya aibu yao kwa ndege wengine na watu, wanajulikana kuwa chini sana wakati wa kutoka kwa malisho ya ndege. Spishi hiyo haichanganyiki kwa urahisi na ndege wengine katika makazi yake ya asili, isipokuwa labda laini-nyekundu ("Neochmia temporalis") ambayo imetoroka utumwani na kuzaa katika mkoa huo.

Firetail iliyo na nyekundu-nyekundu inachukuliwa kama ndege ya kuvutia lakini ngumu katika kilimo cha kilimo: ni nadra na ghali, zinahitaji vibali ambavyo vimezuiliwa kwa madhumuni maalum ya utafiti, na hubaki siri zaidi katika anga kubwa na zenye kufafanua ambazo huiga makazi yao. Hakuna rekodi ya spishi zilizofanyika katika anga kabla ya 1938, Cayley alibaini kuwa kutokuwepo kwa fasihi mnamo 1932. Rekodi ya kwanza ya mateka ilichapishwa katika "Jarida la Aviltural" la Uingereza. Mwandishi, H. V. Highman wa Perth, alipata mkataba wa ushuru, ambaye alisafiri kilomita mia mbili, kumtega na kumpa ndege karibu ishirini na tano. Highman alidumisha mkusanyiko wake wa kibinafsi wa jozi tatu katika anga kubwa, kupima sita kwa ishirini na nne kwa mita ishirini moja, na mimea hai na spishi zingine kadhaa za ndege, pamoja na firetail nzuri. Kielelezo kimoja kilitumwa kwa mtaalam wa kitamaduni Simon Harvey huko Australia Kusini, ingawa haikuishi muda mrefu baadaye. Highman anaripoti kwamba jozi nane zilitumwa nchini Ujerumani mnamo 1933.

Uchunguzi wa spishi kawaida hufanywa wakati unasumbuliwa na mtu huyo ataruka kwa kiwango cha juu na kupiga simu kwa ufupi kabla ya kuhamia sehemu nyingine ya eneo lake. Tabia ya firetail iliyowekwa nyekundu katika utumwani pia inaripotiwa na wataalam wa kitamaduni kwani wengi wa kisiri na ndege watakuwa na wasiwasi katika kukabiliana na wageni. Ndege walioko uhamishoni watavumilia na kumtazama mtu anayefahamika na mwishowe wataanza harakati zao juu ya ngome. Watu hao huonyesha tabia ya kugonga wakati inazingatiwa kwa karibu, kwa kutumia muswada wao kugoma mara mbili au kuifuta kila tawi linaloanguka. Aina hiyo inafanya kazi asubuhi ya mapema, katika harakati na sauti, na ina hamu ya riwaya yoyote katika anga yao. Watu wazima na vijana hutumia kiota chao cha anga cha usiku. Wanaonekana wakijioga katika maji kwa muda mrefu, na kuzamishwa kabisa wakati mwingine.

Utafiti wa kwanza wa spishi kwenye uwanja huo ulikuwa na John Gilbert, ambaye maelezo yake yalichapishwa kitenzi katika Kitabu cha Gould (1865) na kilichotajwa na North (1914) na wengine; Usahihi wa ripoti zake umethibitishwa katika utafiti uliofuata.
Chanzo muhimu cha habari juu ya spishi hiyo ilitokana na utafiti wa 1960 uliofanywa na Klaus Immelmann huko Wungong Gorge, unyogovu mpana karibu na maji ya kudumu na mnene ulioingizwa na Marri, ambapo aliona tabia ya kulisha moto na kuzaliana. Ujuzi wa tabia zao kwenye uwanja pia unasaidiwa na uchunguzi uliochapishwa wa wafugaji maalum.

Firetail nyekundu-eared ni aina ya mwisho ya kona ya kusini-magharibi ya Australia. Spishi hiyo sio kawaida kuharakisha ndani ya anuwai yake, ingawa inaweza kuwa ya kawaida katika maeneo ambayo hayajasumbuliwa, ambayo kawaida ni misitu nzito na heaths zenye mnene karibu na mito, mito, na mabwawa. Uzani wa idadi ya watu huongezeka kuelekea maeneo ya pwani ya anuwai yake, haswa kusini. Aina ya usambazaji kando ya pwani ya kusini inaenea Esperance ya zamani kuelekea mashariki. Kutoka pwani ya kusini spishi hufanyika kaskazini kama Cape Naturaliste, Bridgetown, Ziwa Muir, Stirling Range, Gairdner River (Calyerup) na Ravensthorpe Range, na iko pwani katika Visiwa vya Bald na Coffen karibu na Jiji la Albany. Archipelago, kama visiwa vya kati na vya miti. Rekodi ni chache zaidi kaskazini mwa Wungong Brook katika safu za kupendeza na za kupendeza, na kuna kupungua kwa idadi ya watu kuelekea maeneo ya ndani ya Hifadhi ya Kitaifa ya Fitzgerald na Ravensthorpe Range. Firetail ni nadra katika ukanda wa ngano na karibu haipo katika tambarare ya pwani ya Swan.

Immelmann alisema kwamba uwezo wa spishi ya kujadili mimea mnene wa makazi yake ulikuwa mzuri zaidi kuliko ile ya nyasi zingine za Australia. Wao husogea kando ya matawi kwa kupiga kutoka "upande hadi upande katika hops ndogo katika muundo kama arc." Kushuka, firetail-nyekundu-nyekundu hutembea haraka na kwa njia ya kawaida kupitia majani mazito.
report_src: Firetail nyekundu-eared hula hasa mbegu; spishi hii imeainishwa kama “mbegu ya kula” katika maelezo yake, ikionyesha kwamba lishe yake kuu inajumuisha mbegu mbalimbali zinazopatikana kwenye vichaka na mimea ya asili ya Australia [1].
