question_en: How large is the Caraga Administrative Region?
pos_context_en: The region has a total land area of , representing 6.3% of the country's total land area and 18.5% of the island of Mindanao. 47.6% of the total land area of the region belongs to the province of Agusan del Sur. Of the total land area, 71.22% is forestland and 28.78% is alienable and disposable land. Major land uses include forestland comprising 31.36% and 23.98% of agricultural and open spaces.
neg_context_en: Caraga, officially known as the Caraga Administrative Region or simply Caraga Region and designated as Region XIII, is an administrative region in the Philippines occupying the northeastern section of the island of Mindanao. The Caraga Region was created through "Republic Act No. 7901" on February 23, 1995. The region comprises five provinces: Agusan del Norte, Agusan del Sur, Surigao del Norte, Surigao del Sur and Dinagat Islands; six cities: Bayugan, Bislig, Butuan, Cabadbaran, Surigao and Tandag; 67 municipalities and 1,311 barangays. Butuan is the regional administrative center.

From 2001 to 2003, Caraga Region consistently maintained its performance vis-à-vis other regions in Mindanao. Caraga posted a 0.9% growth rate compared to the 9.5% growth rate of Region 12 and the 2.6% growth rate of the Autonomous Region for Muslim Mindanao (ARMM). Caraga's growth rate in 2001-2002 and the 2002-2003 period was the same (0.9%). This was much less than the growth of the population. This performance was better however than the region's performance in the 2000-2001 period, where the region's economy declined by 1.4%.

The agriculture, fishery and forestry (AFF) sector is Caraga's banner economic sector, exhibiting an increasing growth trend of 3.8% and 6.8% growth rates in 2001 and 2003 respectively. Despite the decreasing growth trend of the agriculture and fishery subsectors, the sizeable growth rate of the forestry subsector more than compensated for the decrease. The forestry subsector grew by 36.3% in 2003, the highest growth rate for any subsector in the region. It is also important to note that Caraga Region has the highest GVA in the forestry subsector among all regions in the Philippines.

Caraga Region, situated in the northeast section of Mindanao, is between 8 00' to 10 30' N. latitude and 125 15' to 126 30' E. longitude. It is bounded on the north by the Bohol Sea; on the south by the provinces of Davao del Norte, Compostela Valley and Davao Oriental of Region XI; on the west by Bukidnon and Misamis Oriental of Region X; and on the east by the Philippine Sea of the Pacific Ocean.

"Caraga" is said to have originated from the native word "Kalaga" which means "spirit of soul". Hence, the whole "Provincia de Caraga" of AD 1622 was called "region de gente animosa", that is "region of spirited men". Another fictional etymology of the name flows from a local legend as coming from the word "Cagang", a numerous small crabs matting the beach of Caraga, which is also known as "katang" to the native inhabitants. Legend goes that the town was named as such because the first Spanish missionaries who came in the early years of 1600 found numerous small crabs matting the beach.

Caraga Region is located at northeastern part of Mindanao. It has five (5) provinces, namely: Dinagat Province, Surigao del Norte, Surigao del Sur, Agusan del Norte and Agusan del Sur. Caraga Region is now hosting several mining projects producing various mineral commodities particularly but not limited to gold, copper, chrome, nickel, iron and limestone for concrete cement production. This makes the Department of Environment and Natural Resources, Mines and Geosciences Bureau, Regional Office No. 13 with Office located in Surigao City plays important role in the region's economy, job generation, social and environmental enhancement and protection and ensuring government shares through royalties and taxes.

The land area of the province is representing 27.75 percent of the total land area of Caraga Administrative Region and about 5.14 percent and 1.74 percent of the total land area of Mindanao and Philippines, respectively. The province is elongated in shape, extending from the northeastern portion at Carrascal to the southernmost municipality of Lingig. It is approximately in length and at its widest point which runs from Cagwait to San Miguel.

Caraga Region is situated in the Samar – Surigao segment of the Eastern Bicol – Eastern Mindanao ophiolite belt, one of the nine (9) major ophiolite. Ophiolites, particularly the ultramafic member of the assemblage, are of economic significance as they play host to two strategic ferro-alloy metallic commodities namely nickel and chromium. Large tracts of ultramafic terrains are exposed in the province of Surigao del Norte and northern Surigao del Sur, a majority of which are within the Surigao Mineral Reservation (SMR). Minor occurrences can also be found in the western range of Agusan del Norte.

The hospital was expanded and the number of beds increased in 1958 to fifty beds. The hospital continued to grow to seventy-five beds and in 1970 it grew to 100 beds. The current number of beds, 150, was authorized in 1975. In 1993 the hospital was devolved by the Philippine government to the province of Surigao del Norte. On February 11, 1997, the hospital was renamed Caraga Regional Hospital.

The region performed fairly well in terms of regional output contributing 8.01% in 1998, 8.25% in 1999 and 8.29% in 2000 to the Mindanao GRDP. The region contributed 1.44% in 1998, 1.48% in 1999 and 1.50% in 2000, to the Philippine economy. In terms of growth rate, the region accelerated faster and outpaced the other regions in Mindanao from 1998 to 2000, except for the Southern Mindanao Region which posted a 6.06% increase in 1999-2000. Caraga Region recorded a 5.42% increase during the same period.
question_src: Je! Kanda ya utawala ya Caraga ni kubwa kiasi gani?
pos_context_src: Mkoa huo una eneo la jumla la ardhi, linalowakilisha 6.3% ya eneo la ardhi la nchi hiyo na 18.5% ya kisiwa cha Mindanao. 47.6% ya jumla ya eneo la ardhi katika mkoa huo ni wa mkoa wa Agusan del Sur. Kati ya eneo la jumla la ardhi, 71.22% ni msitu na 28.78% ni ardhi inayoweza kutengwa na inayoweza kutolewa. Matumizi makubwa ya ardhi ni pamoja na misitu inayojumuisha 31.36% na 23.98% ya nafasi za kilimo na wazi.
neg_context_title_src: Migodi na Ofisi ya Ofisi ya Geosciences 13 (Ufilipino)
Migodi na Ofisi ya Ofisi ya Geosciences 13 (Ufilipino)
neg_context_src: Caraga, inayojulikana kama mkoa wa utawala wa Caraga au mkoa wa Caraga tu na kuteuliwa kama Mkoa wa XIII, ni mkoa wa kiutawala nchini Ufilipino unaochukua sehemu ya kaskazini mashariki ya kisiwa cha Mindanao. Kanda ya Caraga iliundwa kupitia "Sheria ya Jamhuri Na. 7901" mnamo Februari 23, 1995. Mkoa unajumuisha majimbo matano: Agusan del Norte, Agusan del Sur, Surigao del Norte, Surigao del Sur na Visiwa vya Dinagat; Miji sita: Bayugan, Bislig, Butuan, Cabadbaran, Surigao na Tandag; Manispaa 67 na barangays 1,311. Butuan ndio kituo cha kiutawala cha mkoa.

Kuanzia 2001 hadi 2003, mkoa wa Caraga ulidumisha utendaji wake wa vis-a-vis mikoa mingine huko Mindanao. Caraga aliweka kiwango cha ukuaji wa 0.9% ikilinganishwa na kiwango cha ukuaji wa 9.5% cha mkoa 12 na kiwango cha ukuaji wa asilimia 2.6 wa mkoa wa uhuru wa Mindanao wa Kiislamu (ARMM). Kiwango cha ukuaji wa Caraga mnamo 2001-2002 na kipindi cha 2002-2003 kilikuwa sawa (0.9%). Hii ilikuwa chini sana kuliko ukuaji wa idadi ya watu. Utendaji huu ulikuwa bora zaidi kuliko utendaji wa mkoa katika kipindi cha 2000-2001, ambapo uchumi wa mkoa ulipungua kwa%1.4.

Sekta ya Kilimo, Uvuvi na Misitu (AFF) ni sekta ya uchumi wa Caraga, inayoonyesha kuongezeka kwa kiwango cha ukuaji wa asilimia 3.8 na viwango vya ukuaji wa 6.8% mnamo 2001 na 2003 mtawaliwa. Licha ya kupungua kwa mwenendo wa ukuaji wa kilimo na uvuvi, kiwango cha ukuaji wa ukubwa wa misitu zaidi ya kulipwa kwa kupungua. Kijitabu cha misitu kilikua kwa asilimia 36.3 mnamo 2003, kiwango cha juu cha ukuaji kwa kiboreshaji chochote katika mkoa. Ni muhimu pia kutambua kuwa mkoa wa Caraga una GVA ya juu zaidi katika sehemu ndogo ya misitu kati ya mikoa yote nchini Ufilipino.

Mkoa wa Caraga, ulio katika sehemu ya kaskazini mashariki ya Mindanao, ni kati ya 8 00 'hadi 10 30' N. Latitudo na 125 15 'hadi 126 30' E. longitude. Imefungwa kaskazini na Bahari ya Bohol; Kusini na majimbo ya Davao del Norte, Bonde la Compostela na Davao Mashariki ya Mkoa XI; Magharibi na Bukidnon na Misamis Mashariki ya Mkoa x; na mashariki na Bahari ya Ufilipino ya Bahari ya Pasifiki.

"Caraga" inasemekana ilitoka kwa neno la asili "Kalaga" ambayo inamaanisha "roho ya roho". Kwa hivyo, "Provincia de Caraga" yote ya AD 1622 iliitwa "Mkoa De Gentesa Animosa", ambayo ni "mkoa wa wanaume wenye roho". Etymology nyingine ya hadithi ya jina hutiririka kutoka kwa hadithi ya ndani kama inatoka kwa neno "Cagang", kaa ndogo ndogo zinazozunguka pwani ya Caraga, ambayo pia inajulikana kama "Katang" kwa wenyeji wa asili. Hadithi inakwenda kuwa mji ulipewa jina kama hilo kwa sababu wamishonari wa kwanza wa Uhispania ambao walikuja katika miaka ya mapema ya 1600 walipata kaa ndogo ndogo za pwani.

Kanda ya Caraga iko kaskazini mashariki mwa Mindanao. Inayo majimbo matano (5), ambayo ni: Mkoa wa Dinagat, Surigao del Norte, Surigao del Sur, Agusan del Norte na Agusan del Sur. Kanda ya Caraga sasa inakaribisha miradi kadhaa ya madini inazalisha bidhaa anuwai za madini lakini sio mdogo kwa dhahabu, shaba, chrome, nickel, chuma na chokaa kwa utengenezaji wa saruji. Hii inafanya Idara ya Mazingira na Maliasili, Migodi na Ofisi ya Geosciences, Ofisi ya Mkoa Na. 13 na ofisi iliyoko katika Surigao City inachukua jukumu muhimu katika uchumi wa mkoa, kizazi cha kazi, ukuzaji wa kijamii na mazingira na ulinzi na kuhakikisha hisa za serikali kupitia kifalme na ushuru.

Sehemu ya ardhi ya mkoa huo inawakilisha asilimia 27.75 ya jumla ya eneo la ardhi la mkoa wa utawala wa Caraga na karibu asilimia 5.14 na asilimia 1.74 ya eneo la ardhi la Mindanao na Ufilipino, mtawaliwa. Mkoa umeinuliwa kwa sura, kutoka sehemu ya kaskazini mashariki huko Carrascal hadi manispaa ya kusini ya Lingig. Ni takriban kwa urefu na katika hatua yake pana ambayo inaanzia Cagwait hadi San Miguel.

Kanda ya Caraga iko katika sehemu ya Samar - Surigao ya Bicol ya Mashariki - Mashariki ya Mindanao Ophiolite Belt, moja wapo ya tisa (9) kuu ya Ophiolite. Ophiolites, haswa mwanachama wa Ultramafic wa mkutano huo, ni muhimu sana kiuchumi wanapocheza kwa bidhaa mbili za kimkakati za Ferro-Alloy Metallic ambazo ni Nickel na Chromium. Trakti kubwa za terrains za Ultramafic zinafunuliwa katika mkoa wa Surigao del Norte na kaskazini mwa Surigao del Sur, ambao wengi wako ndani ya Uhifadhi wa Madini wa Surigao (SMR). Matukio madogo pia yanaweza kupatikana katika anuwai ya magharibi ya Agusan del Norte.

Hospitali iliongezwa na idadi ya vitanda iliongezeka mnamo 1958 hadi vitanda hamsini. Hospitali iliendelea kukua hadi vitanda sabini na tano na mnamo 1970 ilikua hadi vitanda 100. Idadi ya sasa ya vitanda, 150, iliidhinishwa mnamo 1975. Mnamo 1993 hospitali hiyo ilibuniwa na serikali ya Ufilipino kwa mkoa wa Surigao del Norte. Mnamo Februari 11, 1997, hospitali ilipewa jina la Hospitali ya Mkoa wa Caraga.

Kanda ilifanya vizuri katika suala la pato la kikanda kuchangia 8.01% mnamo 1998, 8.25% mnamo 1999 na 8.29% mnamo 2000 kwa Mindanao GRDP. Mkoa ulichangia 1.44% mnamo 1998, 1.48% mnamo 1999 na 1.50% mnamo 2000, kwa uchumi wa Ufilipino. Kwa upande wa kiwango cha ukuaji, mkoa uliharakisha haraka na kupita mikoa mingine huko Mindanao kutoka 1998 hadi 2000, isipokuwa kwa mkoa wa Kusini mwa Mindanao ambao uliweka ongezeko la 6.06% mnamo 1999-2000. Kanda ya Caraga ilirekodi ongezeko la 5.42% katika kipindi hicho hicho.
report_src: Kanda ya utawala ya Caraga ina ukubwa wa jumla unaokadiriwa kuwa 6.3% ya eneo lote la ardhi la Ufilipino na huchukua 18.5% ya kisiwa cha Mindanao, hivyo kuifanya iwe mojawapo ya maeneo makubwa zaidi ya kiutawala nchini; kati ya eneo hili, 47.6% liko ndani ya jimbo la Agusan del Sur, huku 71.22% ya jumla ya ardhi ikiwa ni misitu na 28.78% ikiainishwa kama ardhi inayoweza kutengwa au kutolewa [1].

question_en: Where does U.S. Route 17 begin and end?
pos_context_en: U.S. Route 17 or U.S. Highway 17 (abbreviation U.S. 17, US 17, also known as the Coastal Highway) is a north–south United States highway. The highway spans the southeastern United States and is close to the Atlantic Coast for much of its length. The highway's southern terminus is at Punta Gorda, Florida, at an intersection with US 41. Traveling north, US 17 joins up with US 50 in Paris, Virginia, and the northern terminus of US 17 is in downtown Winchester, Virginia. This is also the point at which the portion of US 50 called the Northwestern Turnpike begins.
neg_context_en:
An old alignment of US Route 17 along the Dismal Swamp Canal carries the US Route 17 Business designation north from the Dominion Boulevard intersection to Deep Creek, where US 17 Business crosses the canal on a small drawbridge, before proceeding north to rejoin US Route 17 at Interstate 64 (Exit 296).
US Route 17 Business through Gloucester Courthouse consists of a loop, Main Street, that travels through the historic courthouse district, intersecting State Routes 3 and 14. VA 14 multiplexes with US 17 Business on the northern leg back to US 17. Main Street is likely a former alignment of US Route 17, due to several US 17 shields on it that lack a Business banner.
U.S. Route 17 Business in Saluda branches off of mainline US 17 (Tidewater Trail) to the northeast at Gloucester Road along with a concurrency with Virginia State Route 33. One block after the wye Virginia Secondary Route 618 joins the two routes from the intersection of Lovers Retreat Lane. At the intersection of General Puller Highway VA 33 turns right SSR 618 continues north onto Oakes Landing Road and BUS US 17 turns left. This segment also contains the name "School Street," and runs west until reaching mainline US 17 once again.
U.S. Business Route 17 through the vicinity of Fredericksburg, begins at the intersection of US 17 and Virginia State Route 2 southeast of Fredericksburg, where they both become Tidewater Trail. From there the road passes by Fredericksburg Country Club, Shannon Airport and the Fredericksburg Agricultural Fairgrounds. Within the city limits, Tidewater Trail becomes Dixon Street and crosses under the Blue and Gray Parkway interchange, then curves right before splitting onto southbound Princess Anne Street and northbound Caroline Street. Both streets cross under the Fredericksburg (VRE station), where US BUS 1 joins US BUS 17 along the same parallel one-way streets, until they reach Herndon Street and become a two-way street again at Princess Anne Street. US Bus 1 & 17 continues to run northwest until they reach US 1 where US BUS 1 terminates, but US BUS 17 joins and cross the Rappahannock River, and enters Falmouth. US BUS 17 leaves US 1 at the west end of Virginia State Route 218 where it runs northwest onto Warrenton Road before finally terminating at the north end of the I-95/US 17 multiplex at Exit 133-B.
U.S. Business Route 17 in Warrenton, Virginia is also multiplexed with U.S. Business Route 15 and U.S. Business Route 29, at least at the southern end. After James Madison Highway becomes Shirley Avenue, US Bus 15 leaves this concurrency at Falmouth Street. U.S. Route 211 joins the two Business routes as US BUS Route 211 runs east along Waterloo Street and US 211-BUS 17/29 become Broadview Avenue. As the triplex curves right, and intersects Roebling Street, it becomes Lee Highway, and US Bus 17 makes a left turn onto Broadview Avenue, a name it will keep until the intersection of Foxcroft Road and becomes James Madison Highway before terminating at the interchange with mainline US Route 17.
U.S. Business Route 17 through the vicinity of Marshall, Virginia runs northeast from Exit 27 on Interstate 66, partially along Virginia State Route 55 (Free State Road, West Main Street), then turns southeast onto Winchester Road as it reunites with US 17 at Exit 28 on I-66.

Route 17 officially begins about west of its interchange with Interstate 91 (at Exit 8). Route 80 begins at the interchange and continues eastward while Route 17 turns northward. Route 17 is a 4-lane principal arterial road, becoming 2 lanes as it passes through North Haven, Northford (where it briefly overlaps with Route 22), and Durham. In Middletown it becomes a 4-lane freeway for leading to an interchange with the Route 9 freeway. Route 17 duplexes with Route 9 for about on a surface road from Exit 13 to Exit 16, where Route 17 exits and shortly thereafter begins a concurrency with Route 66 as it crosses the Connecticut River from Middletown into Portland. on the Arrigoni Bridge. Just after the bridge, it spawns a alternate, Route 17A, which leads to the center of town. Routes 17 and 66 become a 4 lane principal arterial for the rest of the concurrency, where Route 17 turns north and becomes a secondary 2-lane arterial. After meeting the northern end of Route 17A, it enters Glastonbury, passing through the South Glastonbury Historic District and gradually becoming more suburban. The last of Route 17 is a freeway, which ultimately merges into Route 2 West at Exit 7.

Maryland Route 17 (MD 17) is a state highway in the U.S. state of Maryland. The state highway begins at the Virginia state line at the Potomac River in Brunswick, where the highway continues south as Virginia State Route 287 (SR 287). MD 17 runs north from the Brunswick Bridge to the Frederick–Washington county line near Wolfsville. The state highway serves as the main north–south highway of the Middletown Valley of western Frederick County. MD 17 connects Brunswick and Wolfsville with Rosemont, Burkittsville, Middletown, and Myersville. The state highway also connects those communities with the valley's main east–west highways, which include U.S. Route 340, US 40 Alternate, Interstate 70 (I-70), and US 40.

State Route 17 (SR 17) is a state highway serving the Columbia Plateau in the central region of the U.S. state of Washington. The highway travels through mostly rural areas of Franklin. Adams, Grant, Douglas, and Okanogan counties and is designated as part of the National Highway System between Mesa and Moses Lake and as the Coulee Corridor Scenic Byway between Othello and Coulee City for passing through the Grand Coulee. SR 17 begins in Mesa at an interchange with U.S. Route 395 (US 395) and travels north and intersects SR 26 near Othello before entering Moses Lake, where the highway intersects Interstate 90 (I-90) and travels as a partial expressway. SR 17 continues north, intersecting SR 28 in Soap Lake, through the Grand Coulee to a short concurrency with US 2 west of Coulee City. The highway turns northwest and crosses the Columbia River on the Columbia River Bridge at Bridgeport before ending at US 97 in Brewster at the southwestern edge of the Colville Indian Reservation.

SH 17 is officially split into two parts by a stretch of concurrence with U.S. Highway 285. The first part of the route begins in the south at the New Mexico state line where the road becomes New Mexico State Road 17. From the state line the road proceeds in a winding, generally easterly path over the San Juan Mountains via Cumbres Pass and La Manga Pass, both over in elevation. Along this section, the road offers access to Rio Grande National Forest and the many recreational activities it offers. After leaving the national forest, the road continues east for approximately 13 more miles before merging with US 285 at Antonito. From Antonito, SH 17 runs northward concurrent with US 285 for just over thirty miles to the city of Alamosa. At Alamosa, the second part of SH 17 begins after the road splits from US 285. From there, the road proceeds northward up the middle of the San Luis Valley between the Sangre de Christo Mountains in the east and the San Juan Mountains to the west. The route passes through the towns of Mosca, Hooper (where the road meets the eastern end of State Highway 112) and Moffat before reaching its northern terminus where it again meets US 285 roughly five miles south of Villa Grove.

US 17 continues north through Gloucester Point, which is home to the Virginia Institute of Marine Science. At the north end of the suburban community, the U.S. Highway meets the western end of SR 216 (Guinea Road). US 17 continues through a suburban area to Gloucester Courthouse, which is directly served by US 17 Business (Main Street). At US 17's northern intersection with the business route, the U.S. Highway becomes concurrent with SR 14 north to Adner, where the state highway heads west as Adner Road. At Glenns, the highway has an intersection with SR 198 (Glenns Road) and SR 33 (Lewis Puller Memorial Highway). US 17 and SR 33 head north together and cross the Dragon Swamp, which becomes the Piankatank River, into Middlesex County and assume the name Tidewater Trail. The two highways diverge at Saluda, into which SR 33 and US 17 Business head north as Gloucester Road. US 17 collects the other end of the business route (School Street) on the west side of Saluda.

U.S. Route 17 Bypass (US 17 By-Pass) was established in 2009 and is long. Beginning at the US 13/US 17 split, located southeast of Windsor, US 17 Bypass follows the preexisting expressway grade of US 13. At exit 215, US 13 splits and continues north, while US 17 Bypass continues on freeway grade highway till it re-merges with US 17, near mile marker 221.

From its southern terminus with SR 1 in Santa Cruz, Route 17 begins as a five-lane freeway (narrows to four lanes after Pasatiempo Drive). From there, it proceeds through Scotts Valley. At the north end of Scotts Valley, it becomes a four-lane divided highway, with access at various points without interchanges, and begins a winding ascent of the Santa Cruz Mountains. The road crosses the Santa Clara/Santa Cruz county line through the Patchen Pass, commonly referred to as "The Summit", at an elevation of 1,800 feet (549 m), where there is an interchange with SR 35. Just north of the summit, a winding descent of the mountains begins, again with access at various points, mostly without grade separations, as far as Los Gatos. At Los Gatos, Route 17 becomes a freeway again. It expands to six lanes after an interchange with SR 85. This interchange has three levels; it is unusual in that the top level (CA 17) is at-grade, with the other levels below-grade. The number of lanes later expands to eight shortly before reaching its northern terminus at Interstate 280, where it continues as Interstate 880.

The route begins at an intersection with US 64 and U.S. Route 84 in New Mexico south of Chama. The road then heads north into central Chama along Terrace Avenue. NM 17 then exits Chama and heads northeastward, passing through a wooded area in northern Rio Arriba County. The road then reaches the Colorado state line, where it becomes Colorado State Highway 17, heading north.
question_src: Njia ya 17 ya Merika inaanza wapi na kuishia?
pos_context_src: Njia ya U.S. 17 au Barabara kuu ya U.S. (Maelezo ya U.S. 17, US 17, pia inajulikana kama Barabara kuu ya Pwani) ni barabara kuu ya Amerika ya Kaskazini. Barabara kuu inaangazia Amerika ya kusini mashariki na iko karibu na Pwani ya Atlantiki kwa urefu wake mwingi. Kituo cha kusini mwa barabara kuu kiko Punta Gorda, Florida, kwenye makutano na Amerika 41. Kusafiri Kaskazini, Amerika 17 inajiunga na Amerika 50 huko Paris, Virginia, na terminus ya Amerika ya 17 iko katikati mwa jiji la Winchester, Virginia. Hii pia ni hatua ambayo sehemu ya sisi 50 inayoitwa Northwestern Turnpike huanza.
neg_context_title_src: Njia maalum za Njia ya U.S. 17
Barabara kuu ya Jimbo la Colorado 17
Njia maalum za Njia ya U.S. 17
neg_context_src: Marekebisho ya zamani ya Njia ya Amerika ya 17 kando ya Mfereji wa Swamp wa Dismal hubeba Uteuzi wa Biashara wa Njia ya Amerika ya Kaskazini kutoka kwa makutano ya Dominion Boulevard kwenda Deep Creek, ambapo biashara ya Amerika 17 inavuka mfereji kwenye droo ndogo, kabla ya kuendelea kaskazini kuungana tena na Njia ya Amerika ya 17 huko Interstate 64 (exit 296). Biashara ya Njia 17 ya Amerika kupitia Gloucester Courthouse ina kitanzi, Barabara kuu, ambayo inasafiri kupitia wilaya ya kihistoria ya kihistoria, ikiingiliana njia za serikali 3 na 14. VA 14 inazidisha na biashara ya Amerika 17 kwenye mguu wa kaskazini kurudi Amerika 17. Barabara kuu ni uwezekano wa upatanishi wa Amerika ya 17, kwa sababu ya Shields kadhaa za Amerika 17 juu ya kuwa na marufuku ya biashara. Biashara ya Njia ya 17 ya U.S. katika matawi ya Saluda mbali ya Mainline US 17 (Trail ya Tidewater) kaskazini mashariki mwa Gloucester Road pamoja na makubaliano na Jimbo la Virginia Njia ya 33. Sehemu moja baada ya Njia ya Sekondari ya Wye Virginia 618 kujiunga na njia mbili kutoka kwa makutano ya wapenzi wa kurudi nyuma. Katika makutano ya Barabara kuu ya Puller VA 33 inageuka kulia SSR 618 inaendelea kaskazini kuelekea Oakes Landing Road na basi za Amerika 17 zamu kushoto. Sehemu hii pia ina jina "Mtaa wa Shule," na inaendesha magharibi hadi kufikia mainline US 17 tena. Njia ya Biashara ya Merika 17 kupitia maeneo ya karibu na Fredericksburg, huanza kwenye makutano ya Amerika 17 na Jimbo la Virginia Route 2 kusini mashariki mwa Fredericksburg, ambapo wote wawili wanakuwa Trail ya Tidewater. Kutoka hapo barabara inapita na Fredericksburg Country Club, Uwanja wa Ndege wa Shannon na Fredericksburg Fairgrounds. Ndani ya mipaka ya jiji, Trail ya Tidewater inakuwa Dixon Street na inavuka chini ya njia ya bluu na kijivu Parkway, kisha inaendelea kabla ya kugawanyika kuelekea kusini mwa barabara ya Anne Street na Mtaa wa Northbound Caroline. Mitaa yote miwili inavuka chini ya Fredericksburg (kituo cha VRE), ambapo basi 1 ya Amerika inajiunga na basi 17 kando ya barabara zile zile za njia moja, hadi watakapofika Herndon Street na kuwa barabara ya njia mbili tena katika Princess Anne Street. Basi la Amerika 1 & 17 linaendelea Kuendesha kaskazini magharibi hadi watakapofika sisi 1 ambapo basi la Amerika 1 linaisha, lakini basi la Amerika 17 linajiunga na kuvuka Mto wa Rappahannock, na kuingia Falmouth. Basi la Amerika 17 linatuacha 1 mwisho wa magharibi wa Jimbo la Virginia 218 ambapo inaendesha kaskazini magharibi kuelekea Barabara ya Warrenton kabla ya kumaliza mwisho wa kaskazini wa I-95/US 17 Multiplex huko Exit 133-B. Njia ya Biashara ya Merika 17 huko Warrenton, Virginia pia inazidishwa na Njia ya Biashara ya U.S. na Njia ya Biashara ya U.S. 29, angalau mwisho wa kusini. Baada ya barabara kuu ya James Madison kuwa Shirley Avenue, basi la Amerika 15 linaacha makubaliano haya katika Mtaa wa Falmouth. Njia ya U.S. 211 inajiunga na njia mbili za biashara kama njia ya basi ya Amerika 211 inaendesha mashariki kando na Mtaa wa Waterloo na Amerika-211-bus 17/29 kuwa Broadview Avenue. Kama njia ya tatu inazunguka kulia, na inaingiliana na barabara ya Roebling, inakuwa Lee Highway, na US Basi 17 hufanya zamu ya kushoto kuelekea Broadview Avenue, jina litaweka hadi makutano ya barabara ya Foxcroft na kuwa James Madison Highway kabla ya kumalizia kwa njia ya marsh. 55 (Barabara ya Jimbo la Bure, West Main Street), kisha inageuka kusini mashariki mwa barabara ya Winchester wakati inaungana tena na Amerika 17 huko Exit 28 kwenye I-66.

Njia ya 17 inaanza rasmi karibu magharibi ya kubadilishana kwake na Interstate 91 (saa 8). Njia ya 80 huanza kwa kubadilishana na inaendelea mashariki wakati Njia ya 17 inageuka kaskazini. Njia ya 17 ni barabara kuu ya barabara kuu ya 4, na kuwa vichochoro 2 kadiri inavyopita North Haven, Northford (ambapo inaingiliana kwa kifupi na Njia 22), na Durham. Huko Middletown inakuwa barabara kuu ya njia 4 ya kusababisha kubadilishana na Njia ya 9 ya Barabara. Njia ya 17 Duplexes na Njia ya 9 kwa karibu kwenye barabara ya uso kutoka Kutoka 13 kwenda Kutoka 16, ambapo Njia ya 17 inatoka na muda mfupi baadaye huanza makubaliano na Njia ya 66 wakati inavuka Mto wa Connecticut kutoka Middletown kuingia Portland. Kwenye Daraja la Arrigoni. Mara tu baada ya daraja, husababisha mbadala, Njia ya 17A, ambayo inaongoza katikati ya mji. Njia za 17 na 66 zinakuwa njia kuu ya njia kuu ya njia yote ya concurrency, ambapo Njia ya 17 inageuka kaskazini na kuwa sekondari 2-mstari wa nyuma. Baada ya kukutana na mwisho wa kaskazini wa Njia ya 17A, inaingia Glastonbury, ikipitia Wilaya ya Kihistoria ya Glastonbury Kusini na polepole ikawa kitongoji zaidi. Ya mwisho ya Njia ya 17 ni barabara ya bure, ambayo hatimaye inajumuisha katika Njia ya 2 Magharibi kwa Kutoka 7.

Njia ya Maryland 17 (MD 17) ni barabara kuu ya serikali katika jimbo la Merika la Maryland. Barabara kuu ya serikali huanza katika mstari wa Jimbo la Virginia kwenye Mto wa Potomac huko Brunswick, ambapo barabara kuu inaendelea kusini kama Jimbo la Virginia Route 287 (SR 287). MD 17 inaendesha kaskazini kutoka Bridge ya Brunswick hadi mstari wa Kaunti ya Frederick -Washington karibu na Wolfsville. Barabara kuu ya serikali inafanya kazi kama barabara kuu ya kaskazini -kusini ya bonde la Middletown la kaunti ya Frederick Magharibi. MD 17 inaunganisha Brunswick na Wolfsville na Rosemont, Burkittsville, Middletown, na Myersville. Barabara kuu ya serikali pia inaunganisha jamii hizo na barabara kuu za mashariki mwa bonde, ambazo ni pamoja na Njia ya U.S. 340, US 40 Alternate, Interstate 70 (I-70), na US 40.

Njia ya Jimbo 17 (SR 17) ni barabara kuu ya serikali inayohudumia Plateau ya Columbia katika mkoa wa kati wa jimbo la Merika la Washington. Barabara kuu inasafiri kupitia maeneo mengi ya vijijini ya Franklin. Adams, Grant, Douglas, na kaunti za Okanogan na imeteuliwa kama sehemu ya mfumo wa kitaifa wa barabara kuu kati ya Mesa na Moses Lake na kama Coulee Corridor Scenic Byway kati ya Othello na Coulee City kwa kupita Grand Coulee. SR 17 huanza huko Mesa kwa kubadilishana na U.S. Route 395 (US 395) na kusafiri kaskazini na kuingiliana SR 26 karibu na Othello kabla ya kuingia Ziwa la Moses, ambapo barabara kuu inaingiliana na 90 (I-90) na inasafiri kama njia ya sehemu. SR 17 inaendelea kaskazini, ikiingiliana SR 28 katika Ziwa la Sabuni, kupitia Grand Coulee kwa makubaliano mafupi na Amerika 2 magharibi mwa Coulee City. Barabara kuu inageuka kaskazini magharibi na kuvuka Mto wa Colombia kwenye Daraja la Mto wa Columbia huko Bridgeport kabla ya kuishia Amerika 97 huko Brewster katika ukingo wa kusini magharibi mwa Colville Indian Reservation.

SH 17 imegawanywa rasmi katika sehemu mbili kwa kushikamana na Barabara kuu ya U.S. Pamoja na sehemu hii, barabara inapeana ufikiaji wa Msitu wa Kitaifa wa Rio Grande na shughuli nyingi za burudani zinazotoa. Baada ya kuacha msitu wa kitaifa, barabara inaendelea mashariki kwa takriban maili 13 zaidi kabla ya kuunganishwa na Amerika 285 huko Antonito. Kutoka kwa Antonito, SH 17 anaendesha kaskazini kaskazini wakati huo na Amerika 285 kwa zaidi ya maili thelathini hadi mji wa Alamosa. Huko Alamosa, sehemu ya pili ya SH 17 huanza baada ya barabara kugawanyika kutoka Amerika 285. Kutoka hapo, barabara inaendelea kaskazini kuelekea katikati ya bonde la San Luis kati ya Milima ya Sangre de Christo mashariki na Milima ya San Juan kuelekea magharibi. Njia hiyo inapita katika miji ya Mosca, Hooper (ambapo barabara inakutana na mwisho wa mashariki wa Barabara kuu ya Jimbo 112) na Moffat kabla ya kufikia terminus yake ya kaskazini ambapo tena hukutana nasi 285 takriban maili tano kusini mwa Villa Grove.

Amerika 17 inaendelea kaskazini kupitia Gloucester Point, ambayo ni nyumbani kwa Taasisi ya Virginia ya Sayansi ya Majini. Mwisho wa kaskazini wa jamii ya miji, Barabara kuu ya Merika hukutana na mwisho wa magharibi wa SR 216 (Barabara ya Guinea). Amerika 17 inaendelea kupitia eneo la kitongoji hadi Gloucester Courthouse, ambayo inahudumiwa moja kwa moja na Biashara ya Amerika 17 (Barabara kuu). Katika makutano ya kaskazini ya Amerika na njia ya biashara, barabara kuu ya Merika inakuwa sawa na SR 14 Kaskazini hadi Adner, ambapo barabara kuu ya serikali inaelekea magharibi kama Adner Road. Huko Glenns, barabara kuu ina makutano na SR 198 (Glenns Road) na SR 33 (Lewis Puller Memorial Barabara kuu). Amerika 17 na SR 33 huelekea kaskazini pamoja na kuvuka Swamp ya Joka, ambayo inakuwa Mto wa Piankatank, ndani ya Middlesex County na kudhani jina la Tidewater Trail. Barabara mbili zinajitenga huko Saluda, ambazo SR 33 na Amerika 17 zinaongoza kaskazini kama barabara ya Gloucester. Amerika 17 inakusanya mwisho mwingine wa njia ya biashara (barabara ya shule) upande wa magharibi wa Saluda.

Njia ya U.S. 17 Bypass (US 17 By-Pass) ilianzishwa mnamo 2009 na ni ndefu. Kuanzia Amerika 13/Amerika 17 Split, iliyoko kusini mashariki mwa Windsor, Amerika 17 Bypass ifuatavyo daraja la Expressway la US 13. Katika Kutoka 215, Amerika 13 inaendelea na inaendelea kaskazini, wakati njia 17 za Amerika zinaendelea kwenye barabara kuu ya daraja la Freeway hadi itakapobadilika tena na Amerika 17, karibu na Mile Marker 221.

Kutoka kwa terminus yake ya kusini na SR 1 huko Santa Cruz, Njia ya 17 huanza kama barabara kuu ya barabara tano (nyembamba hadi vichochoro vinne baada ya Pasatiempo Drive). Kutoka hapo, inaendelea kupitia Bonde la Scotts. Mwisho wa kaskazini wa Bonde la Scotts, inakuwa barabara kuu iliyogawanywa na njia nne, na ufikiaji katika sehemu mbali mbali bila kubadilishana, na huanza kupaa kwa Milima ya Santa Cruz. Barabara inavuka mstari wa Kaunti ya Santa Clara/Santa Cruz kupitia Patchen Pass, inayojulikana kama "mkutano wa kilele", katika mwinuko wa futi 1,800 (549 m), ambapo kuna kubadilishana na SR 35. Kaskazini mwa mkutano huo, asili ya vilima vya milima huanza, tena na ufikiaji wa kiwango cha chini, kwa mbali, kama vile hatua za kupunguka, kama vile mbali. Huko Los Gatos, Njia ya 17 inakuwa barabara ya bure tena. Inakua kwa vichochoro sita baada ya kubadilishana na SR 85. Maingiliano haya yana viwango vitatu; Ni kawaida kwa kuwa kiwango cha juu (ca 17) kiko kiwango, na viwango vingine chini ya daraja. Idadi ya vichochoro baadaye inakua hadi nane muda mfupi kabla ya kufikia kituo chake cha kaskazini huko Interstate 280, ambapo inaendelea kama Interstate 880.

Njia hiyo huanza kwenye makutano na Amerika ya 64 na Njia ya U.S. 84 huko New Mexico kusini mwa Chama. Barabara kisha inaelekea kaskazini katikati mwa Chama kando ya Terrace Avenue. NM 17 basi anatoka Chama na anaelekea kaskazini mashariki, akipitia eneo lenye miti katika kaskazini mwa Rio Arriba County. Barabara basi inafikia mstari wa Jimbo la Colorado, ambapo inakuwa Barabara kuu ya Jimbo la Colorado 17, ikielekea kaskazini.
report_src: Njia ya Merika 17 (US 17) huanza katika mji wa Punta Gorda, Florida, kwenye makutano na Barabara Kuu ya U.S. 41, na huendelea kaskazini hadi inapomalizikia katikati ya jiji la Winchester, Virginia, ambako inaungana na U.S. 50 [1].
all_claims: Njia ya Merika 17 (US 17) huanza katika mji wa Punta Gorda, Florida, kwenye makutano na Barabara Kuu ya U.S.
41, na huendelea kaskazini hadi inapomalizikia katikati ya jiji la Winchester, Virginia, ambako inaungana na U.S.
